www.movingimage.com

title: Senior Cloud Service Developer - Engaging >100k users everyday at Hilti Asia IT Services (Petaling Jaya, Malaysia)
description:
You will be part of a team of solution architects, software engineers, designers and business counterparts, which are located all over the world. In this highly challenging and motivating environment, we provide you the opportunity to design sustainable architectures, lead junior developers to achieve outstanding results and to take over responsibilities for crucial parts of the Hilti Cloud.



  • Drive functional and technical design of RESTful web services for the Hilti Cloud

  • Develop Cloud Applications and Web Services on Java and/or .net with agile methods

  • Support the international (US, Europe and Asia) roll-out of Corporate Cloud Services

  • Collaboration & consultancy within a global IT team regarding concept design and implementation in line with the Business and IT strategy

  • Ensure reliable operations of the Hilti Cloud Services together with our partners

title: Team Lead Operations (DevOps) (m/f) at InterNations (München, Germany)
description:
Our Operations Team is responsible for both the external, customer-oriented systems as well as for the internal IT infrastructure. As the Team Lead for Operations at InterNations your role will encompass leading the Operations Team and organizing its workflows and processes.


As the Team Lead of Operations at InterNations, you will:



  • play a large role in shaping the system architecture and ensure the high stability and scalability of our internal and customer-oriented systems

  • be responsible for the monitoring and operation of our infrastructure, systems, and services (incl. Nginx, MySQL, PHP, RabbitMQ, Solr)

  • guarantee the smooth operation of our internal IT together with your Help Desk Team

  • gladly pass along your know-how and experience to your team and act as a liaison between your team and other departments


You meet the following requirements:



  • a degree in IT or other relevant technical training with at least 5 years of work experience

  • experience with Linux (Debian) and MySQL administration

  • knowledge of the automation of deployments (CI/CD) and configuration management (e.g. Ansible/Puppet/Chef)

  • experience with networks, firewalls, web server administration, virtualization, load balancing, monitoring, high availability solutions and scripting (e.g. bash, PHP, Ruby)

  • ability to work under pressure, pragmatic, communicative, and have experience leading a team

  • very good German and English skills


We offer:



  • a fast-growing, dynamic company with international scope

  • a friendly work atmosphere and the space you need to pursue your own ideas

  • weekly team breakfasts, fresh fruit & regular team events

  • a central location in a wonderful cosmopolitan city with beautiful natural surroundings


Are you the right one for the job?


Then send us your application today (CV, cover letter, start date, salary expectation) c/o Lars Strojny to:


jobs@internations.org

title: Backend Developer at MobiLab Solutions GmbH (Köln, Deutschland)
description:
As a Java backend developer at MobiLab you will help us push forward our Master Data Management and Mobile Payment efforts.

Room for Growth


You'll have a chance to leave your imprint on the following:



  • design and implement REST APIs for our services (e.g. Spring MVC, Spring Data);

  • integrate with 3rd party services and ensure their reliability (e.g Hystrix);

  • work with the appropriate persistence layer for the project (e.g. SQL and / or Cassandra);

  • continuously optimise the applications for performance (e.g. Graphite / Grafana metrics);

  • work with the latest of scaling technologies (e.g. Docker and Kubernetes).

title: Front-End Developer at Helloprint (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Helloprint: the most attractive work environment of the Netherlands


Tired of busy offices, where marketing and customer service frequently interrupt you during complex programming? Working with cheap hardware and an OS which does not suit you, while the HR department imposes difficult procedures and salary scales which do not take your teams and your individual performance into account? Working for a manager who doesn’t know the difference between Java and JavaScript? Tired of all the bullshit management, unnecessary rules and lack of courage and creativity?



At Helloprint we can imagine that. Our board is formed by guys and girls like you! Therefore, we dare to say that the work environment we provide, is quite simply the most attractive in the Netherlands: 



  • The most amazing office location: at the heart of Rotterdam, in the middle of the Witte de With street (next to Blender). Bad for your health, great for the atmosphere;

  • Flexible working hours (between 07:00 am and 21:00 pm)

  • High-end laptop and/or desktop with OS of your choice and 2 monitors.


Work hard, play hard


Ok, that sounds cool. But print? Isn’t that a boring business? Well, not at Helloprint. You may know us from our label ‘Drukzo’. With a young and highly motivated team Helloprint develops innovative business models at lightning speed, renewing the market continuously. You might think print is a boring business in an ancient culture, but at Helloprint it is anything but. Meet the most ambitious start-up of the Netherlands:



  • We currently have about 150 colleagues and grow by 10 to 15 employees each month;

  • Our tech team is large and diverse enough to learn from each other, but small enough to have a serious impact on results and outcomes;

  • The average age of our team is 29 years;

  • We are the fastest growing e-commerce business in the Benelux countries;

  • An international environment which allows you to grow at rapid pace. With offices in Rotterdam and Valencia and very soon in France;

  • Fast career growth: individual development plans, fast routes-to-success, Zend Certification and conferences such as Laracon and PHPcon;

  • The possibility to grow incredibly fast in our organization and make it to our board. Seriously, our whole board is formed by guys like you;

  • Freedom, responsibility and creativity. At Helloprint, you decide how you fulfill your job yourself. We are quite different in this compared to other companies, to be frank, because we truly belief in responsibility;

  • We offer good salaries and great bonus schemes which can exceed 35 % of you yearly salary. We love to share when we have success and hard work and success will pay off;

  • We pride ourselves for our parties and work trips. ‘Work hard, play hard’ is our motto.\


Invent, develop and challenge!


Invent, develop and challenge the market, that's your job. As a software engineer you are fully responsible and informed of all business flows within the Helloprint platform. You know all the ins and outs of the supporting processes. You’ll build new cool elements and consider it a sport to get them live. You know what to do in case of escalation and provide guidance to internal and external customers.


Interested?


Up for it? Spread your wings and apply now! We'd love to hear why you want to work for Helloprint and why you think you are suitable for this position. Obviously, we are happy to receive your CV. We like to see that you have taken the trouble to delve into our company. Show us why you're the one software developer that we seek. Be smart and convince us flaming. That is, after all, your passion.

title: Team Lead Software Engineer at Rasan Information Technology (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
description:
Team Lead software engineers at Tameeni designs the architecture and implementation of our software projects. They are the centerpiece where Tameeni innovation and creativity become a feasible reality. It is because we have talented and capable lead software engineers, we can at Tameeni dream big and dare to challenge business obstacles and competitors.


As a team lead in Tameeni, you are expected to play a leadership role in energizing, guiding, and motivating fellow software engineers. Team leads assign development tasks to our development team members and oversee the development process. Since we rely on offshore development alongside onsite team, it is essential for the team lead software engineer to play a leadership and coordination role between various development teams and align team members’ efforts.


Besides writing code part of the time, team leads are responsible for the quality of the code developed as well as maintaining our internal development standards and conventions which we derive closely from common software development standards and conventions.


Team Leads are required to create detailed software development plans and assign tasks to team members. They are also responsible for providing implementation time estimates and scoping of the development target. This will be an ongoing effort between team leads and project managers to ensure that projects and milestones are delivered to the expectation of business needs both in terms of time and functionality.


Team leads also ensure the optimization of developed applications and their underlying systems. They are responsible for the performance and reliability of the applications.

title: Senior Front-End Developer / Angular JS (F/M) at Drooms GmbH (Frankfurt am Main, Deutschland)
description:
We are looking for a Senior Front-End Developer (f/m) who has deep knowledge and hands-on experience. Beyond the required technical ability, we are looking for an individual with a “just do it” attitude, a passion for building awesome stuff and a love of disrupting industries.

What you'll be doing



  • Developing and building client-side applications that tap into our core services

  • Work closely with designers and back end engineers to develop user interfaces with modern web technologies that can be tested and scaled easily

  • Showing high level of technical excellence that will drive new ideas and deliver outstanding (and well-tested) code

title: Software Engineer Java at CINTEO GmbH (Stuttgart, Germany)
description:
To expand our development teams in Stuttgart we look for professionals in Java! You feel addressed? Then Apply now to become a part of CINTEO!


Your profile



  • With your profound knowledge in Java as well as your knowledge in handling the spring framework and web services you develop demanding omni-channel E-Commerce solutions for big companies based on enterprise E-Commerce platforms.

  • With the help of highly performant equipment and current open source frameworks you work with latest methods (e.g. Scrum, TDD) and create complex web applications in Java in your development team.

  • In the conceptualization of solutions and the creation of software- and system architecture, you benefit from your analytical strength as well as your knowledge about design patterns .

  • In your previous career, you already acquired knowledge in handling databases and persistent systems – preferably you have already gained experience in the areas HTML, CSS, JavaScript and JS-frameworks.

  • Your team orientation, personal initiative and your sense of responsibility are a perfect match for our actively lived corporate values.


We offer you



  • A highly flexible and agile work environment with interdisciplinary teams and projects

  • Working in a innovative role-based organizational form

  • Innovative and disruptive issues in an established industry

  • Working with professionals

  • Modern office space with an Italian coffee machine, daily fresh fruit and free drinks

title: Front-End, Back-End and Full-Stack Developers at EMBL-EBI (Hinxton, UK)
description:
Are you a software developer or engineer looking for an exciting opportunity?


We have a number of vacancies and are looking for talented developers and engineers for opportunities arising now and in the near future. Some examples of the types of positions that arise are:

Front-End Software Engineer with JavaScript skills

Full-Stack Software Developer with expert knowledge of Java and Spring (MVC, Security, Integration)


Back-End Python Developer with experience of working on large-scale data analysis projects

Based on the Wellcome Genome Campus in the Cambridge biotech cluster, we offer outstanding technical infrastructure and a supportive, family-friendly working environment. We are a medium-sized organisation of small collegial teams working together in a vibrant, international environment. The campus offers a free commuter bus service, on-site nursery, and subsidised gym and restaurants.

Our staff are very diverse, from patient, detail-oriented coders to experimental early adopters, and work at the interface of biology and computer science. One quality they all share is a natural ability to collaborate and bring out the best in one another.

Working at EMBL-EBI allows you to explore new ideas and technologies, and to put your energy into solving important problems. You will work collaboratively with scientists and engineers to find solutions for healthcare, agriculture and the environment by maximising the value of life-science research data.

title: Product Design Lead - top meditation app at Insight Timer (Sydney, Australia)
description:
Insight Timer is seeking a Lead Product Designer


Insight Timer is the top rated and most used meditation app on both iOS and Android; with over 1.5 million registered users and 900+ of the world’s top teachers.


We have recently completed a funding round and we need an experienced product designer to reimagine our popular iOS and Android mobile apps, working alongside a visual designer whom has just joined us from Google. 


You will be involved in every aspect of the product development process, from brainstorming innovative ideas to tweaking pixels right before launch. You will utilize your full range of user experience design, user interface design and interaction design skills plus define best practice going forward.

title: Senior Javascript Engineer - Dortmund at Zalando SE (Dortmund, Deutschland)
description:
You Are Setting Standards


Variety. As part of your onboarding, you will get to know some and join one of our teams that matches your interests and skills. As a team, you will build, scale and continuously improve a variety of web applications that redefine the user experience of our customers and partners.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code. You will decide together on the technologies and tools to utilize as well operate large-scale web applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Purpose. You and your team will work truly cross-functional with an entrepreneurial mindset and drive the whole development cycle according to its purpose - from implementation to testing and maintenance.


Mastery. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the scalability, performance and user-centricity of our software. You will add value through innovation by leveraging current trends in software design, frameworks and RESTful web services.

title: TL;DR: Senior Front-End Developer - Impact our Millions of Users at Catawiki (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
As a Senior Front-End Developer for Catawiki you’ll be part of an agile development team of 50+ developers and will mostly be developing parts of the product that are used by our millions of customers. You will interact with our Back-End, UX, Product Management, Data and Marketing teams (plus Catawiki’s users!) as you develop new functionality to: 



  • Bring your own ideas to improve the product with an iterative, small-steps approach through A/B testing.

  • Collaborate with the designers in your team to develop the best user experience for our customers.

  • Work hand to hand with the backend developers in your team to build APIs and improve performance.

  • Work in a modern ES6 environment.

  • Migrate our not-so-modern jQuery application to React

title: (Senior) Java Engineer (f/m) at zooplus AG (München, Germany)
description:
What you will be responsible for



  • developing and continuously delivering applications for one of the most successful e-commerce platforms in Europe to enable our growing and successful business 

  • working in a Scrum environment and taking part in alle parts of the software life cycle from concept thru coding to testing and maintaining

  • get fascinated by discovering and solving the digital challenges of delivering a full e-commerce stack: Customer Experience, Payment, Supply Chain & Finance

  • strive for mastery in a challenging agile environment using state-of-the-art technologies

  • be part of a multinational team located in the Munich city center

  • work autonomously surrounded in a pleasant working environment


We strongly believe that this is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced developer looking for a new challenge. The opportunity to work within the heart of Munich, within the international e-Commerce scene with opportunities arising all the time. Lastly, a great group of colleagues with a genuine passion and interest into what they do, inside and outside of work.

title: Perl Developer at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online hotel reservation service in the world) is looking for Perl Developer who is passionate about their craft, who thrives on challenge and who believes in success through collaboration. Whether it is hardening Perl's hash function or developing efficient serialization libraries, we solve serious problems using Perl.


We offer an international, result-driven, fun, and dynamic environment. If scale and complexity excite you, Booking is the place to B!


B.responsible


Our technical culture derives strongly from our strong ties to the Perl community. We appreciate what open source means both for our business and also for internal projects. Some of our most useful hacks inside the company have come from someone scratching the proverbial itch. We are actively engaged and enjoy the benefits our culture produces such as increased communication between each other and also to our business counterparts.


As a Software Developer, you are responsible for the development, performance, and scaling of our public website as well as internal systems, which includes using: Perl (5.14), DBI, Mason, Moose, Sereal, Plack, nginx, Javascript, MySQL, Memcached, Redis, Hadoop, Elasticsearch, git, and CentOS Linux. You will work independently and will also be responsible for making technical decisions within a team. Our development strategy is agile and we work in small Scrum teams of 5-7. We do several rollouts every day. We are data-driven and do extensive A/B testing.


Even without Perl experience, your colleagues will help you get up to speed in order to be able to start solving real problems from day one.


Important aspects of the job include:



  • Rapidly develop next-generation scalable, flexible, and high-performance systems.

  • Solve issues with the site and internal systems, prioritizing based on customer impact

  • Act as an intermediary for problems, with both technical and non-technical audiences

  • Collaborate with the team, Team Leaders and Product Owners to prioritize projects

title: (Vertica) Database Architect (f/m) at Smaato (Hamburg, Deutschland)
description:
Smaato is looking for an experienced (Vertica) Database Architect to improve the reliability and performance of our rapidly growing, complex and dynamic database environment. This role comes along with the contact to various database technologies such as Aerospike, MongoDB, MySQL, PostgreSQL and Vertica. 


The DBA will work shoulder-to-shoulder with the engineering teams to design, build and operate the next generation of database infrastructure at Smaato. 


Key Responsibilities include but are not limited to



  • Serve as a technical expert for SQL database design, development, and management.

  • Remain accountable for all aspects of database services.

  • Provide administration and management of database, clustering, and replication infrastructure, in development, quality control, stage and production environments.

  • Proactive monitoring of databases from performance and capability management perspectives.

  • Perform database maintenance activities, including optimization, backup and recovery, application updates and patches.

  • Ensure continuity of operations and support database applications as required.

title: Principal Server Engineer - 2017's Biggest Mobile Strategy Game at NaturalMotion games ltd. (London, UK)
description:
We are on the hunt for a world class principal server engineer with expert backend development skills to head up our highly experienced server team running the genre disrupting mobile title, Dawn of Titans.


The NaturalMotion London team have created something truly unique with the Dawn of Titans project and over three years have established one of the most talented teams in the games industry. Our game will bring a console-quality experience to mobile, featuring ground-breaking graphics, an unparalleled collaborative multiplayer environment and an adventure that will retain players for many years to come. In this bold move to position ourselves as a world leader in AAA mobile game development, server infrastructure with undisruptive seamless gameplay becomes the plinth to our success.


Our small but elite team of server engineers hold over seventy years of coding experience across multiple technical industries, offering high performance from day one and allowing you to reach new levels of coding excellence, always pushing the boundaries of server technology.  


What challenges await you?



  • Developing high-performance game logic in a distributed fashion exposed to millions of users.

  • Write robust code that runs on AWS.

  • Maintaining the current code base through its lifecycle over many short development iterations and collaborating with your awesome team to ensure superior quality of code at every step of the journey.

  • Working with our client side games development teams to develop robust extensible systems.

  • Managing the intelligent storage of a huge amount of player and game data.

  • Plan for growth from the infrastructure point of view and solution components accordingly.

  • Improve our games solutions architecture, processes and code base.

  • Operate a live game

  • Keeping the fun - we believe that a team that has fun whilst coding is an essential part of making a fun and engaging experience for our audience.

title: DevOps Engineer at Ocono (Berlin, Germany)
description:
What would you do with 3 million requests per hour? Make history within our industry?


Come and join our professionalists team @Ocono. Come and be part of our daily process of finding ever better solutions to manage high traffic while implementing cutting-edge technologies and ensuring realtime analysis, that drives our business. We wait for your ideas and would love to have you grow with us. Ocono is a vibrant and progressive start-up in the center of Berlin. Our international team is dedicated to bring the right apps to the right people. 


Job Description



  • You will develop RESTful backend services and build stable and elegant web applications.

  • Create redundancy in our systems with clustering, sharding or replication strategies and being responsible for its availability and auto scaling.

  • You will work with real time analysis in a high traffic environment (> 3 million requests / hour).

  • You will be a part of a very agile, short cycle development with continuous integration, in a dynamic start-up environment, where it is always interesting.   

  • You will elaborate technical concepts and integrate your own ideas and visions into the product.

  • You would work in an international team and feel comfortable working in English or German.

title: Full Stack Developers, Your Attention Please! at Jobbatical (Tallinn, Estonia)
description:
Be our web developer extraordinaire, and use your full-stack skills to help us change the world, one jobbatical at a time!


We'd like to tell you this is the best jobbatical in history, but we're a bit biased. Having said that, this is totally the best jobbatical in history. Let us count the ways:



  • The team: A close-knit group of people eager to help you fit in. We love what we're doing, and we also love a good laugh.

  • The role: A fantastic opportunity to build and perfect a platform poised to change the world of work as we know it.

  • The location: Beautiful Tallinn, an innovative and spirited city with an intriguing history and a bright future. You'll never cease to be amazed by the cultural and meteorological quirks of this pint-sized capital.

title: DevOps at iprice group (Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia)
description:
DESCRIPTION



  • Automate the set-up of development, QA and production environments to provide minimum overhead

  • Integrate logging and exception handling of production systems into our ELK monitoring infrastructure

  • Manage and coordinate the release process and pipeline with the development team

  • Actively monitor the performance of the infrastructure to ensure that errors are escalated timely

  • Responsible for creating regular backups and perform disaster recovery in emergency situations

  • Plan the companies infrastructure requirements to maximize performance and minimize the costs

title: Frontend Developer (m/f) at Pepper.com at Pepper Media Holding GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
description:
Your responsibilities would include:



  • Plan components together with designers and backend engineers

  • Implement reusable, solid and fast responsive front-end components

  • Identify and fix performance and maintenance problems

  • Ongoing improvement of our front-end infrastructure

  • Stay up to date with new front-end technologies and best-practices and share them with the team

title: Senior PHP Developer (m/f) at Westwing Home & Living (München, Deutschland)
description: As a senior developer, you will design and develop complex web applications and modules for our eCommerce platform. Furthermore you will optimize our platform for scalability during peak traffic hours. Adhering to agile SW-development methodologies you will also ensure code quality and enforce best practices by communicating and sharing them to team members.

title: Full-stack Developer (Python/Node/Angular) at Conference Compass (Delft, Netherlands)
description:
Conference Compass is looking for a full-stack developer (Python, Node & Angular.js) to join our enthusiastic international team in creating cutting-edge mobile and web apps for events. 


You will participate and take the lead in developing data processing software, backend API’s and innovative user interfaces. You will take an important part in designing powerful software components and your code will be used within our ecosystems of highly customizable and successful mobile apps for events.


Who we are looking for


We are looking for an inspired and creative developer that shares our passion and experience in (either or both) Python and JavaScript. As we aim to succeed together we look for someone who is both communicative and open-minded. We look forward to welcoming an inventive developer, who has a solution-oriented attitude and is driven by the desire to build great products. Our position is ideal for a senior developer, but as we aim to learn together and share knowledge, we also welcome enthusiastic developers with less experience, but a lot of ambition.


In addition to new developments, your position would also provide you the opportunity to work with our sophisticated backend deployment infrastructure and with some of the most exciting current technologies like Node.js, AngularJS, Titanium Mobile, MongoDB and PostgreSQL.


What you will be doing



  • Design clever data processing systems. 

  • Create clean and rapid backend API's. 

  • Implement intuitive user interfaces. 

  • Participate in the development of the next generation of our event app and knowledge platform. 


What we ask from you



  • Good knowledge of (either or both) Python/JavaScript programming language(s). 

  • The capacity to write clean and correct code for data processing. 

  • Great eye for detail and strong sense of responsibility. 

  • Fluency in English and good communication skills. 

  • The ambition to develop well written and designed software. 

  • The aspiration to work with others to solve complex problems. 

  • A strong sense of enthusiasm that makes you come to work with excitement in the morning, and lets you leave with excitement in the afternoon.


What we offer



  • The chance to be part of a meaningful challenge. 

  • Competitive salary and holiday allowance. 

  • Exciting and challenging assignments. 

  • A fun team of A-players from 8 different nationalities. 

  • Flexible work hours. 

  • An inspiring office in the old city centre of Delft.

title: UX Designer at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online accommodation reservation service in the world) is looking for the world’s smartest designers. As a member of our Front End team you’ll be given the freedom to make meaningful and measurable improvements impacting millions of people. You’ll join us at our beautiful Amsterdam HQ and work with some of our industry’s smartest people.


B.responsible


Our guiding principle is that by helping our users we help our business. As a designer in our Front End team you’ll be a key part of the idea generation process, working in a small startup-like group which takes full ownership of their part of our platform. You’ll work with developers, product owners, copywriters and user researchers to conceive, analyse, hand code & test your ideas.


B.creative


‘Designer’ is just what it says on your CV – you’d be just as happy to be labeled an Engineer, or Analyst; a Builder, Hacker or Maker. Because what you really do, what you live for, is solving problems. Your portfolio isn’t a series of beautiful but generic templates – it’s a collection of stories that you can discuss with enthusiasm, and regret … because you’re always getting better at what you do and you’re never satisfied with ‘good enough.’. You’re equally comfortable discussing colour theory, user psychology, or the semantic implications of the DIV tag, you’re a writer of excellent HTML & CSS. You’re excited about the endless potential of the web, and being able to build things that millions of people can use every day.

title: Senior UX Designer at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description: Join the world’s leading accommodation company and help define the future of travel. This position offers the successful candidate broad scope for working on a variety of products within the current and future Booking.com family, based in our headquarters in the centre of Amsterdam.

title: Make User Onboarding Great Again! at Penneo (Søborg, Denmark)
description:
Do you consider yourself to have a solid experience with online user onboarding experience? Are you eager to learn and to contribute? Wanna be part of a fast moving team of highly motivated colleagues living on the edge? Well here is an opportunity for you.


So what’s the job again?


The main part of the job is to ensure that the customers get the best possible experience in the onboarding process. Whatever way possible! We are looking for a person with front-end development skills who can actually execute his/her own ideas. You will be part of the Penneo front-end team and will be expected to share the responsibility of the look and feel of the Penneo application with these guys.


The Right Candidate is...



  • experienced with web development and front-end engineering

  • has worked with user onboarding for a SaaS company before

  • knows the ins and outs of user onboarding

  • has strategies to keep users engaged with a product

  • knows how to maximize product adoption

  • has some tricks up his/her sleeve

  • someone who carries Javascript, CSS and HTML as handy weapons. (Bonus points for ES6, React, Flux, Git)!

  • self-driven, responsible, a team player, and has a great emphasis on quality


We offer you a unique chance to...



  • Work in a fun, bold, cool, dynamic, professional and international work environment

  • Be part of a Danish company with international potential and opportunities

  • Have a direct impact on a great product used by hundreds of companies

  • Get 20 very nice and highly skilled colleagues to help you in your quest

  • Have a seat at our super cool 13th floor penthouse office

  • Eat lunch in our second to none canteen with great food every day (with take-away option at night)

  • Get in shape in the our fitness center with 24-7 access


Who we are


Penneo is a young software company headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark. We help companies sign documents digitally, and we do it well. So well that our customer service guys won’t be able to keep track of the onboarding process of all the new customers manually. And this is where you come in!


Our product is built with a scientifically balanced mix of passion and technologies like React, SCSS, Browserify and Gulp. We strive to have a user-friendly service that makes it faster, easier and secure to sign documents. So now, we just need you to enhance the whole onboarding process so our customers will have an even better experience in the future.



Does this sound like something for you? Get in touch with us today!




Click here to read what a couple of our top tech employees have to say about working at Penneo.

title: Front End Developer at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Booking.com is looking for the world’s best Front End Developers all around the globe! Join us at our beautiful headquarters in Amsterdam and work on planet Earth’s  #1 accommodation website with some of our industry’s smartest people! You’ll be given the freedom to make meaningful and measurable improvements impacting millions of users.


About the Front End team


Our guiding principle is that by helping our users we help our business. As a developer in our Front End team you will be building the user interfaces of the Booking.com website. You'll be a key part of the idea generation process, working in a small startup-like team which takes full ownership of their part of our platform. You'll work side by side with designers, back end developers, product owners, copywriters and user researchers to conceive, analyze, hand code & test your ideas.


About you


You’re excited about the endless potential of the web, and being able to build things that millions of people can use every day. You’re passionate about your craft, have an excellent eye for detail and an absolute commitment to making sure features are well implemented and bug free. Your core responsibility will be in combining your knowledge and expertise with the goals of our business to deliver a world-class user experience to our diverse, loyal user-base. You’ll be comfortable taking a data-led approach to development, since we make all our decisions based on experiments and testing. You will be a passionate advocate for the user and excited about working in an agile, collaborative environment.


Key responsibilities



  • Translate requirements and mockups into fully functioning features using JavaScript and HTML/CSS

  • Continuously look for ways to improve Booking.com and implement A/B tests

  • Take ownership of sections of Booking.com's desktop, tablet and mobile web sites

title: Machine Learning Developer (f/m) at E.S.R. Labs AG (München, Deutschland)
description:
What does your work life look like with us?


As Machine Learning Developer you are responsible for the modeling of several aspects for autonomous driving for autonomous driving, especially in Computer Vision. Furthermore, you implement, optimize and port on embedded platforms and develop new network topologies.

title: Game Engine C++ Developer - Defold at King (Stockholm, Sweden)
description:
We are now looking for a C++ Game Engine Developer with a passion for games, development, quality and new technology to join our Defold team.


We are a team of 20 people consisting of a core engine team, tools team, and a support & services team. Our cross platform game engine team creates a range of new high quality functionality in a maintainable, high-performance fashion. Defold is used by teams within King as well as external game teams.


Who we are


We work in small collaborative teams where everyone are involved in coming up with great features, from design and analysis to implementation. We are problem solvers, constantly reviewing how and why we do things and learning from each other. We are experimental, trying out new tech and innovative ideas and willing to take risks to drive the entire industry forward. We are sociable and fun, and we like to hang out together. We are passionate, some might even say quirky. We love tech and games, and are obsessed with creating the best user experience.


About the Stockholm Studios


Our first studio has been making casual games since 2003. It is the home of Candy Crush Saga, one of the world’s most played game. Since 2015 we have two studios centrally located in one of the world’s most unique and beautiful capital cities, built over 14 islands. You’ll find plenty of urban delights and open spaces within walking, skating and swimming distance – dependent on the time of year, of course.

title: Java Software Architect - $60k at Crossover () (allows remote)
description:
Ready to make $60,000 USD while working from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you. Work through Crossover, and youll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world.


Company Description:

Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing remote contractors. Our platform connects customers to the worlds best talent for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we dont just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.


Job Description:

Youll be given responsibility for the whole process of a key technology platform. You will facilitate the platform as it supplies source, build, and test services. We expect for you to utilize your extensive experience to continually improve and redefine the developed software. You will consistently ensure quality and productivity by implementing automation wherever possible.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Java) at M800 Limited (Hong Kong)
description:
• Design and implement server side communications systems

  • Prepare technical documentation on server side applications and system design

  • Maintain and enhance existing components

  • Perform ad-hoc assignments as requested

title: Lead Dev Engineer - Continuous Integration and Delivery at ING (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
As a Dev engineer you will develop and maintain applications within the complex and dynamic world of BCD (Bank-wide Customer Domain) within Wholesale Banking Services. Imagine a system where 75 Java applications, consisting of 500+ reusable components, across multiple domains and multiple countries, work together in one ecosystem.


As a Dev engineer, you will deliver business value across the entire application chain together with your team. You will need to understand the full stack and contribute to all activities on your backlog. You are able to move all stories from To Do to Done.



Way of Work


We work Scrum/Agile in small teams with sprints of 2 weeks. The exact role within a project will vary, but the focus will be on:



  • Refining;

  • Designing;

  • Quality Assurance;

  • Aftercare.


As you can imagine, certainly given the size of ING Bank across the world, the work is on large and interesting projects with an international character. The applications that we  develop are implemented worldwide, therefore cultural sensitivity is required. The selection will not just be based on technology, it also matters to us what the person brings to the team and to ING. The right person in the right place benefits us both.



Requirements



  • Java developer who can:

  • Grow into tooling expert on continuous integration, delivery and reliability/resilience

  • Describe and draw the current architecture, implement technical improvements and design the road for the future

  • Not afraid of coding, giving guidance to juniors and to discuss choices/options with stakeholders

  • Exhibit knowledge on front and backend java technologies

  • Play the role of scrum master

  • Exhibit good working knowledge of version control systems; upgrading and automation is therefore required



The Tooling team


Before the existence of Maven, we started automating the development environment with ANT and unit tests. We integrated this into our working environment (RAD and currently Eclipse) and we can now create workspaces and build releases easily. Over the years this homegrown system has become stable but the long term task is to move towards ING’s standard continuous delivery pipeline. This is our highest priority for this year. Possibility for innovation (e.g. move to Java 8) comes from this team. Your initiatives are welcome.



Skills required


We use state-of-the-art tooling and work with the latest Java-based systems.



  • University Graduate (Bachelor’s or Master’s) degree;

  • At least 5 years of software engineering experience in large organizations.

  • You are able to efficiently develop and maintain code in a complex environment.

  • Advanced knowledge of Java 7/8, REST APIs, JSON, Oracle.

  • Advanced knowledge of Java development techniques, Jenkins, Eclipse Plugins, Git, Maven and Gradle.

  • Knowledge of persistency frameworks (e.g. Hibernate, MyBatis), knowledge of MVC-models (e.g. Struts or Spring).

  • Inside knowledge on Websphere or Tomcat would be an advantage.

  • Knowledge of JavaScript/Dojo would be handy.

  • Good knowledge of infrastructure & middleware (e.g. Linux, web- and application-servers, databases) would be handy;

  • Familiarity with tools like Confluence, JIRA, Eclipse, Crucible, Fortify, SVN/Git, Jenkins, Maven, Gradle, etc;

  • Experience with Agile/Scrum and Dev-Ops;

  • Awareness of security needs in a large financial institution

  • Excellent social skills, good communicator, creative, likes to learn and experiment;

  • Strong analytical skills, willing to learn, willing to share knowledge with others;

  • Proactive, perseverant and value a multi-cultural work environment;

  • Proficient in English;

  • Ability to occasionally travel

  • Passionate about technology

title: Frontend Developer (m/f) - Munich, Germany at Westwing Group GmbH (München, Deutschland)
description:
The Westwing mission is to inspire and make every home a beautiful home. We are on a quest to bring the wonders of eCommerce for home & living to our more than 26 million members in 14 countries on three continents. In less than 5 years on the market, we have grown to more than 219 million Euros in annual sales, and the opportunity ahead of us is massive.


The Westwing team is the secret to our success. Our more than 1,500 team members balance creativity and style with innovative technology and strong business fundamentals. We are proud to be working with inspiring colleagues who are smart, fun, ambitious, and looking for the challenge to transform an industry and take it into the future.


Do you think this could be you? To pursue our ambitious expansion strategy, we are looking for an awesome Frontend Developer (m/f). As Frontend Developer, you will be responsible for turning our websites into a beautiful and unique shopping experience for our customers.

title: Full Stack Ruby on Rails Developer at Nanameue Inc. (Minato, Japan)
description:
You will be a part of our growing web services team, report directly to our CTO and CEO and this is what you will be doing:



  • Develop API backend and Web Application using Ruby on Rails + (PostgreSQL and MySQL)

  • Build and develop frontend part from a designer finished Sketch or PSD file using HTML/CSS and ReactJS

  • Develop and maintain test specs using Rspec and related frontend tests

  • Support and debugging web applications as needed

  • Optimize and profiling web applications using NewRelic and related tools

  • Ignite and present a better solution to solve a problem to CTO/CEO

  • Having fun and share your knowledges and visions with Junior developers

title: Backend Software Engineer at IRESS (Sydney, Australia)
description:
IRESS is seeking a Backend Software Engineer to join our growing team responsible for building our award-winning financial planning product – XPLAN. It’s been rated the number one financial planning software for the ninth consecutive year, being used by the majority of the Australian Financial Planning market with over 25,000 clients in Australia and New Zealand alone.


IRESS is a principal global supplier of share market and wealth management systems producing innovative, sophisticated solutions. We provide solutions that help with life’s big decisions – from getting a mortgage approval, planning for retirement, to trading on the stock exchange – things that make a real difference to people’s lives and financial well-being.


As a Backend Software Engineer in our Feature Team, you’ll be playing a vital role in building new functionality across the entire development lifecycle from inception, design, and deployment. You’ll be part of a collaborative; AGILE team passionate about developing high performance, scalable web applications.


Being part of our Sydney office, as a Backend Software Engineer, you’ll have the chance to develop your skills across our entire stack which includes Python, Javascript, CSS3, React, Angular 2, Backbone and HTML5.  As we continue to grow, you’ll have the opportunity to make an impact on different projects while developing your technical or leadership skills.


We're passionate about improvement as we introduce continuous integration and continuous delivery best practices into our engineering environment.  You'll work alongside talented Engineers who are passionate about keeping up to date with the latest trends and tools while having access to formal training opportunities at IRESS.


We’re recruiting for multiple roles and are open to candidates at all levels from Junior to Senior. This includes Full Stack Engineers as well as Backend Engineers. We’re open to applicants both locally and overseas and can provide sponsorship for suitable candidates.


This is a fantastic chance to join an established, innovative, high growth Fintech that has doubled in size in the last five years while entering new and exciting markets.


About You


Required



  • Similar experience as a Software Engineer, Developer, Programmer, etc

  • Experience with at least one of the following - Python, C++, PHP, Java or Ruby

  • Strong understanding of web standards and architecture

  • Knowledge of relational databases and SQL

  • Knowledge of multi-tiered object-oriented application development

  • Experience in the cycle of software development, and agile methodologies

  • Ability to structure test code efficiently and write robust test cases


Desired



  • Exceptional Python and front-end development skills using modern HTML 5, CSS 3 and JS

  • Experience with xUnit testing frameworks and selenium testing


Culture and Perks


We recognize and reward hard work and celebrate our successes over a Friday afternoon drink and at various socials throughout the year. We don't sweat the small stuff either; our dress code is as relaxed as we are. As well as local charity events and initiatives, we hold global days and activities to make the most of our global strength and diversity. This includes a yearly global hackathon!


Perks include subsidized healthcare insurance, share scheme, community events, flexible working opportunities and access to various learning and development programs.


About IRESS


We began in 1993 as a small Australian tech start-up. Now we're a global team of over 1,800 brilliantly-minded people across five continents – and we're still growing. We're listed on the Australian Stock Exchange, with a strong financial track record and our continuous investment in product development and innovation is what keeps us ahead of the game. We may be one of the largest financial software providers, but we haven't forgotten our roots; we've kept the entrepreneurial spirit and agility that defined our early years - it's something we continue to look for and admire in our people.

title: (Senior) Frontend Developer (m/f) at movingimage (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:
movingimage is in a process of fast growth and therefore looking for qualified senior software engineers for its newly formed teams. We are hiring talented engineers with a broad and deep understanding of technology, visionary, yet very pragmatic developers, who can envision and implement next generation software innovations.


You will be working with our multinational team on designing and implementing enterprise software solutions. And there's a lot more to learn about us, for example from our video:


https://e.video-cdn.net/video?video-id=A5ZJB3cguCu-duGx3Hy3Q4&player-id=EKGFrtKUDHbdBELNij71Hk&width=800


Interested?


Then you're in the right place, because we are currently looking for an experienced:


Senior Frontend Developer (m/f)


Would you like to…



  • play an important role in our multinational agile software development team?

  • use new technologies and solve thrilling development tasks?

  • implement high-quality and scalable video asset management and video streaming solutions for enterprise customers?

  • write clean and reusable code with page performance in mind?

  • deliver a rich, engaging and unmatched user experience?

title: DevFactory Technical Product Manager - $100k at Crossover () (allows remote)
description:
DevFactory Technical Product Manager - $100k


Are you in a technical role now and have a vision for how things SHOULD be built but lack the influence to change it?

Some of the best Technical Product Managers come from strong technical leaders who decide to make the jump from implementing a product to defining a product. DevFactory is especially suited for you, as we are a By Developers, for Developers focused company.


Are you a great Technical Product Manager looking for the next big thing?

DevFactory is one of the most exciting companies you could imagine for Technical Product Managers. Hard problems, revolutionary technology, and a great team.


One of the best Technical Product Management jobs. Period.


Here are a just a few reasons why:

  • By Developers for Developers: As a Technical Product Manager, you know software development. Youve very likely have had a significant portion of your career in software development. All those times you thought to yourself I would absolutely have created this tool way better... in this role you can.
    Define products you would love to use.

  • Iteration, Improvement focused culture: We have a culture that not only enables your success, but strives to always think what better looks like. We view this iterative improvement as a necessity not only from an individual perspective, but as a team. You will be an integral part to improving not only products, but how we deliver products.

  • Career Focus: Candidates have a clear career path to increased compensation and responsibility. As your skills and competencies grow, your scope and area of impact will grow as well.

  • Customer Focus: At DevFactory, how our Customers will actually use our product (the use case), is the primary driver behind every specification. We believe that by centralizing the Use Case, we can focus on what makes our products great for our customers, and unique in the marketplace.

  • Learn and Use Disruptive Tech: Every day you hear about how some new company is applying disruptive technology to a stagnant industry. Wouldnt you like to be working for those innovative companies working on those new industry changing approaches? At Devfactory, this is your chance to be a part of that and both learn and apply these disruptive technologies (such as AI, Machine Learning, Big Data analysis, NLP, PaaS Cloud services) from Open Source, AWS, Google, and others.

  • Work/Life Balance: DevFactory is a fully remote company, with every role being a fully remote role. Simply put, DevFactory provides you with a unique work/life flexibility and the opportunity to work with a global team of top performers in their field.




A bit about DevFactory

The DevFactory culture is rooted in a deep appreciation of software and software development combined with an intense desire to use metrics and objective data to make software development better. We are inspired by the industrial manufacturing revolution that happened over 100 years ago. Jobs were loosely defined, not measured, not specialized, not automated, and the result was terrible quality and productivity. Today manufacturing is dominated by scientific measurement, automation, specialization, and well defined processes - making it very high quality and 100x more productive. We see the same opportunity in large scale software development.


We build systems that help make software and software dev teams better. We measure the quality of code, tests, builds, and architectures at a deep level; finding valuable insights not just surface level coding violations. We mine the history of source control systems to help dev teams find their buggiest parts of code, most productive developers, riskiest classes, etc. We build active systems that evaluate code on every commit and help our customers prevent their software quality from slowly eroding and accumulating expensive technical debt.


If making software better and development teams more productive is something you are passionate about, youll be inspired at DevFactory.


DevFactory is actively hiring candidates for this position through the CrossOver marketplace on Crossover.com. Crossover is one of the most legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote, work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.


Responsibilities of the Role

As a Technical Product Manager, your core responsibility is to take the big ideas from Product Management Leadership and figure out how to break it down into meaningful bite-size chunks for Engineering. Were relying on you to take that large complex release, figure out how it should be functionally broken down, and then defining that very clearly for the development team to go implement. Youll be using your deep technical background to identify the key decisions that need to be made (sometimes the hardest part!), finding the best answer to those questions and then defining both how the product will be implemented, and what you want to see to know that it was implemented correctly.


At DevFactory were Agile. We have 1-2 week sprints that focus on a clear milestone of work in the greater release. As a Technical Product Manager, your primary responsibility is to take the large release level ideas and break it into clear Milestone specifications that the development team can actually build. As you will be the owner for the area, you will be ultimately responsible for reviewing what the engineering team has actually built and making the final call on if it meets exactly what you specified or needs additional work.

title: Transferwise is looking for Full Stack Devs with an awesome product mindset! at TransferWise (Tallinn, Estonia)
description:
Full Stack Developer


TransferWise is an international money transfer startup with over 1 million customers worldwide. Co-founded by Skype’s first employee, the innovative platform is backed by Andreessen Horowitz, Sir Richard Branson, and PayPal founder Max Levchin, and led by an experienced team, including Paypal’s former Director of Product and Google Europe’s former Head of Finance. We're disrupting the world of international money transfers with transparency and low fees.


Product engineers only


Here at TransferWise we don’t hire coders, who pick up tickets from a backlog and push code to production without considering value and impact.


We hire engineers that empathise with our customers problems, develop solutions and measure results.  We’re proud of engineering team - it's built an incredible product that’s changing the world.  They operate autonomously within their teams, focussing relentlessly on our customers.


What you’ll be working on:



  • TransferWise is complex under the hood, but we’re just getting started. With our own payment rails, there are lots of opportunities to build new products and services on them.

  • At its core, our stack is Java microservices, using Netflix OSS offerings, and SPAs written in Angular 1/React, with a legacy Grails monolith. We are moving quickly to proven distributed technologies that can be scaled (Kafka, Zookeeper, Eureka, Bouncer +  much more)
    More details: http://tech.transferwise.com/the-transferwise-stack-heartbeat-of-our-little-revolution/

  • Integrating with a variety of partners and providers across the world, so our customers can send money across borders with minimal fuss and maximum confidence

  • Getting to the core of the customer’s problems by conducting interviews, answering support and figure out what TransferWise is to the customer and how it can be improved

  • What do you want to be working on? Autonomous teams come up with their own plans, there is no hierarchy telling you what to do.


Benefits:


Apart from the all-expenses-paid company trips, stock options in one of Europe’s most hotly tipped startups, a laptop and team lunches every other Thursday, you won’t get much in the way of extras. However, we will give you 28 days holiday a year (plus public holidays), a fun, friendly atmosphere, plenty of opportunities to grow and the chance to be part of our little revolution. Oh, and coffee, there’s plenty of coffee.


Not from Estonia? - No stress, we will help you (and your family) to relocate from any part of the world!

title: Software Engineer (.net) at Exact (Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia)
description:
Software Engineer (.net)

The Job
Are you an experienced Senior Software Engineer (.NET) who wants to help an international company develop its business software solutions?

The Exact Asia Development Center (Exact ADC) is the international development center of Exact, one of Europe’s largest suppliers of business software applications. With our software development approach we have become a market leader with a strong international presence and users in over 125 countries. Our software is developed using ASP, VB6, VB.NET, C#, C++, JavaScript on the .NET/COM platform and we've adopted an Agile software development methodology (SCRUM).

Responsibilities:



  • In Exact, empowering our employees with the right skills and knowledge is our goal. If you are ready to move ahead and contribute towards a better understanding of functionalities and business practices, technical guidelines and best practice solutions, we want you.

  • We are looking for .NET engineers with proven web development / technology skills (HTML5/CSS/JS/JQUERY)

  • Design, code and test business software applications independently

  • Program both new solutions and new functionality in existing solutions, based on business needs, and using detailed functional designs

  • Maintain and troubleshoot applications by monitoring, identifying and correcting software defects

  • Investigate and solve software bugs in medium to complex business software applications and reports

  • Take ownership for the quality of all software targets and codes assigned

  • Be part of a multidisciplinary international teams, that collaborates closely with the technical and functional designers

  • Sharing software engineering expertise in your team



You Offer



  • Bachelor's degree or professional degree in computer science, information technology or equivalent

  • You must be experienced with JQuery and must have worked with and/or developed plugins.

  • Experience with incorporating client-side scripting into .Net server controls is a plus.

  • You should be familiar with integrating a front-end web application to back-end services via AJAX/JSON/REST.

  • You must have a good understanding of user-experience design and principles.

  • Coding is one of your passions in life

  • A minimum of 3 years’ experience in a role as software engineer/web developer

  • You must be experienced in web application development using ASP.NET

  • Effective verbal and written communication skills in English

  • Malaysian citizenship or relevant residence status

  • You will be asked to put your skills to work to help enhance a unique SaaS platform business solution.



We Offer @ Kuala Lumpur



  • We would like to provide you on the job training. Besides that we will train you to be an expert on domain knowledge.

  • You will receive a competitive salary, dependent on your level of education and work experience.

  • We offer you flexible working hours.

  • You will be exposed to cultural, social and professional experiences in an international environment.

  • You will be exposed to AGILE Software Development methodology (Scrum)

  • In addition we offer several extra benefits, such as an enhanced employee provident fund, group hospitalization and surgical coverage, term life insurance, vacation incentive after three years of employment, and a daily allowance.

  • Last but not least, you'll be working in office located in the GTower opposite to LRT Station Ampang Park, where, in addition to the fun you have at work, you can play in the games room or participate in activities like badminton, foosball and many more.



Our Culture
Exact combines the energy of a startup with the benefits of a multinational. We think actions speak louder than words and continuously strive for innovation; technical as well as personal. Each day again, we challenge ourselves and each other to be better than the day before. There’s never a dull moment at Exact.

Exact has an open and welcoming culture in which anybody can have impact. We value ideas by their merit, not by their source. New opinions, people and principles keep our minds flexible, while we stay committed to our mission of empowering SME’s to be the driving force of the global economy.

Are you the ‘you’ in our story?
Please apply using the 'Apply' button.

You will be hearing from us soon.
Agency calls are not appreciated.

Trefwoorden: Vacancy, Fulltime, Kuala Lumpur, Software Developer, Senior Developer.

title: Senior JavaScript Engineer - (HTML/CSS, React, Angular/Angular 2 or Ember) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
description:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will be building the technologies that are utilized as a base for further products and aim to connect all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility - a software development methodology that allows engineers to get work done while management keeps their distance. Along with our guiding set of principles - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.


Your individual impact at Zalando is limitless. It is not only about growth and improvement, it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue.Along with you, we strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.


You Are Setting Standards


Variety. As part of your onboarding, you will get to know some and join one of our teams that matches your interests and skills. As a team, you will build, scale and continuously improve a variety of web applications that redefine the user experience of our customers and partners.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code. You will decide together on the technologies and tools to utilize as well operate large-scale web applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Purpose. You and your team will work truly cross-functional with an entrepreneurial mindset and drive the whole development cycle according to its purpose - from implementation to testing and maintenance.


Mastery. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the scalability, performance and user-centricity of our software. You will add value through innovation by leveraging current trends in software design, frameworks and RESTful web services.

title: (Junior/ Senior) Operations Engineers/ DevOps - SUPERCRUNCH by GfK at GfK (Nürnberg, Deutschland)
description:
HERE YOU ARE. Another day in the office. Time to wrap up and hit the traffic home. Remember how excited you were when you got that great job in this brilliant IT team? And now? We guess the job is ok, your colleagues are nice too, and the coffee breaks are timed to perfection. All in all, a comfortable gig. Of course, you're keeping an eye out for other roles. You're still ambitious. Still want to go places and try out new stuff. Looking for a fresh challenge. Something to get your teeth into.


In time for the launch of our brand new SUPERCRUNCH unit by GfK!


At SUPERCRUNCH by GfK, Data Science driven by next level technology take center stage. Not just a fuzzy business power talk Management hears and thinks, "Yeah, that sounds great, next topic". Everyone gets it, lives it, and breathes it. It's an agile start up within an established, global organisation – the best from both worlds!


More than 35 experts from 12 nations share the same vision: To develop best-in-class tech and analytics solutions addressing todays biggest marketing challenges. Why just be a number cruncher, if you could be a SUPERCRUNCHER!


With GfK's incredible global data landscape at our disposal, we might have an unfair advantage – not many players can say they collect granular sales data in more than 100 countries, or measure cross-media behavior using state-of-the-art technology for tens of thousands of consumers. Our other major USPs are our team and our values. Close, cross-functional collaboration of Data Scientists, IT Engineers, and Commercial experts is in our DNA. Our radically agile and dynamic startup setup enables everyone to learn at a fast pace, contribute to our solutions and get recognized for the hard work they do.


Our (Junior/Senior) Operations Engineers/ DevOps will join the most ambitious, Big Data crunching operations team on the planet and contribute to making SUPERCRUNCH the No. 1 Marketing Analytics player!


SUPERCRUNCH's Technology unit is led by Jörg, Senior Director Technology – passionate IT Manager by day and Superhero IT nerd by night with a passion for Big Data dating back to ancient times (2008), who prides himself with the most diverse taste in music and racket based sports and who spent most of his career building up and fostering the success of  DevOps- and Software Engineering  teams. SUPERCRUNCH is headed by Norbert, an obsessed number-cruncher himself, whose music taste reflects his personality: from Paolo Conte to Sex Pistols and everything in between!

title: Senior Ruby On Rails Developer (f/m) (in Berlin/Germany) at MODOMOTO (Curated Shopping GmbH) (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:
The Team:


You will be joining a tight-knit team of experts, in which decision-making is open and collaborative. Sharing knowledge and discussing strategy is just as much part of our day-to-day activity as quiet time is, to deliver an excellent product.

To be successful in this role, you must be a quick learner and have excellent software development skills. title: Lead Javascript/Frontend Developer at LeadIQ (Singapore)
description:
Are you the type of engineer who punches juke boxes to make the music start? Do you consider riding your motorcycle off into the a sunset a personal hobby? Is architecting a system from the ground up no big deal to you? We're looking for full-time Javascript programmers to make this happen.


As a company we are at an exciting stage in our growth. We are getting traction with big customers, scaling out, and solving increasingly complex engineering problems. We want team members with attributes like:


- focus on delivering value to the customer
- strong belief in collaboration
- passion that drives you to execute and innovate
- ability to self-manage and take ownership of a feature
- good written communication
- not afraid of a steep learning curve
- experience in a start up

- discipline in following process and documenting your work


These personality traits define the culture we are building and are more important to us than a particular set of technical skills, so there is some scope for training if you're a fast learner.


If you join LeadIQ, you will learn a lot: In terms of technical ability there are many cool tools, technologies, patterns and other great developers that will sharpen your skills. Personally you be given the chance to step up, lead and make your mark in a growing startup as we tackle the challenges in our next phase of growth.


So if you feel like you're a good fit for us, drop us a line! We love meeting developers who are excited by our product!

title: Senior Software Engineer, Backend (Java) at Zalando SE (Erfurt, Germany)
description:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility. With the set of principles that we give our teams - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust them to shape the future of Zalando. You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


What makes your individual impact at Zalando limitless is the possibility to tackle and create new opportunities. At Zalando, it is not only about growth and improvement - it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue. We strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.





You Are Setting Standards


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of products that create value for our platform.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).

Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.


Work Environment. Self-organized,  autonomous teams and flexible working hours.
