title: Build & Release Engineer - Tobii Tech at Tobii AB (Stockholms län, Sweden)
description:
Tobii Tech Platform R&D Tools is looking for a creative and dedicated person to own the build and release process for several key teams within Tobii Tech!


As a part of our brilliant Tobii Tech-team you will be a central part of the development that will blow peoples minds and make their dreams come true. 


We are growing at warp speed, and growing like this means a whole bunch on new challenges! One of these challenges is to manage our build & release process, and now we are looking for a talented person to help us tackle this challenge. Are you the one we are looking for? 


The role and responsibilities


As a build & release engineer at Tobii you will have an extremely important role, we need someone talented who is proactive to improve the environment that our developers works in. You will be running the day-to-day engineering processes and be in touch with our talented teams within Tobii Tech on a daily basis. 


In this role you will get an extremely rare insight into what Tobii is all about and what all the different teams are up to. 


Your days will be filled with



  • Development of strategies for branching and merging

  • Coordination of the best practices with other parts of Tobii

  • Building scripts, tools and other services to improve the productivity of our developers

  • Work to ensure a working build flow between the teams


All our jobs at Tobii are about innovation, passion and making things real.

title: Senior Angular / Node Developers at Recordsure (London, UK) (allows remote)
description:
At Recordsure we pride ourselves on our development professionalism, using as many modern practices & tools as suit the things we need to build.

Agile practices are our norm, whilst we organise ourselves on Jira, Atlassian and GitHub, keeping in constant daily contact with one-another on Skype.

We love delivering, innovating & collaborating and support each other in our individual learnings and group challenges.

You will work remotely for us, probably from your home in Eastern Europe or the APAC region, and we will do everything possible to make you feel part of the team... including a trip to London once or twice a year.


You will be expected to work 8 hours per weekday. To ensure effective communication with the rest of the team, and also to take part in required agile ceremonies and meetings, your working day must include the hours 10:00 to 14:00 GMT, including during British Summer Time.


About the job


You’ll be joining our front-end team, working primarily with Angular.js on our web portal application. Strong experience is required in this area along with its underpinnings: JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.


The web portal enables users to access and search records, listen to recordings, perform administration tasks, configure and view reports, view dashboard metrics, and see the results of our speech, semantic analysis and other machine learning system outputs. Some of the features you’ll be building will be straightforward CRUD, while others will involve rich and highly bespoke functionality.


We also have a server side component written in Node.js for performing administrative functions relating to organisations, users, authentication, etc. You must have at least an intermediate level of Node.js experience. We’ll provide you with the support necessary to build your experience to an advanced level if necessary.

title: Software Architect at Traveloka (Singapore)
description:
Be the owner of software engineering best practices, processes, abstractions, metrics, and engineering philosophy at Traveloka.
You will be in charge of keeping the company up to date with disruptions that are happening in engineering, including containers and orchestration, serverless, DevOps, NoOps, actor model, other programming paradigms, etc. and shape company technology strategy in alignment with landscape evolution.
You will also be the chief architect owning key principles and design criteria, and be the chief reviewer of technical designs at Traveloka.

title: Senior Java Developer (m/f) at movingimage (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:
movingimage is in a process of fast growth and therefore looking for qualified senior software engineers for its newly formed teams. We are hiring talented engineers with a broad and deep understanding of technology, visionary, yet very pragmatic developers, who can envision and implement next generation software innovations.


You will be working with our multinational team on designing and implementing enterprise software solutions. And there's a lot more to learn about us, for example from our video:


https://e.video-cdn.net/video?video-id=A5ZJB3cguCu-duGx3Hy3Q4&player-id=EKGFrtKUDHbdBELNij71Hk&width=800


Interested?


Then you're in the right place, because we are currently looking for an experienced:


Senior Java Developer (m/f)


Would you like to…



  • be an important part of our multinational agile software development team?

  • implement the new version of our APIs using technologies like GRPC, Spring, HATEOAS, Akka, Mongo DB, RabbitMQ and Kafka?

  • implement high-quality and scalable video asset management and video streaming solutions for enterprise customers?

  • deliver a rich, engaging and unmatched user experience?

  • write well-structured and documented “clean” code?

  • continuously update and expand the existing product?

  • experience how the principles of the Agile Methodology are implemented and lived within the whole organization?


Are you able to…



  • present at least a bachelor’s degree in computer sciences (or some other significant degree) and relevant work experience in building high traffic web applications using J2EE, Spring, Scala or Golang of at least 6 years?

  • demonstrate that you are a language agnostic with core understanding of mainstream programming languages and proven programming experience in either Java or C++?

  • demonstrate that you are a native user of linux systems (preferably Debian-based distribution)?

  • be hands-on in designing software and solving complexity by using OOP design patterns and SOLID principles?

  • prove that you are experienced in building Domain Driven Design (DDD) applications and web services?

  • show that you are familiar with asynchronous and event-driven programming using frameworks like Vert.x, Reactor and Netty?

  • show strong knowledge of NoSQL databases (especially MongoDB and ElasticSearch) and MySQL?

  • ideally also prove previous experience in implementing RESTful APIs for mobile and web applications?

  • communicate in German and English in all relevant courses of business?

  • be open and a team player who is able to carry out goal-oriented analysis and solve problems?


Do you feel addressed? We should get to know each other!


We offer…



  • an exciting perspective, a wide range of tasks, constantly new challenges and a desire for thinking out-of-the-box as part of our corporal culture

  • an open working environment that is characterized by teamwork and cross-functional cooperation and in which heart and humor are key figures

  • freedom to introduce your own ideas and to take responsibility

  • a modern selection of hardware devices

  • a professional collaboration with Scrum Masters

  • high-quality and scalable video asset management and video streaming solutions for enterprise customers

  • free German and English courses

  • a weekly breakfast

  • Flexible work time with 30 days of holiday

  • stable working environment

  • Hack days twice a year


Even more interested?


Apply now!


Submit your meaningful application documents noting your earliest available starting date through our online portal at the following link:


https://movingimage24gmbh.softgarden.io/apply-choice?6&jobDbId=792805&sgClickId=19245173&l=en


Your contact:


Mutabazi Nzirubusa | HR Recruiter


MovingIMAGE24 GmbH


Stralauer Allee 7 | 10245 Berlin


You will find more about us on our website: www.movingimage.com

title: JavaScript Front End Engineer at Tripaneer (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Tripaneer.com is looking for a JavaScript Front-End Engineer to improve the user experience of our products.


Full time and long term | Join our international team in Amsterdam


This is your opportunity to join a fast growing startup and to make your mark. We believe that a great customer experience is key to the success of our business and in our small but growing team you will have the responsibility and freedom to ideate, implement, test and deliver improvements to our websites and other future products.


We’re looking for an experienced front end developer who is motivated by making measurable customer focused improvements to our products. The main responsibility is to implement features but also to own the front end infrastructure, and topics such as ease of implementation, performance & scalability. The Tripaneer.com team works in a highly collaborative environment of critique and iteration, involving experienced developers and the founders of Tripaneer.com


Since the launch of our first website in April 2013 our revenues have mostly funded our growth, and recently we received additional investment.

title: Senior Ruby on Rails Architect - $50/hr at Crossover () (allows remote)
description:
The Senior Ruby on Rails Architect role is the senior level of our technical positions and requires an expert-level understanding of Ruby on Rails and related technologies. This position is a hands-on leadership role. You will need a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect to senior software engineer on the most complex elements of the product. You will also be a technical team leader and solution evangelist.

Role Description

In the role, you will be creating solutions architecture, algorithms, and designs that scale to the customer's enterprise/global requirements. Its your responsibility to ensure that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product.

Though we like to remove most of the management overhead for our Senior Architects to let you focus on the key technical solutions - you will be a peer-leader of a team of architects and developers to apply software engineering best practices and implement automations across all elements of solution delivery.


Company Description

Crossover is inventing the future of work. A future where high-skill jobs are available to anyone around the world - as long as they are the best-of-the-best in that skill. We assemble teams of these rockstars, apply best-known playbooks to run the teams and provide a platform to help each team and individual continuously improve. Crossover then connects these teams to companies with specific needs. And unlike freelancer marketplaces, Crossover only accepts customers looking for multi-year project or program needs.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Ruby code

  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications

  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems

  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.

title: Senior/Lead Front-End Javascript Engineer (AngularJS) at Compucorp (Greater London, UK) (allows remote)
description:
We like to build stuff… sometimes complicated stuff… for Art Galleries, Non-Profits and Charities. 


We’re an innovative bootstrapped startup based in London in the UK. We've grown to over 30 staff in the past 2 years based solely on the quality of the work we’ve been producing for our clients and we’re on the lookout for a talented Senior/Lead Front End Javascript Engineer (Angular JS) to join our team.


We do things a little differently, basing all our solutions on open source products, having flexible working hours and a real team mentality. Our work covers web design, app development and branding for Charities, Art Galleries and Non-profit organisations across the country. Our clients include Charities such as Wikimedia, Amnesty and Farm Africa, galleries such as the Photographers Gallery and Craft Central but we’ve got a long client list that includes other companies, trade associations and government bodies.


Your principle focus will be on developing Angular JS single page applications as part of the CiviCRM and Drupal frameworks for the CiviHR project (https://civihr.org/) but there's a lot going on at Compucorp so expect to be exposed to other technologies too! 


CiviHR is an ambitious project to develop a fully featured HR application designed for Non-Profit and Charitable organisations worldwide. It's based on the Drupal and CiviCRM frameworks and has been in development for around 24 months. We recently reached an exciting milestone and opened up for public beta.


We're looking for someone who can join a great team in mid-flight, have instant results and can help us to create a great product for Charities around the world.

title: Senior PHP Developer at belvilla (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Belvilla is looking for a Senior PHP-Webdeveloper,  to help us continue to build our products and services. Together with a team of young, enthusiastic colleagues you develop new tools, maintain and expand existing services and help improve usability and conversion. Your primary focus will be development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. It’s key that you’re experienced with the Symfony framework. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your coworkers into the application. A basic understanding of front-end technologies is therefore necessary as well.


You feel comfortable working within an agile environment that focuses on delivering business value, at a fast pace, in a dynamic fast growing company. The team focuses on building user-centered, modern, mobile, flexible platforms.


What is expected of you



  • Come every day with the energy & drive to achieve greatness, always drive yourself and others to improve

  • Develop, test and implement LAMP stack based, user- centered solutions

  • You deliver software that goes beyond basic functional requirements

  • Building reusable code and libraries for future use

  • You feel the drive to always want to optimize the application for maximum speed and scalability

  • Integration of user-facing elements developed by a front-end developers with server side logic

  • You help boost the Symfony framework experience level within the team by coaching and help setting up standards

  • You believe that great quality code is the result of team effort. You have a positive attitude toward team Planning, pair programming, TDD and Lean/Agile Practices.

title: JavaScript Developer- Kiev Ukraine at Camlin Technologies (Kyiv, Ukraine)
description:
A new exciting opportunity currently exists for a talented Javascript Developer within Camlin Technologies based in Kiev Ukraine. 


Role Responsibilities:


The Javascript Developer will be responsible for full-stack, client-side and server-side development of new and existing web-based products using Javascript. This will involve working in a team to develop software and unit tests, following an agile methodology.


Primary responsibilities:



  • Integrating existing software and developing new software solutions;

  • Creating technical specifications and test plans;

  • Ensuring product quality through unit testing, system testing and continuous integration;

  • Investigating new technologies and continually updating technical knowledge and skills

title: Frontend Developer: Let the movies come to you at Magine (Östermalm, Sweden)
description:
Plejmo is looking for awesome Frontend developers to join the team! 


Who we are


 Plejmo is the newest and most exciting streaming service in the Nordic market. Offering the largest catalogue of new and older movies with a unique dynamic pricing model.


We want more movies, more available! To offer everyone the freedom of choice in how, when & where they consume their movies. Striving towards a complete library including the newest titles, the ”oldest" classics and the most popular TV series - all available for the right price without subscription, you pay as you go. Plejmo challenges old structures and will change the movie consumption and its industry from the ground. Plejmo will defeat piracy with passion together with all movie lovers out there!


We have very big dreams and exciting ambitions and we are working extremely hard to help people love movies more than they ever have. We live in the fast moving digital startup world and we are looking for smart, adaptable people who can think on their feet. We thrive on fresh thinking, making a difference and most of all the love of learning and continually improving.


As a pioneer we must be quick and nimble, therefore we work together across all disciplines to deliver solutions. We are not afraid of trying new things and improving as we go, in fact we love it. There is no such thing as done or perfect in our world, only better.


Plejmo is a part of the MagineTV umbrella, a diverse group of around 145 people sitting in Stockholm (HQ), Berlin, and London. Our Plejmo team has around 10 people and is growing strongly. Everyone is equal and all ideas and opinions count. Flexibility in working and mindset are important to be part of a team in which change is and will happen constantly.


Plejmo is looking for awesome Frontend developers to join the team!

title: Head of Engineering (m/f) at Rocket Internet Company (Berlin, Germany)
description:
As the Head of Engineering (m/f) for one of our companies, you will guide technical teams building systems and products that may be used by tens of millions of people around the world every day from our headquarters in Berlin.


You will manage one or more cross-functional teams, taking them from concept to production, while remaining involved from a hands-on technical standpoint.


About the position:



  • You are responsible for the development and supervision of a team consisting of developers, testers and system experts and will be interfacing with a product counterpart.

  • You find and hire talented people to build up great teams.

  • You lead the development of multiple high-traffic sites and mobile apps.

  • You learn from and share knowledge with other Rocket ventures worldwide.

  • With your deep knowledge, you are able to solve complex problems and support your team in a hands-on manner.

  • You are in charge of code quality and architecture.

  • You manage projects, timelines and releases.

title: Senior VB Software Engineer at SSCS, Inc. (Salinas, CA) (allows remote)
description:
Want to work remotely as a full time developer for a company that has been writing software for over 35 years?
SSCS is currently looking to add a Software Application Developer to our team to work on maintaining existing software projects. The candidate will need to be proficient in Microsoft Access/VBA or VB6. Knowledge of .NET/C#, C++ and SQL is a plus as well.
The Software Application Developer's responsibilities will range from designing, developing, testing, debugging and maintaining applications with other members of the team. The candidate must have basic professional, theoretical, and conceptual knowledge in a specific field of software development, typically acquired via a bachelor’s degree or professional experience.

title: Senior Algorithm C++ Developer | Auto Trading | Trading Algorithm at Eclipse Trading (Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong)
description:
The Autotrading team is responsible for the firm's algorithmic trading. Our expertise in market structure combined with careful design and clever implementation is critical to the success of our trading. We are one of the top market makers in Asia.


Responsibilities and Duties



  • Design and development of our market making and trading algorithms, including quoting, hedging, arbitrage and delta one trading

  • Provide leadership in market structure and algorithm design across IT

  • Provide technical guidance throughout IT in design and code reviews

  • Work closely with traders and quants to define the behaviour of our automated trading

  • Provide Tier 3 support as needed

title: Ruby on Rails Senior Architect - $50/hr at Crossover () (allows remote)
description:
The Senior Ruby on Rails Architect role is the senior level of our technical positions and requires an expert-level understanding of Ruby on Rails and related technologies. This position is a hands-on leadership role. You will need a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect to senior software engineer on the most complex elements of the product. You will also be a technical team leader and solution evangelist.

Role Description

In the role, you will be creating solutions architecture, algorithms, and designs that scale to the customer's enterprise/global requirements. Its your responsibility to ensure that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product.

Though we like to remove most of the management overhead for our Senior Architects to let you focus on the key technical solutions - you will be a peer-leader of a team of architects and developers to apply software engineering best practices and implement automations across all elements of solution delivery.


Company Description

Crossover is inventing the future of work. A future where high-skill jobs are available to anyone around the world - as long as they are the best-of-the-best in that skill. We assemble teams of these rockstars, apply best-known playbooks to run the teams and provide a platform to help each team and individual continuously improve. Crossover then connects these teams to companies with specific needs. And unlike freelancer marketplaces, Crossover only accepts customers looking for multi-year project or program needs.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Ruby code

  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications

  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems

  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.

title: Frontend Developer JavaScript (m/f) - Modern Technology Web Application at CeleraOne GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:
We are a team of highly motivated software architects and mathematicians with diverse backgrounds – from text mining, routing algorithms, and social networks to compiler technology and mathematics. We combine our knowledge to advance CeleraOne’s technology and products every day.



We develop our backend mainly in Python and C++. The frontend is based on modern JavaScript
technologies. We strive for high code quality and rigorous testing. Each line of code must pass the code
review.


ABOUT THE JOB



  • Development of a modern web-based frontend by using solid technologies (Backbone, Twitter Bootstrap, Grunt, RequireJS)



  • Appealing and structured visualization of high amounts of data



  • Draft, implementation and testing (Buster.JS) of views for dynamic contents

title: Senior Software Engineer (Java / RubyonRails) at Pocketmath (Singapore)
description:
The Sopranos team (backend) develops and maintains numerous services that backs Pocketmath products. We are responsible for the bidders that integrates with supply-side platforms and bid on behalf of our customers. Our bidders can handle up to 40 million HTTP bid requests per minute, achieving a median of 5 milliseconds for processing each bid request.


We are looking for senior engineers who create well-designed services that are built to last. We value maintainability, performance at scale, reliability, quality, and simplicity.


Our toolchain consists mostly of Java, Go, Spring Boot, Docker, MySQL, HBase, New Relic, Git, Jenkins with an assortment of other technologies like AWS Kinesis, RDS, Data Pipelines, Redshift.


The Powerpuffs team (frontend) is looking for a senior developer with a passion for building great products, crafting user experiences and a desire to work with awesome data and analytics. You will primarily be working on our Ruby on Rails stack but a good working knowledge of Node.js, Sinatra and Go would be an advantage.


Together with the rest of the development team, you'll help us build out new features and capabilities across the entire platform.


You'll get to solve cool problems while aggressively learning new languages, frameworks and toolkits.


There's never a dull day here at the Pocketmath team!

title: DevOps Engineer - Java / Linux / AWS at Atlassian (Sydney, Australia)
description:
Love staying ahead of the growth curve and experimenting with new software and environments? Get on board as an Atlassian DevOps Engineer.


As a Sr. Engineer in one of our Site Reliability Engineering teams, you’ll build solutions to enhance availability, performance and stability of Atlassian services as well as automating away repetitive work. You'll also respond to pings, pages and alerts to investigate issues in our products that you can really sink your teeth into. You'll be working on non-production and production environments, monitoring, data collection and configuration management, as well as disaster recovery planning, capacity engineering, reliability improvement initiatives and platform automation. The best person for this role is someone that has a collaborative spirit - in our world, it’s not about being a hero and having all the answers, it’s about sometimes saying "I don't know" and working on finding solutions rather than starting with an assumption. The team needs someone who can ask questions, learn from others and turn chaos into order.


This role would be a great fit for someone with creative and innovative problem solving skills with a willingness to take responsibility for the code you write all the way to production. You will develop and implement solutions that operate at scale - seeing your own technology efforts directly improve the reliability of our products. Our teams are empowered and expected to improve our products to truly deliver a reliable experience to customers. You will own development efforts in each and every sprint from planning to delivery to realise this goal and collaborate with different team to review code.


One thing we promise: you’ll never be bored.


More about you


On your first day, you will have experience in:



  • Scripting and software development across one or more programming languages - we don't want you doing repetitive work! Knowledge of Java is required. 

  • Deep understanding of Linux systems

  • Monitoring distributed systems application architectures

  • Exposure to and maintenance of configuration management and orchestration tools at scale

  • Diagnosing and troubleshooting user facing service outages

  • Exposure to system and application level telemetry for large distributed cloud architectures

  • Diagnosing and resolving problems in high-throughput web applications and network services


We'd be super excited if you have:



  • Expertise with one or more of Python, bash, perl, Golang

  • Experience with container management and microservices architectures such as Docker

  • Building, automating, and maintaining infrastructure in Amazon Web Services

  • Experience monitoring cloud services with DataDog

  • Understanding of ITIL terminology for incident and problem management

  • Awareness and insight into industry trends (technology, methods and tooling)

  • Management and troubleshooting of a continuous integration pipeline

  • Experience leading teams of engineers in service outage situations


More about our team


Atlassian Site Reliability Engineering is a recently formed and rapidly growing group within the organisation. We are in the process of building our teams, tools and systems as part of Atlassian's mission to build the best SaaS services in the world. This is a truly exciting team to join - we are currently or are planning to be involved with every technical team across Atlassian.


We enable Atlassian to go fast by providing real time feedback on production systems. We work side by side with the product family and platform developers to maintain and improve services and performance. We live the company values with a strong customer focus and possess a healthy sense of urgency. We are a heavily data driven team, utilising a variety of data collection, enrichment, analytics and visualisations to learn about our complex systems.


We also live the 'Play, as a team' value by having a strong focus on sharing learning experiences from the front line with the development teams. So, the options for people in the team are vast. If you like mastering a domain and going deep, we need you. If you can juggle three tasks and coordinate multiple people in the heat of an incident, we need you. If you love the benefits of process and methodical improvement, you will love it here. If you want to keep your head down, headphones on and bash out code to support the team, we have a spot for you too.


Atlassian. Powered by You.





Additional Information



All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Senior Mobile Developers at Teamwork.com at Teamwork.com (Cork, Ireland)
description:
Here at Teamwork.com we've gone as far as we can with Cross-Platform Technologies for our mobile apps.  But it's just not good enough.  We want to take advantage of the very best that each platform offers.  It's not enough to be able to just get stuff done with our apps - we want them to be so good that people become addicted to using them.


So we're going fully native and we're putting together the best mobile team in the country to do it.


If you're a die-hard iOS or Android developer, this is your dream job: No legacy code, and the freedom and resources to do the best work of your career.


What We Expect:



  •  Strong attention to detail.

  • Willing to learn. You must have an open mind, be able to pick things up quickly and enjoy working with passionate people.

  • Fundamentally, this position is for a senior developer role, so we want to see that you've made some beautiful apps that you're proud of.


Ideally we'd also expect you to be familiar with the list below, but the main thing is your portfolio. Show us with the stuff you've done. Definite bonus points for putting together something using our API (http://developer.teamwork.com) - doesn't matter how small. 


What we we're not looking for:


 Ninjas. (Although if you want to do some martial arts in your free time that's fine too.)

title: Senior Frontend Developer (m/f) at InterNations (München, Germany)
description:
Our engineering teams architect, develop and test our social network. As a Senior Frontend Developer, you will be responsible for building awesome frontends, assuring their quality and running them in a production environment in an interdisciplinary team of different specialists.


As a Senior Frontend Developer at InterNations, you will:



  • implement and architect web applications in HTML, CSS and JavaScript in a Scrum team

  • identify and communicate front-end best practices

  • build efficient and reusable front-end systems and abstractions

  • test your code with automated tests

  • take part in expanding, documenting and implementing our UX pattern library

  • work with Product Management on the feasibility of upcoming changes


You meet the following requirements:



  • expert-level knowledge of JavaScript: you understand prototypal inheritance, scoping, and closures

  • familiarity beyond ES5 (e.g. ES6, TypeScript, CoffeeScript) 

  • you care about consistency of design and dislike having ten different buttons on a single page

  • you like fast web applications and know how to optimize them

  • experience in JavaScript frameworks, especially React and Backbone is a plus but deep JavaScript knowledge is way more important

  • you want to learn new things: technology, practices, user interactions

  • you have an interest in coordinating cross-team efforts and initiatives

  • a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience as a frontend developer

  • familiarity with automated testing, be it unit-, functional- and/or acceptance testing


We offer:



  • a fast-growing, dynamic company with international scope

  • a friendly work atmosphere and the space you need to pursue your own ideas

  • weekly team breakfasts, fresh fruit and regular team events

  • a central location in a wonderful cosmopolitan city with beautiful natural surroundings

  • support with visa and work permit application

  • we only need to support IE 10+


Sound interesting?


Then start the conversation by sending in your application today (CV, cover letter, start date, salary expectation) c/o Lars Strojny to:jobs@internations.org

Please include in your cover letter a list of projects you contributed to and are proud of. We also like to hear about what kind of work environment you aspire for and what technologies you find interesting right now.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer in a fast growing ecommerce startup at Oberlo (Berlin, Germany)
description:
We are looking for a DevOps Engineer (m/f) who maintains, grows, and optimizes our development infrastructure. In this role, you work closely with our development team and enable them to ship faster and more securely.


Your responsibilities



  • Plan, build, maintain and evolve our AWS infrastructure

  • Further develop the monitoring for all our services

  • Scale our infrastructure with high availability in mind

  • Work on the migration from our current PaaS to pure AWS solution

  • Share your experience about building a reliable and immutable infrastructure by documenting processes and consulting your colleagues

title: Software Engineer at Condé Nast International, Digital (London, UK)
description:
Condé Nast International publishes Vogue, Wired, Ars Technica, Vanity Fair, Glamour, GQ and many other leading brands. We're in China, Japan, Taiwan, India, Russia, Italy, France, Spain, Germany, the UK and Mexico.


In total we run 64 websites for about 220 million monthly uniques. We’re profitable, privately owned and committed to constantly reinventing ourselves at the tender age of 107.


Historically, we've had different tech stacks in markets all over the world. Now we’re looking at unifying our core platform, including our CMS and data infrastructure. This is a new international team, with the opportunity to help define what we ship and how we ship it. You'll get a rare look at digital publishing around the world. You'll be working with experienced folks in product, data and UX who have done this before. And you'll have a leadership team that gets it, clear strategy to execute on and the freedom to get on with it your way.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Site Reliability (m/f) - Munich, Germany at Westwing Home & Living (München, Deutschland)
description:
The Westwing mission is to inspire and make every home a beautiful home. We are on a quest to bring the wonders of eCommerce for home & living to our more than 26 million members in 14 countries on three continents. In less than 5 years on the market, we have grown to more than 219 million Euros in annual sales, and the opportunity ahead of us is massive.


The Westwing team is the secret to our success. Our more than 1,500 team members balance creativity and style with innovative technology and strong business fundamentals. We are proud to be working with inspiring colleagues who are smart, fun, ambitious, and looking for the challenge to transform an industry and take it into the future.


Do you think this could be you? To pursue our ambitious expansion strategy, we are looking for a Senior Software Engineer - Site Reliability (m/f) to join our Site Reliability Group. In this position you will work with a team of skilled people ensuring that our applications fit all the technical requirements to run in the cloud under high standards of availability, stability and performance.

title: Java Search Engineer at KAYAK (Berlin, Germany)
description:
The Position

We are looking for Java backend developers to help improve and maintain KAYAK’s world leading search and booking technology. We integrate with over 200 travel partners and link to over 800,000 hotels, 500 airlines, and 60,000 rental car locations. You will be an essential part of a high powered team that keeps all of this running smoothly – helping millions of people find the best hotels, best vacation packages, and the best ways to fly from A to B, every day!

Person



  • A solid Software Engineer with backend experience

  • Must be comfortable in a fast paced startup environment

  • Hands on and self-motivated

title: Devops at Ellmount Interactive AB (Stockholm, Sweden)
description:
Ellmount Interactive is expanding and looking for a DevOps to strengthen our team in central Stockholm. We provide development and operations for Casino Room (casinoroom.com), which is an iGaming brand with its own backend platform. With new offices at Kungsbron 2, we have an excellent location, with a vibrant, young and growth-focused environment.


What you can expect:


• Full time employment


• A challenge and an opportunity to grow

title: (Linux) System Administrator at Melexis Technologies NV (Tessenderlo, Belgium)
description:
Your future job


As a System Administrator at Melexis, you will



  • Automate system administration tasks by shell scripting and/or company configuration management system

  • Participate in projects to deliver business value and write/maintain all relevant project documentation

  • Analyse the root cause of recurring incidents and resolve them in a timely manner in order to avoid recurrence of the issue

  • Write and give training to global and local employees to allow them to achieve the right level of use of basic applications

  • Participate in Global Helpdesk structure to effectively resolve end users requests according to SLA

  • Ensure that all IT policies are applied and followed correctly in order to build and maintain the right environment

  • Implement approved changes on the production systems according to company standards in order to achieve 24x7 uptime of operations and continuously improve infrastructure

title: Software Engineer at Bol.com (Utrecht, Netherlands)
description:
With over 7 million customers, 30 million monthly visits and 15 million products, bol.com is the most successful online retailer in The Netherlands and Belgium. Over 1.200 people – including more than 300 IT-professionals, and 55+ Scrum teams – strive to make bol.com into the best, most customer-centric shop possible. Is that something you’d like to contribute to?


As a Software Engineer you will work in one of the three “feature spaces” within our IT organization:



  • The Retail Platform Space focuses on our retail platform. The ambition is to develop a best in class toolbox that seamlessly facilitates buying, product enrichment, sales and reporting.

  • The Shopping Experience Space is all about our customers, so optimizing the customer experience is key. Focus areas range from responsive websites, so information is presented perfectly on all devices, to personalization on the bol.com platform.

  • The Fulfillment Network Space works on projects that help us meet or even exceed customer expectations each day. CRM platforms, the development of our Warehouse Management System and supporting logistics processes are a few examples.


Our Software Engineers ‘breathe’ IT-technology, and their Java skills are vital to bol.com’s ongoing success. With so many Scrum teams conducting such a wide range of projects, bol.com offers engineers constant challenges to be taken on as a team.

title: Software Engineer at Condé Nast International, Digital (London, UK)
description:
Condé Nast International publishes Vogue, Wired, Ars Technica, Vanity Fair, Glamour, GQ and many other leading brands. We're in China, Japan, Taiwan, India, Russia, Italy, France, Spain, Germany, the UK and Mexico.


In total we run 64 websites for about 220 million monthly uniques. We’re profitable, privately owned and committed to constantly reinventing ourselves at the tender age of 107.


Historically, we've had different tech stacks in markets all over the world. Now we’re looking at unifying our core platform, including our CMS and data infrastructure. This is a new international team, with the opportunity to help define what we ship and how we ship it. You'll get a rare look at digital publishing around the world. You'll be working with experienced folks in product, data and UX who have done this before. And you'll have a leadership team that gets it, clear strategy to execute on and the freedom to get on with it your way.

title: Senior Frontend Engineer - JavaScript (React) (m/f) at uberall GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:
DESCRIPTION



  • As Senior Frontend Engineer / Senior Frontend Developer you will be working on our Digital Marketing Software (SaaS) and be a part of a highly skilled agile team. As a collaborative team member you will have a voice in our daily stand ups that will be listened and helps us to provide the best solution for our partners and clients.



RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Participate in full life-cycle software development of our innovative and unique cloud solution for Digital Marketing

  • Work closely with Product and Design to develop and implement new features and products & engage in feature discussions, product planning, collaboration with others, etc.

  • Maintain our website, our number one promotional tool. We need it to be clear, look great, load fast, and most importantly, effectively explain what we do

  • Build extensible widgets, pushing for the simplest integration of our latest functionality

  • Develop our web-apps that our customers use every day to manage anywhere from 50 to 10s of thousands of business listings

  • Build a reference connection to our extensive Rest API that both our partners and our own client apps us

title: Lead Mobile Developer at Creatubbles Japan (Chiyoda, Japan) (allows remote)
description:
Creatubbles™ is the safe global community for creators of all ages. It is the perfect space for children, families and teachers to save, share, discover and interact with multimedia creativity portfolios. It lets anyone share their experiences and creations safely in more than 50 countries, whether they are at home, school, an event or activity.


We recognize creativity is a critical life skill to be developed and nurtured like any other form of expression. We believe in the importance of finding and developing your individual voice by being able to express thoughts and ideas freely.


Creatubbles™ is an integrated creativity ecosystem with a growing list of partners that believe in nurturing creativity through a safe and supportive environment.


With "Share with Creatubbles", any company, organization or individual can very easily connect to and use Creatubbles™ to engage in meaningful (and creative!) ways.



  •        Main site: https://www.creatubbles.com

  •        Blog: https://stateoftheart.creatubbles.com

  •        Partners: https://partners.creatubbles.com


About our company


We are an ambitious team of around 20 people, covering 12 nationalities and operating as a network of virtual teams around the world. After closing a strategic partnership in Japan we are quickly building out our team in Tokyo.


Having recently raised a total of $10+MM from private and strategic corporate investors, we have plenty of fuel in the tank to build out our product, our team and to fund our global expansion.


To fulfill our mission to nurture the original creativity of children around the world, we are constantly exploring new ways to incorporate the latest ideas, approaches, and technologies into our products and services.


We are now looking for a world class team lead to manage our mobile app engineering teams.


About our development Team and Technologies



  • Our development team is headed by an experienced CTO and has 3 senior iOS and 2 senior Android developers, in addition to 3 front-end developers, 4 full-stack developers and two test engineers.

  • We start the day with a Scrum call and organise our work in 2-weekly Sprints.

  • Github, CircleCI, Jenkins, Heroku and Amazon AWS are just a couple of the many friends we rely on every single day.

  • ScreenHero allows us to enjoy pair-programming sessions, even when members are located on the other side of the world.

  • Our team is small and flexible, and everyone participates in the decision-making process.

  • With our web apps we support desktop browsers, smartphone and tablet devices and keep pushing the boundaries of responsive web and CSS techniques. At the same time we are rolling out a range of native mobile apps with simplified and very robust navigation.

  • Our focus is building and keep iterating on universal experiences and interfaces that work for and delight users between ages of 1 and 99.

  • The back-end is made available to our web app, our native mobile apps and our partner's applications as a simple REST API.

  • Security is extremely important to us and we regularly work with experts to review our security strategy.


About you



  • You are excited by the potential of mobile technology to transform the lives of creative minds around the world

  • You eat, drink, speak and breathe iOS and Android, and are a guru in one or more object orientated languages (Objective C, Swift, Java, Kotlin, C#, ...)

  • You are extremely hands-on, technically excellent with solid engineering principles.

  • You are proficient in automated testing (jUnit, Appium, ...).

  • You have a strong eye for beautiful design and are passionate about smooth user experiences.

  • You have shipped a range of popular consumer focused apps (please include references in your cover letter).

  • You have experience with data-driven product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc

  • You take quality and testing very seriously. Very very seriously. Obviously.

  • You take full responsibility for the product - from early planning stages to deployment and maintenance.

  • You are fluent in spoken and written English (knowledge of Japanese is a big plus).

  • You have a pro-active personality, are a real team player and feel comfortable working in a fast-paced tech startup environment.

  • You exhibit strong leadership and people development skills and know what will make your engineers go the extra mile.

  • You have a fundamental interest in what we are doing and show empathy for our users.

  • You have a general curiosity and an ability to embrace complexity


What we offer



  • A full time job opportunity, but part-time contractors are also welcomed.

  • We prefer remote work but relocation to Tokyo, Japan can also be arranged.

  • Super-flexible work schedule: we work across time zones and allow everyone to work when they are the most productive.

  • A very competitive salary and possibly stock options.

title: MicroStrategy Developer at Pokerstars (Douglas, Isle of Man)
description:
The Senior MicroStrategy Developer will be one of the key players in the Business Intelligence team of PokerStars. The successful candidate will be the lead development of MicroStrategy. The role requires a candidate with extensive hands-on experience of strategic data solutions in large organisations. The candidate must be capable of leading design and development tasks, managing the relationships with key stakeholders and acting as a strong advocate of both data-driven decision making in general and MicroStrategy in particular.

The successful candidate will have responsibility for the MicroStrategy Architecture, including the interface with the data warehouse and must be capable of in-depth technical discussions with regards to the design of the Data Warehouse. The candidate will direct the planning and implementation of schema objects, attributes, metrics, advanced reports, visualisations, dashboards, Intelligence Cubes and data-marts as well as other data and functional-related automations. In addition, resolving any ad-hoc data requests that come from the business through SQL scripting and by querying the relevant databases in the company. The candidate must be comfortable with business management, technical management and hands-on technical skills.


Key Responsibilities



  • Lead the development of MicroStrategy client front end: data models, attributes and metrics on MicroStrategy Architect.

  • Produce reports, graphs, dashboards, Intelligence Cubes, data-marts and visualisations.

  • Stakeholder management

  • Taking a leadership role in developing the technical and business relationships between the Data Warehouse team and key business customers

  • Promoting the concept of data-driven decision making within PokerStars

  • Developing a thorough understanding of the how the timely availability of accurate data influences business decision-making and company strategy.

  • Closely cooperating with the DWH development team specifying the required updates on the DWH level

title: DevOps Engineer - 2017's Biggest Mobile Strategy Game at NaturalMotion games ltd. (London, UK)
description:
We are on the hunt for a world class DevOps engineer with expert knowledge in delivering large, complex, highly available software systems to join our specialist infrastructure team supporting our genre disrupting mobile title, Dawn of Titans.


The NaturalMotion London team have created something truly unique with the Dawn of Titans project and over three years have established one of the most talented teams in the games industry. Our game will bring a console-quality experience to mobile, featuring ground-breaking graphics, an unparalleled collaborative multiplayer environment and an adventure that will retain players for many years to come. In this bold move to position ourselves as a world leader in AAA mobile game development, server infrastructure with undisruptive seamless gameplay becomes the plinth to our success.


What challenges await you?



  • Development of production infrastructure for a complex AAA mobile strategy game

  • Design and implementation of build, release, deployment, and configuration activities

  • Maintenance and development of an efficiency boosting toolset for our developers

  • Implementing and configuring 3rd party and custom components (AWS, docker)

  • Automating rollout of builds to development and QA teams

  • Together with your engineering team, you will be an on-call rotation and be an escalation contact for service incidents

title: Senior Software Engineer - PAAS at Atlassian (Sydney, Australia)
description:
As a Software Engineer at Atlassian, you will join an engineering-led company and the award-winning leader in software development and collaboration tools. We're looking for experienced and talented engineers to help build the platform that powers Atlassian's Cloud products.

title: Data Scientist at belvilla (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
You will act as the company expert on using data to gain insights on the customer journey and home performance and advise our business stakeholders on improvement initiatives. Next to being a strong analyst and project lead, you will work on developing the required analytical tooling.


You will advise to track and measure whether initiatives are delivering the intended impact, particularly related to customer behavior, financial planning, supply & demand actuals and forecasts.


You will be part of the core Data & Insights cross-functional team of data analytics experts and interact closely with business stakeholders within a multi-national and rapidly growing group of companies.


Tasks and Responsibilities:



  • Build and maintain forecasting models related supply, demand, booking periods and revenue and communicate results internally with marketing, product, strategy and FP&A teams

  • Support product teams in their data needs to maximize their impact, by delivering advanced (statistical) analysis on the initiatives and results that are created.

  • Combine statistical and machine learning techniques to a variety of business applications, including pattern recognition, lift analysis, price optimization and recommendation engines.

  • Be the data expert that supports the teams in setting up test scenarios to validate and further deepen our understanding of user behavior.

  • Build fast feedback loops of the experiments by building clear dashboards that allow for continuous updates in stand-ups and team meets, as well as alert the team of trends breaking in very early stages.

title: Software Engineer - Scala (m/f) | Hamburg at Kreditech Holding SSL GmbH (Hamburg, Germany)
description:
Join the financial revolution!


Are you passionate about finance and want to make a real change? Join Kreditech and our team of over 300 professionals and become part of a transforming industry. From engineering, to design, to analytics, and collections, we do things differently and we reward great ideas, team work and persistence. We have a lot of work to do – and we want you to join us!

title: Digital IT Team Lead at The Absolut Company (Hägersten-Liljeholmen, Sweden)

To ensure that solutions are sufficiently well tested, scalable and fit our global business and consumer’s needs.

title: Senior IT Ops engineer Wholesale Banking Portal at ING (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Senior IT Ops engineer Wholesale Banking Portal


ING is looking for a (mid-senior level) IT Ops/System Engineer within Global Digital Channels domain of Wholesale Banking.


If you want to work at a place where you are in charge of the correct operation of systems impacting tens of thousands of our commercial banking customers, where investing in the automation of provisioning and monitoring never stops, and where we are building a team of top-notch Ops engineers that can take on the challenges of running one of the most important internet-facing applications of one of the largest European Banks, please read on.


Work description


As a Mid-Senior Ops Engineer you look after the availability, reliability of our main Internet-facing commercial banking system—Wholesale Banking (WB) Portal. The WB Portal covers the whole range of ING’s Wholesale Banking products and offers the whole spectrum of Commercial Banking products: payments & cash management, FM, Lending, etc. The portal is accessible via web as well as mobile and tablet devices (with native apps for iOS and Android). The impact of what you are responsible for is huge. The field evolves fast and staying up-to-date and exercising technical leadership to help the organization stay at the forefront is of paramount importance. You will focus on strengthening the monitoring and automated delivery of our software to meet the challenges posed by the growth in the number of users of CB Portal. Some of the main responsibilities are listed below, we expect you to be able to cover more than half of them.



  • Monitoring and supporting the production environment and several other environments of the IB Portal

  • Automating the installation and integration of different components making up IB Portal 

  • Capacity management of file systems and databases used

  • Owning backup/restore and disaster recovery processes

  • Ability to analyze DB performance and make necessary performance tuning suggestions

  • Streamlining our development process from code check-ins all the way to deployment into production in collaboration with Dev colleagues

  • Evolve our approach for monitoring and alerting towards preventive monitoring


You will participate in DevOps teams and software release cycles in collaboration with the Commercial Banking business and its support functions, all within a DevOps way of working.



Your work environment


You will work in the dynamic and challenging environment of the IT organization of ING Global Digital Channels.


We operate according to a Scrum Agile development process and strongly believe in the DevOps approach to delivering IT solutions. The focus is on high-quality mission-critical software delivered in time using iterative development with regular milestone demos to the business, so that at the end there are no surprises about what we build.



Desired skills & experience



  • IT (Master/Bachelor) technical degree

  • Proven track record in this role, preferably in an international environment

  • Good knowledge (or at least keen interest to gain it) of some of the following areas: payments, cash management and financial markets is vital for this position

  • You have sound knowledge of relational databases and ideally have looked after the operation of a critical production installation of Oracle including its performance tuning as well as backup/restore scripts and processes.

  • Excellent knowledge of at least one modern scripting language (Python, Ruby, Groovy). Knowledge of Python is big nice-to-have.

  • Good knowledge of modern application servers such as Nginx, Tomcat, JBoss

  • Good knowledge of enterprise level networking (TCP/IP, VPNs, SFTP, Proxy, Firewalls)

  • Excellent knowledge of OS fundamentals with the ability to apply it in the context of modern operating systems, e.g. RHEL, CentOS etc.

  • Good knowledge and real-world experience in provisioning environments with tools such as Puppet, Chef, Docker

  • Knowledge of NoSQL data stores such as Cassandra, while not mandatory, is a strong nice-to-have.

  • Experience in the inner workings of the JVM, while not mandatory, is an important nice-to-have

  • Experience with continuous integration and continuous delivery using modern OSS tools such as Jenkins, Maven/Gradle, Sonar

  • Performance/Capacity/Availability Monitoring, knowledge of well-known OSS tools in this area (such as Ganglia, Nagios, Graphite, Zabbix) is a big nice-to-have

  • Experience with automating capacity testing with OSS tools such as JMeter and Gatling

  • Basic knowledge of Scrum

  • Able to work under pressure, no 9-5 mentality, willing to be on stand-by outside of office hours

  • Great English communication skills, verbal as well as written.

  • CISSP certificate is a very important nice-to-have.


Important competences:



  • problem solving

  • creativity

  • cooperation

  • disciplined and result oriented

title: Lead Front-End Engineer at Directi (Bengaluru, India)
description:

This team is responsible for building and maintaining Flock Web, Flock Chrome Extension, Flock Mac App and Flock Windows App. The product is as complex and challenging as front end engineering could get. title: Functional Programming Engineers - Play your part in the Australia of tomorrow at Data61 at the CSIRO (Spring Hill, Australia)
description:
The Positions


Data61 is the largest data innovation group in Australia. Bringing together CSIRO's Productivity team and National ICT Australia (NICTA), we are unrivalled in our intellectual capital and our network with the global technology marketplace. The combined group will bring together approximately 600 research staff working in digital technologies to create benefit for Australia. 


We have a number of exciting opportunities for highly motivated, and suitably experienced people to join the Functional Programming team in Data61’s Engineering & Design Group. As part of this talented team you will apply your functional programming skills to contribute to the development of open-source software and systems targeting industry applications which are globally competitive.


What you'll do:



  • Develop software and systems building on Data61's research as part of Data61's business-focussed project teams as allocated.

  • Perform evaluation and comparisons of the developed software in terms of functionality, performance and robustness as necessary to demonstrate the competitiveness of the software.

  • Write documentation for the software and systems.

  • Work collaboratively with project team members including project leaders, engineers and researchers.

  • Make use of Functional Programming tools and processes for efficiency and for ensuring software quality.

  • Contribute to open source development, patent searching and/or patent creation activities as appropriate.


Tenure: Specified term of up to 3 years


Salary: Competitive base salary + 15.4% super (compulsory pension-fund saving) 


Reference: 31923, 31922, 30673


To be successful you'll need:



  • Strong demonstrable skills in functional programming techniques.

  • An ability to demonstrate functional programming principles using Haskell.

  • Demonstrated ability to work with a degree of independence.

  • Demonstrated experience with revision control systems such as git or mercurial.

  • A thorough understanding and commitment to principles of open-source software.

  • High-level communication skills, both written and oral.


Who we are:


Data61: are the largest data innovation group in Australia, a connector that brings together technology innovators, businesses and universities to transform Australian industry and to help solve our greatest challenges. A CSIRO business, we are creating our data-driven future. Find out more: (http://data61.csiro.au/) 


CSIRO - The Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation (CSIRO) At CSIRO, we do the extraordinary every day. We innovate for tomorrow and help improve today – for our customers, all Australians and the world. We imagine. We collaborate. We innovate. Find out more: (http://www.csiro.au)


Additional Benefits:



  • Live in Brisbane, Australia - Blessed with sunny days and plenty of action, Brisbane is one of the fastest growing capital cities in the world but is uncomplicated, laidback and fun-loving. (https://www.queensland.com/en-au/explore-queensland/brisbane)

  • Relocation assistance, visa sponsorship and health insurance for the duration of the contract will be offered to the successful candidates where required.

title: Full Stack Software Architect - $60k at Crossover () (allows remote)
description:
Company Description:


Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing remote contractors. Our platform connects customers to the worlds best talent for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we dont just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.



Job Description:


Our team is all about getting stuff done. We are pragmatic problem solvers who pull from a diverse technology tool set.

  • Write killer code in many languages solid and robust

  • Test before, during, and after TDD on steroids

  • Core tech stack is JVM/Java/Groovy, JS/AngularJS and SQL

  • Thirst and passion for raising the bar and making it better than it is now

  • Social team players in a real open space environment with music and significant shenanigans

  • Have a large tool box: Ruby/Chef/DevOps, Sinatra/Rails, hardcore shell scripting, high performance C++ engines, SQL datamarts, sproc-ing and data pumping; you must have enough tools to use the right one for the job

  • We are real-deal Agile: good design, heavy testing, continuous delivery, pair programming in an open space environment, and lots of communication

  • Embrace the inner, twisted technologist hackathons, side projects, open source


We currently have additional specialized opportunities for candidates with experience in Javascript, specifically:

Back End: Node.js

Databases: MongoDB, NoSQL, or Couchbase

Front End: Angular.js, Bootstrap, or React



Total compensation: $60,000/year

Location: Global (remote)

40 hours per week

title: Front-End Web App Developer at Bublup Technologies, Inc. (Arlington, VA)

We live Radical Agility. With the set of principles that we give our teams - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust them to shape the future of Zalando. You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.

Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

title: Scientific Programmer at European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) (Hinxton, UK)
description:
Are you an experienced software developer with good working knowledge of fundamental algorithms and data structures? The Iqbal research group at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) is looking for a programmer to join their growing team, and play a vital role in developing software used to analyse the DNA of pathogens underlying global health threats such as TB and malaria.

Many problems in the analysis of DNA can be cast as algorithms on strings or graphs. Localised differences in DNA can cause bacterial and parasite strains to differ in medically and biologically important ways - for example being resistant to an antibiotic or being able to infect humans. Detecting and classifying these differences (either between genomes or between noisy experimental subsamples of genomes) can be translated into string and graph problems. The Iqbal group develops such methods. Their work ranges from development of novel algorithms and data structures, to concrete implementations translating research ideas into clinical practise. For example their Mykrobe predictor software has been integrated into Public Health England’s tuberculosis pipeline. Dr Iqbal spent 8 years in the software industry after his PhD, working in development and software management in embedded operating systems for mobile device and network drivers, before returning to academia. The rest of the group have degrees in maths, physics and biology.

EMBL-EBI, the UK site of the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL), has been a global leader in computational biology research since its inception in 1994. Located on the Wellcome Genome Campus, we are at the centre of one of the highest concentrations of technical and scientific expertise in the world. Our research spans fundamental methods in sequence analysis, multi-dimensional statistical analysis and data-driven biological discovery, from plant biology to mammalian development and disease. We are highly collaborative and interdisciplinary, regularly publishing high-impact works on sequence and structural alignment, genome analysis, basic biological breakthroughs, algorithms and methods of widespread importance.

As a Scientific Programmer, you would lead the development and maintenance of key scientific software developed by the Iqbal group. One important area of work is the further development of gramtools, a software suite for analyzing genome sequence data based on a modified Burrows Wheeler transform.

Your specific goals and tasks would include:



  • Develop, implement and maintain advanced algorithms and data structures, in particular in gramtools, but also in other applications related to genome graphs and succinct data structures.

  • Collaborate closely with other team members who are developing modifications of and tools based on gramtools and/or other graph genome software.

  • Apply these software to empirical datasets, profile, evaluate performance and update design, implementation and/or algorithms as appropriate.


Useful links


Group home page: www.ebi.ac.uk/research/iqbal


Gramtools code: https://github.com/iqbal-lab/gramtools


Gramtools motivation and algorithm: https://goo.gl/qsWVrc


Other work from this group on de Bruijn graphs (https://goo.gl/69wrU) and antibiotic resistance prediction using graphs (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pM4yiirQD0c, https://github.com/iqbal-lab/Mykrobe-predictor, https://goo.gl/1ZxR7x )

title: Web Server Administrator at EMBL-EBI (Hinxton, UK)
description:
We are seeking to recruit a Web Server Administrator who will join the Web Production team at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) located at the Wellcome Genome Campus near Cambridge in the UK.


The EMBL-EBI is currently running web applications on over 800 Virtualised VMware-based servers in 2 distinct data centres. We are using chiefly Apache and Tomcat as application servers that receive more than 780 million web requests on average per month from some 4.7 million unique IPs worldwide. The Web Production group is responsible for maintaining and supporting the web infrastructure in a highly dynamic work environment, providing support for some 600 users from all research groups and service teams at the institute.   • Team player, goal-oriented individual, with outstanding technical skills.

  • Best practice around implementing responsive design

  • Experience in the cycle of software development, and agile methodologies.


Culture and Perks


We recognize and reward hard work and celebrate our successes over a Friday afternoon drink and at various socials throughout the year. We don't sweat the small stuff either; our dress code is as relaxed as we are. As well as local charity events and initiatives, we hold global days and activities to make the most of our global strength and diversity. This includes a yearly global hackathon!


Perks include subsidized healthcare insurance, share scheme, community events, flexible working opportunities and access to various learning and development programs.

title: Infrastructure Engineer at Telenor Digital (Trondheim, Norway)
description:
We are looking for software engineers with an interest in infrastructure and systems to help us build a solid infrastructure for a global login and payment solution for tens of millions of users. You’ll be on a team that maintains products we provide to the rest of the engineering teams, such as logging, telemetry or deployment services.


Our project


Telenor Digital is creating a world class login and payment solution with the goal of connecting tens of millions of users to different services within the next two years. We operate mainly in the European and Asian markets.


The Infrastructure team has responsibility for running and maintaining the shared services and tools that are relied on by the product teams. We work closely with all product teams to ensure that the components built serve product needs;  the design and implementation of infrastructure products and services is a product of collaboration with other teams.


Any formal requirements?


Not really!  Most of the engineers at the office have a M.Sc or Phd in Computer Science, or equivalent experience.


English is our working language.


Skills


We are looking for engineers with a wide range of skills but a strong background or interest in infrastructure and systems. You need to have excellent problem solving skills and should be able to reason about and understand distributed systems. You should have a background in software development or related fields – analysis, design, implementation, security, testing, performance tuning, debugging or operations. Ideally, you will also have experience with some aspect of building dependable, large scale distributed software systems – such as consensus (e.g., leader election), state replication, caching strategies, fault tolerance and disaster recovery.


Disclosing our users’ data is not an option, and you should have basic understanding of security as well as methods for authentication, authorization and encryption.


If you are not certain whether you should apply or not, see how many of the statements below you can agree with. It doesn’t have to be all of them, but it shouldn’t be less than half either:



  • You are strongly proficient with at least one programming language

  • You like writing code and building software

  • You are effective on the Unix command line

  • You have at least experimented with Docker

  • You have an account with a public cloud service provider (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform, ...)

  • You are familiar with infrastructure definition technologies (CloudFormation, Terraform, etc.)

  • You have used configuration management systems (Ansible, Puppet, Chef, CFEngine, Salt)

  • You are familiar with networking (VPN, DNS, routing)

  • You have built continuous integration pipelines (with Jenkins, Travis CI, teamcity or similar)


    • What we do


    We have three main responsibilities and products that we provide to the engineering teams:



  • We build secure infrastructure that can be used by our product teams to accelerate their development. This includes infrastructure for service discovery, secret management, VPNs and networking.

  • We build and assist product teams with deployment tools and systems, including continuous testing, integration and delivery systems.

  • We help the product teams monitor services and process logs from production systems.


    • How we work


    We take pride in our services. It is important to us that our users have a great experience using them, and this philosophy drives our priorities. Since change is the only constant, we apply agile and iterative methods and operate in a collaborative, DevOps manner. We also believe that technology should take away the boring repetitive toil -- we strive to build all infrastructure as code and prefer immutable infrastructure where feasible.  You're free to choose your preferred desktop environment – most of us use Mac or Linux.


    So, now what?


    If you’re passionate about coding and infrastructure and think you can work well with us, please send us your resumé/CV. Fresh graduates are encouraged to show their GitHub account or other code samples. Other applicants may of course choose to do this as well.


    Please contact Matt Long, +47 93660112 (Mobile) with questions about infrastructure and operations positions.

The role will involve a mixture of writing and executing manual test scripts, feeding back to developers on bugs or issues noted. There may also be some future work on automation testing although the primary focus for this role will be manual testing. The ideal candidate would have some existing CRM and CMS experience (ideally Drupal), be an expert in developing comprehensive test plans, have expert SQL knowledge and be comfortable setting up a basic development environment and working with Git.


What were looking for is someone who can grasp concepts quickly, has great attention to detail, and loves picking holes in (other people’s!) logic. In short, we’re a team of self confessed geeks who love tinkering and tweaking until something is just right, and we’re looking for someone who thinks and acts like us to join our growing team.
