For more information, visit http://www.immobilienscout24.de

title: Tester/Quality advocate at EROAD (Auckland, New Zealand)
description:
The Role:


We have an outstanding opportunity for a Tester/Quality advocate who is interested in an exciting career in a dynamic, fast-growing technology company.


Our product teams use the Scrum development framework to rapidly deliver software products that meet business needs.


This focus on quickly creating and delivering working products provides a platform for experimentation and innovation, and the opportunity to rapidly prove ideas.


Our development teams are multidisciplinary and work closely with business stakeholders to regularly produce shippable, market-leading products.

title: FPGA Engineer at IMC Financial Markets (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
IMC financial markets – Where Technology drives Trading


Trading nowadays happens in a highly competitive technological landscape; the best trading idea alone doesn’t cut it anymore. Instead, only the best trading ideas that are enabled via robust, scalable and fast technology win.


Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?


FPGA ENGINEERING AT IMC:



  • On most exchanges the trade goes to the party that gets there first, so latency is incredibly important to us and we’re always trying to find ways to become a little bit faster.

  • As an FPGA engineer you work with the trading and infrastructure teams to implement the trading strategies while getting the most out of our infrastructure.

  • You'll work in a small team that takes responsibility to own the complete solution. This includes finding ways to become more productive, improve testing and thinking about measuring and monitoring.

  • Manage the deployment process of solutions as they are developed. We do our best to get changes to production as quickly as possible as improvements can have a very clear effect on our profitability.

  • However we are very careful that this focus on getting our work in production does not compromise quality. We value good engineering practices and we take our responsibilities for stable financial markets very seriously.

  • We currently use a combination of Verilog/VHDL, C++ and scripting languages for our FPGA systems. We automate our testing as much as possible. We connect to exchanges over Ethernet so understanding the details of network protocols and network infrastructure is a very important aspect of the job.

title: Product Owner at Wargaming Sydney (Sydney, Australia)
description: Wargaming Sydney is seeking an experienced Product Owner for a talented software development group working on BigWorld Technology, the record-breaking server technology behind World of Tanks, and other award-winning MMOs.

title: Data analytics - Lead at Plivo (Bengaluru, India)
description:
Plivo is a fast-growing startup backed by some of the best investors in the world including Andreessen Horowitz, Y Combinator, SV Angel, Qualcomm Ventures and Battery Ventures. We’ve raised $2M thus far and are looking to expand into international markets and we need someone who’s excited to grow with us.


Below are some articles worth a read


Techcrunch


Forbes


We are dedicated to simplify and disrupt the multi billion telecom market. Our cloud-powered Voice and SMS APIs allow businesses to build communication applications that are scalable, low cost, and global. Thousands of well known businesses are already built using Plivo including popular conferencing solutions, mobile communication apps, SMS marketing software, and business phone solutions and this is just the beginning.


We are looking for a talented and a driven Technical Leader to join our team.


WHAT STACK WE USE


Golang, Django, Flask, Redis, memcache, Postgres, Celery, Dynamo DB, Hadoop, SNS/SQS, AWS lambda, Nginx, Kamailio, FreeSWITCH, SIP, WebRTC, Linux, Android, iOS, Git, AWS, Docker.


WHAT TECHNOLOGIES WE WORK UPON


Networking, Distributed systems, Big Data, Least Cost Routing, Billing, Invoicing, Analytics, Fraud detection & Prevention, VOIP protocols, SMS Protocols, Cloud Infra, Web and Mobile Platforms, Microservices


ROLES



  • You will be a data-driven, analytical engineer with an eye for detail.

  • You will build solutions that’ll be used drive key business decisions and provide competitive advantage.

  • You will have hands-on experience with the full lifecycle of design, development, deployment and performance tuning of big data projects.

  • You will thrive in a collaborative and fast-paced agile environment.



RESPONSIBILITIES 



  • Build analytical and reporting dashboards for both internal and external users.

  • Build data pipelines and streams from online systems to offline processing and vice versa.

  • Work with business and engineering stakeholders to find the right data integration solution.

  • Analyze data flow bottlenecks in existing systems and come with solutions to fix them.

  • Surface key insights, business intelligence and forecasts based on existing data patterns.

  • Mentor junior engineers and provide technical leadership to a team of data engineers.



JOB PERKS



  • Informal work style, startup culture with flexible work hours

  • Endless snacks and beverages

  • Free gym membership

  • Competitive salary and medical benefits.

title: Senior System Administrator (m/f) | Hamburg at Kreditech Holding SSL GmbH (Hamburg, Germany)
description:
Join Kreditech and our team of over 300 professionals and become part of a transforming industry. From engineering, to design, to analytics, and collections, we do things differently and we reward great ideas, teamwork and persistence. We have a lot of work to do – and we want you to join us! As a part of our Infrastructure team, you will be responsible to make sure our mission critical applications and systems are reliable and ready for Internet scale.

  • You monitor and perform capacity planning for our infrastructure;

  • You work closely with other departments, such as Engineering, Business Intelligence, Data Science, and Cyber Security to create the infrastructure of the future.

title: Java Chief Software Architect - $100K at Crossover () (allows remote)
description:
Java Chief Software Architect - $50/hr


Are you ready to hit the ground running in a dynamic leadership role within our fast-paced environment?


Do you want to develop for developers in a company that believes in empowering software development and creating higher quality code?


Do you enjoy developing solutions to complex architectural problems?


Do you get excited at the idea of building the future of innovation, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers, and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources?


Are you eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world while earning $100,000 USD, all from the comfort of your home?


If you said yes to any of the questions above, this role is for you.

Company Description:

Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing remote contractors. Our innovative contractor based model, does not mean temporary - it means flexibility with global teams. Everyone is a contractor, your managers, your peers, etc. Our platform connects customers to the worlds best talent for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we dont just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.

Job Description:

As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery of a multi-million dollar revenue per year enterprise software product, you will effectively work as the CTO of the engagement with a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to technical team leader and solution evangelist. Its your responsibility to ensure that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product. We want to give you the ability to look at code in ways it has never been looked at before, to understand the interdependency in the code.


We are empowering software development and creating higher quality code by using the latest technologies and toolsets. We are excited about using data to make decisions, we are bringing big data and analysis to software development. We are on the cutting edge of software development, and we innovate improvements on the newest technologies. We want people who are adaptable and can learn new things, and can use new ideas and concepts to solve business problems.



Key Responsibilities:


  • Developing expertise in one or more of our proprietary enterprise software products.

  • Leveraging your broad technology capability set and maintain a level of excitement in using various technologies to architect, develop, and iteratively deploy real enterprise class software.

  • Achieving an expert level understanding of our customers environments and their use of our products.

  • Architecting and leading weekly technical delivery of one or more products in a way that maintains an unyielding focus on quality while matching the needs of the target customer base.

  • Creating solutions architecture, algorithms, and designs for solutions that scale to the customer's enterprise/global requirements

  • Leading a small team of Software Engineers to apply software engineering practices and implement automations across all elements of solution delivery

  • Manage accountability of team members, with pinpoint focus on quality; Personally accountable for resolution of the most technically challenging issues

title: Product Manager at Condé Nast International, Digital (London, UK)
description:
Condé Nast International publishes Vogue, Wired, Ars Technica, Vanity Fair, Glamour, GQ and many other leading brands. We're in China, Japan, Taiwan, India, Russia, Italy, France, Spain, Germany, the UK and Mexico.



In total we run 64 websites for around 220 million monthly uniques. We’re profitable, privately owned and committed to constantly reinventing ourselves at the tender age of 107.



Historically, we've had different tech stacks in markets all over the world. Now we're looking at unifying our core platform, including our CMS and data infrastructure. We want you to come and help lead that effort.



This is a new international team, with the opportunity to help define what we ship and how we ship it. You'll get a rare look at digital publishing around the world. You'll be working with experienced folks in product, data and UX who have done this before. And you'll have a leadership team that gets it, a clear strategy to execute on and the freedom to get on with it your way.

title: Senior Full Stack Developer (Java & Javascript Or Node.JS) at Atlassian (Sydney, Australia)
description: Do you enjoy every part of building software products and have a passion for developing awesome product features? Be a part of an energetic and fast moving team that delivers incredible, innovative improvements to our products. Using Java and Javascript, we create a rich, interactive and engaging user experience. Our Software Developers write and test code that binds the front and back ends of our products together and makes the customer experience and product usability as good as it gets (and it gets pretty darn awesome). This role will be responsible for whole vertical slices of functionality—from front end UI to back end product functionality. This role will be constantly working on and delivering new features and functionality through software improvements in small, high performing teams and continually optimise the performance of our products. You’ll collaborate often with other developers to write the best code for the project and deliver amazing results that our users love.

title: Back End Developer (NodeJS) - Amsterdam at StartMonday BV (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
At StartMonday, we’re taking recruiting to an exciting new level.  We started a revolution last year with 15-second videos for job applications and now we’re adding cognitive solutions in partnership with IBM Watson.  We’re a public company (CSE:JOB) entering the scale-up phase.  As part of this scale-up we are looking to hire an experienced Back-End Developer to help us grow and develop our products here in Amsterdam.


Our HQ is in Amsterdam; our vision is global.


We are looking for an experienced back-end developer who is passionate about building products that customers love.  You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional Agile teams to design, build and roll out products that deliver the company’s vision and strategy.


You will fit right in if you are:



  • Passionate about building solid software that will sit at the heart of our product.

  • Excited by the rapidly-evolving world of a fast-growing startup/scaleup business.

  • Self-motivating and self-driven - you don’t wait for others to tell you what you should do next.

  • A learner - never satisfied with just carrying on, always trying to improve your craft.

  • A sharer - always ready to mentor others and share your expertise.

  • A communicator - you’re fluent in English, and excited to be working on a diverse and highly international team.  You are comfortable speaking up and don’t keep things to yourself - good or bad.

  • A collaborator - You’re respectful of others and a trusted teammate.  You listen as well as talk.  If there is a dispute, you seek consensus rather than victory, and the good of the team over personal gain.

title: Software Engineering Manager - $100k at Crossover () (allows remote)
description:
Software Engineering Manager


If you are an elite Software Engineering Manager eager to gain unprecedented visibility to the top technology companies throughout the globe, employ your technical and managerial skills to oversee cutting-edge software in a high-intensity environment, and earn $100,000 USD per year while working from virtually anywhere on the planet, this job is for you.


The Company:


Crossover is a well-funded startup that has developed a unique way to find, curate and manage the top 1% of global talent and connect them to medium and large businesses. We are experiencing rapid growth within the companies we currently serve and are increasing our staff to expand our business.


Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will consist of teams collaborating from every corner of the world. Our platform connects customers to the worlds best talent for both technical and non-technical contracting. But we dont just find the best; we also provide the software tools, training, and expert management to ensure success for long-term growth.

Job Description:

Crossover is looking for Software Engineering Managers who demonstrate outstanding managerial skills as well as the technical background to deeply understand the code their teams are developing. You will be expected to demonstrate both a mastery of the technical skills associated with the projects at hand, as well as the managerial ability to motivate, build, and monitor your team. Specifically, you will be responsible for overseeing from 4 to 6 teams of 3 to 4 individuals. You will own the process of breaking specifications created by the product management team into clear tasks and timelines, as well as assembling the results into high value, reusable components. Under your leadership, we expect to see consistent improvement in both static code quality metrics and weekly production.

title: Software Engineering Manager (UWP) - $140K at Crossover () (allows remote)
description:
If you are an elite Software Engineering Manager with Universal Windows Platform expertise eager to gain unprecedented visibility to the top technology companies throughout the globe, employ your technical and managerial skills to oversee cutting-edge software in a high-intensity environment, and earn $140,000 USD per year while working from virtually anywhere on the planet, this job is for you.


The Company:


Crossover is a well-funded startup that has developed a unique way to find, curate and manage the top 1% of global talent and connect them to medium and large businesses. We are experiencing rapid growth within the companies we currently serve and are increasing our staff to expand our business.


Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will consist of teams collaborating from every corner of the world. But we dont just find the best; we also provide the software tools, training, and expert management to ensure success for long-term growth.


Job Description:

Crossover is looking for Software Engineering Managers with UWP experience who demonstrate outstanding managerial skills as well as the technical background to deeply understand the code their teams are developing. You will be expected to demonstrate both a mastery of the technical skills associated with the projects at hand, as well as the managerial ability to motivate, build, and monitor your team. Specifically, you will be responsible for overseeing from 4 to 6 teams of 3 to 4 individuals. You will own the process of breaking specifications created by the product management team into clear tasks and timelines, as well as assembling the results into high value, reusable components. Under your leadership, we expect to see consistent improvement in both static code quality metrics and weekly production.


A successful UWP Software Engineering Manager at Crossover will demonstrate the following qualities:

  • Ruthless commitment to impeccable code quality

  • Deep understanding of a wide range of the latest technologies and architectural approaches

  • Advanced proficiency in C# programming language, related frameworks and best practices

  • The ability to make appropriate technical decisions, review design and code, and ensure best technical practices

  • Commitment to hands-on engagement as an individual within the team, despite managerial status

  • Willingness to embrace iterative development as the means for building seamless products

  • Perfectionism: knowing how a job should be done and not stop until its done correctly

  • Exceptional ability to effectively motivate and manage teams of individuals

  • Commitment to increasing efficiency in the workplace by continuously automating parts of the software engineering process

  • Excellent remote management skills (you will be using Skype, GoToMeeting, Google Docs, etc.)


Required Skills and Experience:


A successful UWP Software Engineering Manager at Crossover will demonstrate the following qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering

  • Proven managerial skills with at least 8 years of experience

  • 2 years of experience in hands-on UWP (Universal Windows Platform) application development

  • Experience with Cloud architecture and DevOps

  • At least 5 years of experience in managing .NET application development teams

  • Proficiency in Agile, SDLC, or SLA

  • Proficiency in AWS and TDD is desired but not mandatory

  • Outstanding English communication skills


Total compensation: $70/hr for 40 productive hours per week

Location: Global (remote)


Were one of the few legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote, work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.

title: QA Engineer - SUPERCRUNCH by GfK at GfK (Nürnberg, Deutschland)
description:
HERE YOU ARE. Another day in the office. Time to wrap up and hit the traffic home. Remember how excited you were when you got that great job in this brilliant IT team? And now? We guess the job is ok, your colleagues are nice too, and the coffee breaks are timed to perfection. All in all, a comfortable gig. Of course, you're keeping an eye out for other roles. You're still ambitious. Still want to go places and try out new stuff. Looking for a fresh challenge. Something to get your teeth into.


In time for the launch of our brand new SUPERCRUNCH unit by GfK!


At SUPERCRUNCH by GfK, Data Science driven by next level technology takes center stage. Not just a fuzzy business power talk Management hears and thinks, "Yeah, that sounds great, next topic". Everyone gets it, lives it, and breathes it. It's an agile start up within an established, global organisation – the best from both worlds!


More than 35 experts from 12 nations share the same vision: To develop best-in-class tech and analytics solutions addressing todays biggest marketing challenges. Why just be a number cruncher, if you could be a SUPERCRUNCHER!


With GfK's incredible global data landscape at our disposal, we might have an unfair advantage – not many players can say they collect granular sales data in more than 100 countries, or measure cross-media behavior using state-of-the-art technology for tens of thousands of consumers. Our other major USPs are our team and our values. Close, cross-functional collaboration of Data Scientists, IT Engineers, and Commercial experts is in our DNA. Our radically agile and dynamic startup setup enables everyone to learn at a fast pace, contribute to our solutions and get recognized for the hard work they do.


Our QA Engineer is part of the most ambitious, Big Data crunching operations team on the planet and contribute to making SUPERCRUNCH the No. 1 Marketing Analytics player!


SUPERCRUNCH's Technology unit is led by Jörg, Senior Director Technology – passionate IT Manager by day and Superhero IT nerd by night and with Big Data focus dating back to ancient times (2008), who prides himself with the most diverse taste in music and racket based sports and who spent most of his career building up and fostering the success of DevOps- and Software Engineering teams. SUPERCRUNCH is headed by Norbert, an obsessed number-cruncher himself, whose music taste reflects his personality: from Paolo Conte to Sex Pistols and everything in between!

title: Back End Developer - Scala, Node.js, Python - Agoda hiring now! at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
description:
At Agoda we are a big technology company, but this opportunity is specifically for an important role on a small team. This ambitious team is thinking every day about how to use the latest technology to build new exciting services that will be used by millions of people. We really need someone special to join us and help lead the back end development.

Work will focus on building a service that combines many different 3rd party API integrations.

You must be confident in code quality and execution, working in an agile team.

Industry knowledge and understanding of the e-commerce and B2B SaaS is a plus.

Office location - Bangkok, Thailand.

Technology you should be comfortable with or interested in learning: OpenStack, Scala, Node.js, SQL, Go, Python, RabbitMQ, Redis, REST API's

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Implementation of API endpoints for data manipulation and processes.
  • Build and maintain core application features.
  • Write unit and integration tests.
  • Collaborate in all project planning.
  • Work with both front-end and back-end web developers.
  • Prioritize tasks and coordinate work within the team.
  • Engaging with current team to improve and optimize current code and planning practices.
  • Be prepared to lead strategic technology decisions.
  • Take responsibility for successful delivery of solutions.
  • You will also be bridging the gap between the user experience and the server-side infrastructure, taking an active role on both.


YOU WILL BE A GREAT FIT IF
  • You are passionate about TDD.
  • You care about both user experience and developer experience.
  • You write DRY, readable, and modular code.
  • Are interested in learning new programming languages and tools.


RECOMMENDED SKILLS (NOT 100% REQUIRED):
  • Strong experience building and improving scalable applications.
  • Experience with using ORM and MVC frameworks.
  • Experience with HTTP, WebSocket, and Message Queue protocols.
  • Experience designing and building Restful APIs using Django Rest Framework.
  • Ability to learn and integrate 3rd party API's quickly into existing applications.
  • Ability to work independently and manage projects with many moving parts.
  • Familiarity with session and authentication best practices, access control, and preventing CSRF.
  • Familiarity with how front-end frameworks work such as Angular, Backbone, React JS, etc.
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git, GitHub.
  • Be willing to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from them.




This is a permanent, full time position working on-site in our offices at Central World in downtown Bangkok, Thailand. We are open to candidates from all nationalities and will help with relocation if you are not currently based here.

title: Linux Software developer at Bright Computing (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
We have positions available for enthusiastic Linux experts for the development of our Linux-based cluster management environment. You will be part of a team responsible for the development of our Linux based cluster management software.


You will be responsible for preparing our software stack for new Linux distributions and new CPU architectures; testing, packaging and maintaining third party software components;  managing software updates; keep track of the latest Linux distribution updates; developing integration between our software and third party hardware (e.g. GPUs, high speed interconnects, FPGAs) and software (e.g. Lustre, Kubernetes, Ceph, Puppet, OpenStack); and further developing our build infrastructure. Furthermore, you will also take part in the development of several Python based tools and applications.


There will be ample opportunity to develop your skills and to take initiative. You will have the opportunity to work with the latest hardware (e.g. GPUs, Xeon Phi and high-speed interconnects such as InfiniBand, Omni Path and 40 Gig-E) and software technologies such as parallel filesystems (e.g. Lustre, GPFS, BeeGFS), Hadoop, Spark, OpenStack, Docker, Kubernetes, Puppet, Open vSwitch and Ceph.


Our development team consists of highly skilled developers that are passionate about building a  software product that meets our customers' needs today and in the future. With your help, we will be adding many new features to our product to allow Bright clusters to be used for a wider range of workloads, and to allow clusters to scale to hundreds of thousands of nodes (i.e. exascale). We will also target new CPU architectures such as ARM64 and Power8/9, and further integrate container technology into the product to allow workloads to scale up and down easily on-premise, and to public clouds.

title: Full Stack Developer - Java at TrustedCompany (Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia)
description:
Before taking your next career step, sit back and think about what really matters to you. Joining TrustedCompany will not be like anything you've tried before - and that's a guarantee!


Becoming a team member in TrustedCompany you will quickly realize that we have an agenda. We won't be saving the world, but we do believe that what we do actually makes a difference in a lot of people's lives.


Becoming a developer in TrustedCompany means that you will be a cornerstone in making sure that we continuously build innovative features that both online consumers and online business can use in order to engage with us - basically building the next generation review platform.


At the end of the day - working with us should give you a feeling of belonging as well as doing something that really matters. You won't be just a number with us, as we carefully make sure that each team member is unique and has something that he or she can contribute with to our team. 


If this sounds like something for you - please read our job description and tech stack:


What you will do



  • Develop and maintain clean OOP & MVC driven project respecting good architecture and design patterns.

  • Monitor and assist junior developers in the team.

  • Participate in code review and architecture.

  • Identify and evaluate innovative improvement options.

  • Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.

  • Create reusable code, Plugins and libraries for future use.

  • Continuously improve your skills and stay on top of the latest technologies in the industry.

title: Back-End Web Application Developer at Bublup Technologies, Inc. (Arlington, VA)
description: Bublup is hiring Back-End Web Application Developers to create state of the art, highly interactive applications. Our projects are ground-breaking in terms of how users will interact with data and each other. We are looking for people who love to write code, but also have a great imagination.  Starting bonuses available for top candidates!

title: Senior Software Engineer - Multimedia Algorithms at SSIMWave Inc. (Waterloo, ON, Canada)
description:
About Us


SSIMWave is a spin-off of a state-of-the-art lab at the University of Waterloo and, as a result, we carry traits of a world class research and development facility. SSIMWave provides the media and entertainment industry an enterprise-level software platform to measure, control, and optimize video quality. Our products precisely model human behavior to accurately predict perceptual quality. We have a culture that values innovation and hard work. SSIMWave is a perfect fit for you if you want to be a part of a generational-breakthrough in defining video quality-of-experience.


About you


You want to work for a start-up company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You possess a positive attitude, diligence and a passion for innovation. You are motivated to make an impact at your workplace and you thrive on tackling challenging and rewarding problems.  


About the Position


Our customers include various major players in the media and entertainment industry and our state-of-the-art products provide the most optimal way to measure, control, and optimize live and file-based video.

title: Senior NetSuite Developer at Europes leading online fashion platform at zLabels GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
description:
The opportunity


Zalando’s success also tells the story of our exceptional team and our efforts. We are always happy to welcome new colleagues who join us in creating the world’s best online fashion experience.


zLabels is Zalando’s fashion subsidiary. Located in the heart of Berlin, we develop online fashion brands handling every step in the product lifecycle from initial design right through to distribution. We have a wide range of fashion brands: from sporty men’s fashion to refined women’s wear, to modern kids shoe collections. Some of our brands like mint&berry, Zign and Twintip have become extremely successful during the last few years, establishing ourselves as one of the leading online fashion companies. We plan to continue and build upon this success by expanding our reach to additional regions and online marketplaces.


We are currently looking for self-driven, detail-oriented NetSuite Developers. Using the NetSuite platform, you will play a critical role in designing, implementing and maintaining effective and scalable solutions for our fashion platform. This is a great opportunity to join a fast growing fashion company in a greenfield NetSuite deployment. With the help of your excellent technical and communication skills, you will work collaboratively to deliver solutions to a wide variety of stakeholders throughout the business.



QUALIFICATIONS



  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Science or Computer Science.

  • 3+ years of hands-on NetSuite experience in administrator or developer role

  • NetSuite Administrator and/or Developer Certification is a plus

  • Experience with SuiteScript, SuiteTalk, and Restlets is a must

  • Working knowledge of JavaScript programming in an application/workflow environment.

  • Experience designing and developing solutions for data migration, systems integration, and scripts containing business logic to support functional requirements.

  • Ability to develop functional solutions following best practices and taking into consideration the impact on performance and security

  • Experience with middleware integration solutions (iPaaS) is a plus

  • Highly motivated self-starter, ready to learn new technologies with the ability to be flexible and creative.

  • Expertise identifying scenarios where customization, configuration or workflows are needed

  • High aptitude to understand complex assignments, analyze problems and provide effective solutions.

  • Ability to adapt to a dynamic and agile environment, with evolving requirements

  • Excellent analytical, problem solving, and time management skills.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Ability to thrive in an energetic, fast-paced, high-growth, entrepreneurial environment.



RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Work closely with Product Owners to implement solutions in NetSuite based on evolving business needs.

  • Coordinate with NetSuite support on issues that cannot be resolved internally.

  • Prepare and perform due diligence prior to NetSuite releases.

  • Debug and troubleshoot production issues.

  • Communicate effectively with stakeholders with regard to project status and delivery timeframes.



What you can expect from us



  • Gaining experience from a  startup-driven environment where you work closely with our VP of Technology

  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical leads who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing talks and blog posts to networking with industry leaders

  • Community: hack weeks, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals.



About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.



Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact our Tech recruiter Antonia Samanns.

title: Developer Success Engineer at Auth0 (Palermo, Argentina) (allows remote)
description:
Auth0 gets a lot of praise from developers because we provide a zero-friction, infinitely extensible, enterprise-grade cloud solution that makes identity easy. We not only push ourselves to deliver an incredible user experience - we love to ship developer joy!


Auth0 Customer Success team's mission is to do everything needed to make a customer successful with our products, in all stages of their relationship with us: evaluation, adoption, and use. As a Developer Success Engineer, you are an expert developer who plays a key role in delivering a seamless experience to developers around the world exploring and consuming our product. Not only will you help them integrate Auth0 into their solutions, but you will also be shaping how Auth0 is perceived by the developer community.


Responsibilities



  • Interact with developers around the world to help them integrate Auth0 into their products and solve technical issues they run into, through different channels such as email, forums, and conference calls

  • Provide feedback to the engineering teams on how to improve our product and customer experience

  • Track, triage and follow up on customer support requests throughout their life-cycle

  • Measure and communicate to the company the progress of the support team

  • Improve the product documentation to increase user adoption

  • Build proof of concept and sample applications

  • Innovate on how support is provided and conceived. Bring innovative, state-of-the-art ideas to optimize our processes, tools, etc. and ultimately, our users’ experience

  • Mentor new team members

title: Docker Chief Architect - $100K at Crossover () (allows remote)
description:
Docker Chief Architect - $100K


Are you one of the top Software Architects in the world? Were you an early adopter of virtualization, containers and cloud infrastructure? Do you love to automate everything that needs to be done more than once? Are you interested in earning $100,000 USD while being able to work from any location that is comfortable to you? Eager to join a development network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you. Through Crossover, youll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for elite companies around the world.


The Company:


Aurea is partnering with Crossover to hire the best and brightest Docker Chief Architects. Aurea enables global enterprises to create transformative experiences for their end customers across a range of industries including retail, travel & hospitality, insurance, energy, life sciences, and insurance. Aurea products enable companies to build, execute, monitor, and optimize the end-to-end customer journey across multiple channels and touch-points to maximize growth through a superior customer experience. Aurea serves over 2,000 customers worldwide.

Job Description:

The Docker CA will be in charge of migrating products to Cloud using AWS, Docker and Aurora by taking any of our products from a legacy state, manual build/deploy processes, ancient dependencies, fragile architecture, weak security, lack of scalability or performance). Reverse engineer its legacy architecture and key flows (white box vs black box approach), understand its key weaknesses on the following pillars of cloud-readiness such as security, reliability, simplicity, performance, operational agility and automation. Design out the weaknesses, work hands-on and/or partner with and providing leadership to Product Development team. The final goal is to transform the product into a full dockerized CD pipeline with fully automated build/deploy/monitoring/resiliency processes in a fully consolidated Docker and Aurora environment with no unknown remaining legacy issues in terms of security, reliability, performance and operational agility.

title: Data Warehouse Engineer at Europe's leading online fashion platform at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
description:
The opportunity

As a Zalando Data Warehouse Engineer you will become a critical part of one of the most innovative teams in ecommerce. You will consult and support different stakeholders across the entire company by providing data-driven solutions to business and technical challenges. You'll join our accomplished team of experts in integrating data from many sources into our single-point-of-truth data warehouse. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others' projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand-while receiving meaningful support at every step.

What we're looking for



  • You have demonstrated your programming skills in Python, Java, or PL/SQL for at least 2 years

  • Experience maintaining, refactoring and extending large code bases

  • A preference for agile methodologies

  • A passion for working with relational databases: reading, writing and optimizing complex statements; modelling data structures, and designing ETL processes

  • The ability to communicate effectively with diverse teams

  • Fluent in English



Your responsibilities



  • Develop expertise in understanding our business processes and the many related requirements

  • Collaborate with our analysts to create and implement new initiatives based on our stakeholder requirements

  • Act as a liaison between your team and other teams within Zalando Tech

  • Maintain, optimize and extend our data warehouse infrastructure using Oracle, Exasol and PostgreSQL databases



What you can expect from us



  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical "People Leads" who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing conference talks and blog posts to industry networking Community: hack weeks, movie nights, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals



About Zalando


Zalando is Europe's leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast - with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams - and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It's how we grow.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!

title: SaaSOps Software Engineering Manager - $100k at Crossover () (allows remote)
description:
SaaSOps Software Engineering Manager - $100k


If you are an elite manager of a devops engineering team or a SaaS operations team and you are eager to gain unprecedented visibility to top technology companies throughout the globe, employ your technical and managerial skills to oversee super high impact devops migrations, and earn $100,000 USD per year while working from virtually anywhere on the planet, this job is for you.


The Company:


Crossover is a well-funded startup that has developed a unique way to find, curate and manage the top 1% of global talent and connect them to medium and large businesses. We are experiencing rapid growth within the companies we currently serve and are increasing our staff to expand our business.


Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will consist of teams collaborating from every corner of the world. Our platform connects customers to the worlds best talent for both technical and non-technical contracting. But we dont just find the best; we also provide the software tools, training, and expert management to ensure success for long-term growth.

Job Description:

Crossover is looking for SaaS Software Engineering Managers who demonstrate outstanding managerial skills and also possess the technical background to be a SaaS Operations leader through example. You will be expected to understand the architecture for each of a variety of new SaaS products, design high quality plans for migrating to our simple consolidated architecture, and then coaching a devops team to a successful on time execution. In addition, SaaS Software engineering managers will be responsible for improving individual productivity quarter over quarter through staffing, coaching, process standardization, process improvement, and automation.


A successful Software Engineering Manager at Crossover will demonstrate the following qualities:

  • Ruthless commitment to scientific debugging, and the unrelenting pursuit of the final "Root Cause"

  • The ability to quickly appropriate architectural decisions favoring simplicity

  • Commitment to hands-on engagement as an individual within the team, despite managerial status

  • Perfectionism: knowing how a job should be done and not stop until its done correctly

  • Exceptional ability to effectively motivate and manage teams of individuals

  • Commitment to increasing efficiency in the workplace by continuously automating manual processes

  • Excellent remote management skills (you will be using Skype, GoToMeeting, Google Docs, etc.)

title: JavaEE Course Authoring Opportunity at Pluralsight (FREELANCE) at Pluralsight () (allows remote)
description:
Are you a software developer with JavaEE experience? Are you interested in sharing your knowledge with other developers, virtual mentoring, building your personal brand, and earning extra income in the process? Want to partner with one of the fastest growing education companies in the world?


Pluralsight, the leader in online technology training for software developers, is currently looking for individuals to develop and teach online technical courses to subscribers around the world.  We are specifically looking for developers with relevant JavaEE knowledge, passion, and experience.  


As a Pluralsight Author, you'll collaborate with our curriculum and editorial teams to select and develop your own technical course. We'll work together to ensure your course is presented and marketed in the best way possible. Our author positions are freelance/part-time, enabling a very flexible work environment.


Join a community of recognized expert instructors that inspire, teach, and transform lives everyday by helping learners acquire skills that provide career opportunities and advancement.

title: Cloud Chief Architect - $100K at Crossover () (allows remote)
description:
Cloud Chief Architect - $100K


Are you one of the top Cloud Architects in the world? Were you an early adopter of cloud infrastructure and AWS and passionate about the cutting edge Cloud technologies and trends? Do you love to automate everything that needs to be done more than once?


Are you interested in earning $100,000 USD while being able to work from any location that is comfortable to you? Eager to join a development network of the most talented remote workers in the world?


If so, this role is for you. Through Crossover, youll earn the most competitive wage on the market, work with the best engineers in the field for a highly successful company looking to exponentially grow its adoption of Cloud services.


The Company:


Aurea is partnering with Crossover to hire the best and brightest Cloud Chief Architects. Aurea enables global enterprises to create transformative experiences for their end customers across a range of industries including retail, travel & hospitality, insurance, energy, life sciences, and insurance. Aurea products enable companies to build, execute, monitor, and optimize the end-to-end customer journey across multiple channels and touchpoints to maximize growth through a superior customer experience. Aurea serves over 2,000 customers worldwide.

Job Description:

You will play a critical role in designing and executing cloud-based architectures. This can range from orchestrating the deployment of centralised environments on AWS infrastructure, fresh design/build work in cloud-based environments like AWS and GCE, or adapting large existing infrastructures to an AWS deployment model. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex architectural problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources. As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery of multi-million dollar revenue per year enterprise software products, you will effectively work as the CTO of the engagement with a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to technical team leader to solution evangelist ensuring that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product.


Just as an example, one project includes migrating a large infrastructure consuming over 1,500 machines globally and storing over 5 petabytes of information into AWS. This role will include implementing profound architecture changes to get ready for the cloud, phased adoption of cloud-specific services, progressive removal of legacy technologies, with the ultimate goal of full migration into the AWS cloud.


Key responsibilities:

  • Developing product expertise in a short time frame.

  • Architecting new solutions or adapting existing ones to optimally run in a cloud-based environment (proper use of VMs and containers, queue-based architectures, services-oriented architectures, etc)

  • Owning the execution and implementation of migration strategies (this will include deployment/provisioning using DevOps tools, data migration, testing, cutover/failover of systems, configuration of monitoring and other production management systems)

  • Overseeing technical quality for the output of small teams of Software Engineers (requirements reviews, architectural reviews, and code reviews)

  • While showing technical leadership you will still be in charge of personally addressing the most technically challenging issues in the project. We count on you as the key technical person, not a people manager!

title: Speculative Applications  Software Engineer at iDirect (Cranfield, UK)
description:
At our Cranfield based Web Development Centre of Excellence, we are responsible for the development of a number key components of the iDirect product, as well as providing professional services, training and product support to our global user-base. Satellite networks are complex systems; configuration, maintenance, monitoring and reporting is made a lot easier with our innovative web-based Network Management System tools we develop here at Cranfield.


iDirect Pulse, our primary NMS, is made up of three key components; a C++ based Back-End which collects and caches real-time information from around the network, a JavaScript based Front-End which visualises this information for the user, and a Perl/Node based Middle-End, which acts as an interface between the BE and FE. All three components seamlessly work together to allow for management of the wider iDirect satellite platform.


Our organisation as a whole is very much Scrum/Agile focussed, and as such we work in diverse teams where thoughts and ideas are shared and collaboration is actively encouraged. This gives all our staff the opportunity to work across the product, really getting to understand exactly how and why it operates, and how it fits seamlessly within the larger iDirect communication platform.



About you:


We’re looking for the very best candidates to join us in Cranfield, where you will work alongside a wider team of smart, creative and dedicated colleagues. We value a good approach to problem solving, logical thinking and the enthusiasm, passion and ability to learn new skills quickly


Those who are successful within iDirect:



  • Are excited by and demonstrate a passion for the latest developments in web technology

  • Enjoy regularly coming up with clever, creative solutions to difficult problems

  • Have strong communication skills, and enjoy sharing ideas and knowledge with technical and non-technical colleagues across the globe

  • Show a strong ownership ethic

  • Display both flexibility and dedication to their work, colleagues and product

  • Show a genuine interest in learning about satellite communication

title: Platform Infrastructure Team Leads: Connect fantastic TV to audiences worldwide at Magine (Östermalm, Sweden)
description:
At Magine TV, we believe that it should be about what you want to watch, when and where you want to watch it. We call it TV for Me.


Our cloud-based streaming platform enables over 1 million users create personalised line-ups filled with their favourite shows all handily in one place with no contracts, no installation and no hassle.


We are building and maintaining all that is required to host a globally distributed video streaming platform (infrastructure, architecture, operations, latency, reliability, and uptime).


As developers we need to build software that will handle humongous™ load while still keeping low response times and correctness. We want our systems to be up for the challenges of the real world and we want you to join us in making it happen. 


Your role


We’re looking for experienced Software Engineering team leads experienced in Infrastructure Automation to help us further evolve our infrastructure to support a rapid growth of users and global expansion.


The objective for the infrastructure team is to ensure scalability, performance and high availability of our services and to help other teams to increase their productivity by providing a Platform-as-a-Service to the development teams.


If you like hands on work as well as being the point of reference for your colleagues this is the position for you.


Responsibilities



  • Team coordination and support in decision making processes.

  • Day to day hands on work responsibilities related to design and development of our global       distribution system.

  • Support team members and become their point of reference technically and organizationally.

  • Interface with other development teams and the operation team in order to negotiate technical solutions and guarantee a high level of efficiency of our Infrastructure.

  • Collaborate with and help people inside and outside of the team.

  • Transfer business knowledge from stakeholders to the team.

title: R&D Engineer at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
description:
The Opportunity


Zalando’s mission is to become the world’s leading platform for connecting fashion with people. This goal requires a massive expansion of our business functions. We will serve a wider range of customers in different ways, build new technologies to support our platform architecture and continue to innovate as we expand.


Zalando’s Innovation R&D Team focuses on strategic technical research supporting Zalando’s product vision. Research areas include 3D scanning, soft body physics simulation, and computer graphics (AR and VR). The small team consists of multi-focused computer scientists and researchers. 

What We're Looking For



  • Ph.D./M.S. in Computer Science, Mathematics or related engineering field

  • 4+ years of relevant industry or academic experience

  • Mastery of C++ and one garbage collected language

  • Familiarity with 3D vector math (matrix and quaternion algebra, calculating intersections of geometric primitives, etc.)

  • You can quickly prototype an application and have sufficient knowledge about front-end frameworks, databases, and mobile platforms

  • Strong Research & Development experience

  • Team player with the ability to work in a collaborative environment

  • Creative, resourceful, and innovative problem solver

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English

  • Experience with Linux and Amazon Web Services (desired)


Your Responsibilities



  • Driving and contributing to projects around various technological challenges (e.g. 3D scanning, soft body physics simulation, and computer graphics (AR, and VR))

  • Give vital impulses to the R&D team’s decision making process

  • Solve some of the most challenging technological challenges of our time while working in a team towards achieving a common goal as efficiently as possible

  • Identify and share your knowledge of state-of-the-art technologies, related scientific research, as well as related developments in the startup and open source scene

  • Contribute to  the architecture and coding best practices for the R&D team’s systems

  • Represent Zalando at conferences and meetups, give technical talks and help to recruit great technical talent



What You Can Expect From Us

Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties and events.

Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.

Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences and meetups, and encouragement to publish work.

Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.

Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.



About Zalando

Zalando is Europe's leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast - with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams - and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It's how we grow.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!

title: Technical Program Manager 100K at Crossover () (allows remote)
description:
Do you get excited when you read Ben Horowitzs definition of a good product owner? Do you love bringing valuable software products to market? Do you have a strong technical background so that you can work closely with the engineering teams, but at the same time do you have an excellent understanding of product lifecycles? If so, this role is for you.

We are looking for a world-class Technical Program Manager to help us define and build the software products that underpin our continued success. In this hands-on role, you will orchestrate the delivery of your products, from setting specifications to execution and continual refinement, as you receive feedback from Product Managers and other stakeholders.

You will be working directly with our engineering teams to make our roadmap become real products. As a result, we are looking for a person that has a good technical software background. We will be measuring your performance based on the volume of quality features being released to production, which emphasizes how tightly you will be working with the various execution teams.

This is a completely remote position. You can work from anywhere, and will be collaborating with people from all over the world. Therefore, strong communication and presentation skills will be crucial for your success.


Company Description:

Aurea enables global enterprises to create transformative experiences for their end customers across a range of industries including retail, travel & hospitality, energy, life sciences, and insurance. Aurea products enable companies to build, execute, monitor, and optimize the end-to-end customer journey across multiple channels and touchpoints to maximize growth through a superior customer experience. Aurea serves over 2,000 customers worldwide.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Work with the product team to define the product roadmap that will add significant value to Aurea

  • Create and prioritize the product backlog

  • Coordinate end-to-end delivery of multiple projects across multiple engineering teams

  • Work with our engineering teams daily in one scrum team to go from comps to working software

  • Create detailed working packages from Product Managers specifications

  • Review the features delivered by the engineering teams and demo them to Product Manager

  • Manage a development process with an expected weekly (or faster) production release within a fast-changing and highly agile framework

  • Work Primarily with tech-heavy projects


Total compensation: $100,000/year

Location: Global (remote)

40 hours per week

title: iOS Developer at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online hotel reservation service in the world) is looking for an iOS developer to join our team in our Amsterdam headquarters.  As a member of our IT Production Team, you’ll be given the freedom to make meaningful and measurable improvements that impact millions of people. You’ll be working on 7000+ boxes placed in multiple, live, data centers around the world, as well as working within one of the biggest e-commerce companies in the world.  


B.responsible


Booking.com is all about teamwork and it's what keeps us motivated. We push the limits of our open source technology stack as we solve the challenges that come along with scaling to meet the phenomenal growth of Booking.com. As iOS developer you will:



  • Maintain and enhance our iOS application

  • Translate requirements and mock-ups into fully functioning features

  • Develop new and existing iOS applications features

  • Provide estimates on development cycles

  • Implement conversion experiments (A/B tests)

  • Partner with designers to help define and implement User Interface improvements

  • Work with team members on server-side integration


B.ig Bonus



  • Experience with Apple Approval & Distribution Process, Ad Hoc & Enterprise Distribution

  • SQL knowledge and/or willingness to learn

  • Have built an approved store App

  • Experience working with A/B testing

  • You are passionate about open source and contribute

  • You’re not afraid to solve deep technical challenges of a whole new level at a huge scale

  • You have an intrinsic curiosity in technological innovations and you are always on top of the latest trends


B.offered


We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.  We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits.  IT also has monthly hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences.


This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in the Netherlands.We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

title: DevOps Engineer (m/f) at askCharlie GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:
We are looking for a DevOps Engineer (m/f) who maintains, grows, and optimizes our development infrastructure. In this role, you work closely with our development team and enable them to ship faster and more securely.


Your responsibilities



  • Maintain and improve our AWS infrastructure

  • Further develop the monitoring for all our services

  • Scale our infrastructure with high availability in mind

  • Work on the migration from our current PaaS to pure AWS solution

  • Share your experience about building a reliable and immutable infrastructure by documenting processes and consulting your colleagues

title: Senior Rendering Engineer for PlayStation 4 - CRYENGINE at Crytek GmbH (Frankfurt, Germany)
description:
Crytek is looking for a Senior Rendering Engineer for the PlayStation 4 Console to join the CRYENGINE R&D team in our Frankfurt, Germany studio.


At Crytek we hire amazing people to make great things happen.


For over 15 years, we’ve been at the cutting-edge of computer graphics performance. We continually invest in our team and tech as we push the boundaries of the digital visual arts on the latest platforms.


Our award-winning CRYENGINE empowers developers and creatives at our own studios and licensees worldwide – from small indies to AAA powerhouses - to deliver unique experiences, create new worlds and ultimately make awesome games.


Join us and we’ll invent the future together.


Key Responsibilities:



  • Develop and maintain CRYENGINE's cutting-edge rendering system.

  • Research, prototype and implement scalable solutions for high-quality rendering in a realtime context.

  • Perform CPU and GPU performance profiling and optimization on several high-end platforms.

  • Work closely with artists and content creators to build up highly efficient production workflows.

  • Work with game teams to achieve visually stunning game experiences.

  • Collaborate with other engineers to form a highly creative and productive team.

title: Senior Front-End Developer at eMerchantPay (Sofia, Bulgaria)
description:
We have a great delivery culture, without any scent of bureaucracy, and ship software often. We use the latest stable Ruby/Rails versions, and on the front-end side we are happily employing Bootstrap, jQuery, and React. We are looking for enthusiastic web hackers, especially those with long-term experience in the front-end, whatever the stack.



  • Design and develop innovative web front-end applications and components

  • Actively communicate and cooperate with the system analysts, backend developers, and QAs

  • Performing TDD/BDD using various tools like RSpec

title: Senior Software Engineer (m/f) at crealytics GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
description:
To strengthen our international team in Berlin, we are offering a full-time position as


                                   Senior Software Engineer (m/f)


We enable leading international e-commerce companies drive performance in product advertising and paid search globally in more than 20 languages. In 2015, we generated over one billion Euro in client revenue. We support our clients out of our four offices in Berlin, Passau, London, and New York.


// Your responsibilities



  • As Senior Software Engineer you lead, develop and execute our new product strategy around programmatic ad selling

  • You design and implement the platform that requires real-time constraints and complex, yet powerful software solutions

  • You work closely with other engineers and our Product team, to not only make these systems perform faster and support data at scale, but also to build revolutionary new features for our clients

  • You work collaboratively with other engineering teams to ensure real-time technology integrates seamlessly with other pieces of the platform


// Your profile



  • You bring a Computer Science BA/BS degree and 6+ years of experience OR a MS degree and 3+ years of experience in software engineering

  • You have experience in building high performance, multi-threaded, distributed systems / applications, preferably in a Java 8 /PHP environment

  • You bring previous work experience in AdTech, click tracking, ad servers, SSP´s, DSP´s and DMP´s

  • You are experienced with real-time data processing engines as well as low latency systems

  • You bring excellent Computer Science fundamentals with regards to data structures, sorting algorithms, time complexity, etc.

  • You have experience working with external development teams, Ruby, Python and online marketing is a plus, e.g. Universal Analytics and Google AdWords


// What we offer



  • Contribute to a unique software product that continues to excite us and our customers daily

  • We offer challenges and encourage your personal development, offering individual external and internal training, conference visits, and regular appraisals

  • You will take responsibility from day one and work in a great, agile team of diverse, smart, and passionate people from more than 20 nationalities

  • We regularly provide you with deep insights into our business strategy and offer the chance to shape crealytics with your input and ideas

  • You will benefit from our flexible working hours, our great relocation support, and depending on your tasks, we invite you to work in our Passau office from time to time – accommodation is provided!


If you would like to become part of our success story and think you would make a great addition to our team, Ann-Marie Hennemuth will gladly receive your application with the subject line “Senior Software Engineer (m/f) SO” in English at talents@crealytics.com. Please make sure to include your earliest possible starting date and your salary expectations.


www.crealytics.com

title: Senior Software Engineer, Recommendation & Personalization at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
description:
THE OPPORTUNITY

As a software engineer in the area of "Recommendation & Personalization" you are working on Zalando state-of-the-art recommendation systems serving millions of customers with highly relevant and personalized content. You will be working with the newest technologies to build a SAAS component which can be fully leveraged within our Zalando platform.



Your main challenges will include working with large amounts of data, deliver high-quality recommendation results and at the same time provide a low-latency, rock solid and auto-scaling production system. You will be part of an autonomous and highly ambitious team consisting of experienced software engineers and expert data scientists working on the cutting-edge every day.


WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR



  • You have 4+ years of experience, working as a (Java or Scala) developer. A technical degree is a plus

  • You have in-depth experience of working with data-driven recommendation solutions, including creating, implementing, and tuning recommendation engines

  • You have worked with current Big Data technology (e.g. Hadoop/MapReduce)

  • You are experienced in building and deploying large-scale, distributed data-driven systems in a cloud environment

  • You are keen on collaborating closely with Data Scientists & Data Analysts and have passion to solve algorithmic problems

  • You have a keen interest in Data Mining & Processing as well as applied Machine Learning

  • You’ve worked with NoSQL databases before (e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB) and ideally also have experience in search engines (Solr, Elasticsearch)

  • You write well-structured and tested code in the spirit of Effective Java and Clean Code that easily scales to enterprise level

  • You love to improve & optimize software and to use new technologies

  • Knowledge of near-realtime stream processing and/or message-driven architectures (e.g. Spark, Storm, Aerospike, Kafka) is a plus

  • Experience with Cloud Computing platforms such as AWS is a plus


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • You will be part of an agile and very experienced team that will further develop our recommender systems in short release cycles

  • You will build and operate all services and stream-processed data infrastructure for low-latency personalized recommendations

  • You will implement highly-scalable solutions with state-of-the-art-technologies together with your team

  • You are ready to tweak and optimize our recommendations for various markets all across Europe for millions of customers

  • You will transfer algorithmic prototypes to enterprise level, highly-scalable and fault-tolerant solutions using the right technology for the job

  • You are collaborating with our data scientists to improve and extend our recommendation engine and other analytical customer experience solutions

  • You will be part of a multi-cultural team with different native languages, skills and backgrounds

  • Design, develop, deploy, operate and improve software solutions that impact millions of Zalando customers


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US


Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties and events.


Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences and meetups, and encouragement to publish work.


Work Environment. Self-organized,  autonomous teams and flexible working hours.


Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.




WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!

title: Senior Software Engineer, Search & Browse at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
description:
THE OPPORTUNITY

As a software engineer in the area of "Search & Browse" you will focus on developing Zalando's in-house search engine service providing highly relevant personalized search results helping millions of people find their favorite fashion items. You will be working with state-of-the-art technology to build a SAAS component which can be fully leveraged within our Zalando platform.
Your main challenges will include working with large amounts of data, deliver high-quality search results and also provide a high-performance, stable and auto-scaling production system. You will be part of a small, autonomous, and highly ambitious team consisting of experienced Scala developers and expert data scientists pushing "Fashion Search" one step further every day.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR



  • You have 3+ years of experience, working as a Scala Developer (or with any other functional programming language). A technical degree is a plus.

  • You are experienced with lucene-based technologies like Solr/ElasticSearch

  • You are keen on collaborating closely with Data Scientists & Data Analysts

  • A keen interest in applied Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing and Data Mining is essential, work experience in these topics a plus

  • You write well-structured and tested code in the spirit of Effective Java and Clean Code that easily scales to Enterprise level

  • You love to optimize processes & code and to use new technologies

  • You are experienced in building, evaluating, maintaining and improving large-scale, data-driven products

  • You have worked with current Big Data technology (e.g. Hadoop/MapReduce, Amazon EMR)

  • Knowing near-realtime stream processing and/or message-driven architectures (e.g. Spark, Storm, Aerospike, Kafka) is a plus

  • Experience with Cloud Computing platforms such as AWS is a plus


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • You will be part of an agile and very experienced team that will further develop our search pipeline in short release cycles

  • You will implement highly-scalable solutions with state-of-the-art-technologies together with your team

  • You are ready to tweak and optimize our search for various markets all across Europe with more than a dozen different languages

  • You will transfer algorithmic prototypes to enterprise level, highly-scalable and fault-tolerant solutions using the right technology for the job

  • You are collaborating with our data scientists to improve and extend our search engine and other analytical customer experience solutions

  • You will be part of a multi-cultural team with different native languages, skills and backgrounds

  • Design, develop, deploy, operate & improve software solutions that impact millions of Zalando customers


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US


Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties and events.


Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences and meetups, and encouragement to publish work.


Work Environment. Self-organized,  autonomous teams and flexible working hours.


Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.




WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!

title: Cyber Security Expert Medical Devices (m/f) Rotkreuz - Switzerland at Roche Diagnostics International AG (Kornwestheim, Deutschland)
description:
Roche Diagnostic's Cyber Security Department works globally to ensure that the products that we develop are secured, and remain secured.


As a Cyber Security Expert, your main responsibilities will include:



  • Coordinate and drive the necessary initiatives within the Diagnostic Division to achieve the integration of Cyber Security aspects in the development of new products and in the update/upgrade, maintenance and support of existing products.

  • Coordinate closely with relevant functions of the Diagnostics Business Areas, Global Functions and contracted solution providers to support Divisional Cyber Security goals.

  • Define and propagate processes in the areas of Cyber Security to enable continuous compliance of product development and maintenance processes.

  • Support Cyber Security related Product Risk Management activities, including risk identification, risk rating, selection and verification of risk mitigation and assessment of residual risks.

  • Provide expertise to identify Cyber Security vulnerabilities in released products, performing proactive monitoring of off-the-shelf software and assessing the associated Product- and Business Risks

  • Ensure that Product Teams can respond to identified vulnerabilities, by providing technical vulnerability investigation, coordinating vulnerability response across multiple affected products, and planning risk remediation activities

  • Consult country sales affiliates and product case handling units in Product Cyber Security related issues

title: Cloud Backend Software Developer (f/m) (110339) at BMW Group (München, Deutschland)
description:
THE SOURCE CODE TO THE FUTURE IS DEVELOPED HERE.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR DEVELOPING SOFTWARE.


To revolutionise the future of mobility, one has to go ahead and set standards today. Intelligent technologies that are increasingly taking over driving tasks and providing greater safety and comfort are already in use in our vehicles. Increasing our lead in autonomous driving will need visionary thinkers and creative developers. Specialists in the fields of machine learning, artificial intelligence, sensor technology and software development will work in expert teams, in centres centres of excellence networked around the world, to redefine the limits of what is possible.


Cloud Backend Software Developer (f/m)


We are offering you an interesting position at the BMW Group as a Software Developer (f/m) in the field of vehicle location-based services. Digitalisation will dominate the future development of new automobiles. The use of vehicle sensor data and swarm intelligence of a networked fleet as well as the high-performance, efficient processing and aggregation of data in back end systems form the basis for new customer functions. In this, a special role is played by geospatial data, as the streets and their environments constitute the space in which vehicles move about. As part of your role, you will work in a dynamic and challenging environment in order to develop and safeguard digitally networked services for the vehicles of the future and ensure their smooth function in our vehicles. As a developer, you will work as part of a scrum team to work out and assess appropriate functions and contrive technical solutions that you will implement and put into operation yourself. Depending on the role, a DevOps approach is also conceivable. Your duties will include the provision of interfaces for vehicles as well as basic safety in the vehicle.

title: Senior Agile Coach (m/f) in Berlin or Munich at FlixBus (Berlin, Germany)
description:
FlixBus is a European long distance mobility provider with headquarters in Munich, Berlin, Milan, Paris and Zagreb. Since 2013, FlixBuses have offered a new, convenient and green way to travel which suits every budget.
