title: Senior Software Engineer - Android at Noom (New York, NY)
description:
Noom's scientifically proven behavior change programs take the uncertainty out of creating a healthier lifestyle, reliably delivering health outcomes, and we are tackling some of the biggest diseases out there (Type-II Diabetes, Obesity, and Hypertension to name a few). Our engineering team is at the forefront of this challenge, solving complex technical and UX problems on our mobile apps that center around habits, behavior, and lifestyle.


We are looking for an experienced software engineer with a strong understanding of complex native mobile applications to help set the direction for Android as we scale. You will be making significant contributions to feature development on our existing applications, keeping up-to-date with latest trends in the Android ecosystem, use your best judgment about which ones fit well, and be thoughtful when rolling them out. You will also be a core contributor to the maintenance and improvement of our existing systems. As a senior member of the engineering team, you will also be a teacher and a leader, providing guidance, education, and support to the rest of the team on all things Android.



What We’re Looking For:



  • 3-4 years of large-scale android experience in a team environment

  • Experience in Java, Android Studio, and resource layouts. Gradle, Python and Javascript a plus!

  • Ability to write code that is well structured, idiomatic, reusable, and easy to understand

  • Excellent communicator: comfort explaining technical problems in person and in writing

  • Team player: enjoys teaching new concepts to, and collaborating with, the team

  • User-oriented: thoughtfulness when considering both our growing and our legacy users when implementing new features and updates, placing them as the priority

  • Strong sense of responsibility and ownership; you will have come from an environment in which people are responsible for their own code

title: Agile Test Developers at SimCorp A/S (København, Denmark)
description:
We are transforming our Product Division to become a scaled agile development organisation characterised by high quality results, high performance and high people engagement. In our Technology Agile Release Train (ART) we are eight teams. We are for two of these teams looking for a total of two testers including you who are an experienced tester with the skills, interest and technical competences needed to build and maintain automated test suites.


With your tester background, you excel in finding the bugs in our code before it is released and you make sure that a good portion of the test cases is automated in test suites that you build, maintain and extend. These test suites are to be used as firm and rich quality gates and included in Product Division’s continuous integration scheme, upon which our agile way of working so strongly relies. You will work closely with your developer colleagues in the team to understand requirements, design and implementation, to challenge them and to find weak spots as early as possible.

title: Senior Software Engineer at Sievo (Helsinki, Finland)
description:
We are looking for a team member to  our agile and experienced Technology team which is responsible for the development, operation and maintenance of our SaaS solution. At Sievo, working with our software solution means managing large data sets and enterprise wide solutions, developing a robust platform and offering outstanding user experience to our customers.


As a Senior Software Engineer you will



  • Collaborate with team members to define and implement new features to our product

  • Maintain and improve the existing code base

  • Act as a go-to person and guide to our junior developers

  • Improve our deployment pipeline

  • Investigate new technologies

title: DevOps at a lead Software Defined Networking Company at Nuage Networks (Mountain View, CA)
description:
We are looking for a devops engineer at one of our engineering locations: Mountain View (California, US), Raleigh (North Carolina, US), Antwerp (Belgium), Bratislava (Slovakia).


As part of the infra team, you work in coordination with the main office in California to :



  • maintain the build system of the Nuage Virtualized Services platform, ensuring quality and consistency of the builds generated by our continuous integration system

  • manage source code repositories and continuous integration

  • overlook the test infrastructure, where we simulate most of the major cloud environments (VMware, KVM, Openstack, Cloudstack, Openshift, Kubernetes)

  • maintain and develop the core infrastructure of Nuage engineering, provision and monitor servers, develop integration scripts written in Python and Bash, and keep the whole environment secure

  • work with engineering leads to develop testing platforms and methodologies in new areas of the Nuage platform

title: Transform Healthcare: Looking for Javascript Ninja: React, GraphQL, React-Native at iHealth Labs, Inc. (Sunnyvale, CA)
description: As a member of iHealth Enterprise Solution team, you will have the opportunity to work with a group of talented people to build world-class digital health web and mobile apps using cutting edge technologies. We expect you to innovate, work hard, have fun, and share ideas regularly. You will develop product details by working closely with other engineers and product managers. You will be responsible for seeing product features and/or projects through the full development life cycle.

title: Website Sysadmin / Tech Support - Melb Australia at Powerfront (Richmond, Australia)
description:
Are you an IT Support professional with at least 5 years IT support experience?


Would you like to join a fast growing company with a fantastic culture?


Powerfront is looking for talented Sysadmin / Technical Support Engineer to support our Powerfront CMS platform.


We are a dedicated, passionate and close knit team with technology running through our veins. We're reinventing the world of eCommerce software; we're not developing small applications. We have developed software that transforms the way companies run their online business. You'll use the latest technologies. Every day, you'll be challenged. A career at Powerfront is your opportunity to become a leader in the future of the software industry.


Responsibilities



  • Management of systems ensuring maximum system availability by maintaining a stable, standard and secure technology platform

  • Monitoring, administration and management of server/network infrastructure (internal and hosted)

  • Support server, network and desktop hardware, software and applications

  • Installing patches and security upgrades on server infrastructure

  • Use formal Change Request process for making changes to infrastructure. 

  • Provide help-desk support to clients and resellers by phone or email using the Helpdesk Ticket system

  • Stress Testing Sites

  • Client email support

  • Copying Client Sites & Client data

  • Provide dedicated support during system critical & high platform availability incidents as a key member of the 24x7 incident response team

  • Plan Manage and implement authorised infrastructure projects e.g. server optimisation, firewall replacement, setup U.S. hosting services etc.

  • Disaster recovery plan development, implementation and maintenance

  • Documentation of all systems configurations and processes



Values we look for



  • Honesty, Caring, Self-Improvement, Confidence, Fun, Productivity and Toughness.

  • Showing an eagerness to grow and learn more about the business. This includes asking questions, reading, modelling others, and being open and responsive to feedback/areas of improvement.

  • Exhibit professionalism and commitment to role, the company and creation of the product.

title: Cloud Ops Engineer at Nuxeo (Paris, France)
description:
We are looking for a Cloud Operations Engineer to join small but high-end team dedicated in building SaaS offering for Nuxeo based on container technologies.


The candidate will be based either in Paris, France or New York, USA. The candidate will need to have the legal right to work in the country where they applying, either France or USA.


Primary Responsibilities


Your role will be to help define, build and deploy the hosting infrastructure:



  • Provisioning and monitoring of hosts & VMs

  • Deployment and monitoring of containers

  • Administration and Security of the network

  • Monitoring and reporting of the applications

  • Addressing security concerns


You will work directly with developers and architects and you will be expected to bring the “Ops” view: you will contribute to the design of the system with the goal to make operation easy and safe.


You are expected to be a real technician and to not be afraid by experiencing new tools or coding.


The target technical environment includes:



  • System: Linux/*NIX

  • Cloud Providers: AWS EC2 & Google CE

  • AWS tools: EC2, Cloudformation, VPC, IAM ...

  • Deployment: Ansible, Vagrant,

  • Containers: Docker, Compose, Swarm, Kubernetes, Rancher

  • Monitoring: Datadog, Sumologic, Syslog

  • Security: Firewall, Iptables, AWS Security Group, IDS

  • Versioning: GIT

title: Engineering Project Leader (f/m)  Automotive Infotainment at Cinemo GmbH (Karlsruhe, Germany)
description:
We build cutting-edge, world-first and unique technologies for multimedia, media management, device connectivity and cloud that drives the performance and possibilities of tomorrow's passengers.


As aEngineering Project Leader, you will work directly with our customers, top brand automotive companies, and lead projects for integration of our next-generationembedded multimedia C/C++ middleware. You will ensure that your projects are running successful, from technical, quality and execution part. This role requires an energetic and motivated individual with strong communication, organization, and technical skills who works well in a fast-paced dynamic environment.


Our strength is our focus on performance, high-quality and service.


To support this, we need the best engineers and creative minds to thrive in our culture. 


If you enjoy writing high quality code, love C and have strong technical skills, are an enjoyable person, and want your code to end one day in millions of cars driving the future, then you are at the right place at Cinemo!

title: Mobile Apps Quality Assurance Engineer - Online Travel at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
description:
Mobile App Quality Assurance Engineer



Thailand, Bangkok





This role requires good technical knowledge of native mobile iOS and Android applications , while at the same time ability to analyze, understand, and foresee production issues and potential impact



Responsibilities:



The Mobile App Quality Assurance Engineer role at Agoda is an integral part of the development process. Successful candidates will be responsible for the following tasks:

  • Act as owner of quality assurance strategy and ensure is it practiced throughout assigned scrum team(s)
  • Ensure appropriate level of testing activities are performed across design, development, testing and deployment processes
  • Define, design and implement test automation approach to achieve maximum coverage with minimum execution window
  • Understand the business benefits and KPI for changes and ensure these can be measured effectively
  • Drive the velocity of product development together with scrum team




Skills & Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or any related field
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in quality assurance or any related experience in native mobile applications
  • Automation testing experience in Xcode UI automation or Espresso
  • Good command of English (speaking, writing, and reading)
  • Experience in Agile Methodology is preferred
  • Ability to identify and escalate issues in an appropriate and timely manner
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision and commitment to the ensure team schedules and goals are met
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Good analytical and problem solving skills

title: Softwareentwickler at F&M Werkzeug- und Maschinenbau GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:
Wir sind ein junges Berliner Startup in der Gründungsphase. Wir wollen innovative, datengetriebene Produkte für kleine und mittlere Unternehmen entwickeln und dabei nicht weniger als eine Revolution der Industrie 4.0 auslösen. Dafür sind wir auf der Suche nach kreativen Köpfen, die sich für unsere Projekte begeistern können und diese gemeinsam mit uns umsetzen wollen.


Zur Zeit sind wir noch Teil der F&M Maschinen- und Werkzeugbau GmbH, die sich seit 2010 einen Namen im Bereich der Lohnzerspanung erarbeitet hat. In Kooperation mit der Hch Perschmann GmbH wollen wir unsere Ideen für die Digitalisierung unserer Branche in Form revolutionärer Produkte und Services weiterentwickeln und vertreiben. Zu diesem Zweck möchten wir unser Team um einen Softwareentwickler (m/f) vergrößern.


Wir bieten dir (die Möglichkeit) …



  • bei der Gründung eines Unternehmens Einfluss zu nehmen und Prozesse und Strukturen nach deinen Wünschen mitzugestalten.

  • in einem jungen, interdisziplinären Team zu arbeiten und voneinander zu lernen.

  • deine Fähigkeiten und Kenntnisse im Bereich Industrie 4.0 und IoT auszubauen.

  • flexible Arbeitszeiten und Bedingungen.

  • eine angenehme Arbeitsatmosphäre inklusive Feierabend-Bier und gelegentlichem gemeinsamen Grillens.


Deine Aufgaben wären unter anderem  ...



  • die Entwicklung von Datenstrukturen und Protokollen,

  • die Entwicklung von Schnittstellen zu großen Frameworks und Programmiersprachen,

  • die Integration von Tools zur Verarbeitung und Analyse großer Datenmengen in Echtzeit.


Deswegen wünschen wir uns von dir …



  • ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium im Bereich Informatik o.ä.

  • Erfahrung im Bereich Softwareentwicklung und Softwarearchitektur und der dazugehörigen Konzepte (OoP, Design Pattern, Agile Methoden)

  • Erfahrungen mit der Auswertung und Verarbeitung von Daten mit Schwerpunkt auf Methoden der Signalverarbeitung und des Maschinellen Lernens

  • Idealerweise Erfahrung mit C#/Python/Matlab


Darüber hinaus solltest du …



  • eine Leidenschaft für durchdachte, schlanke und funktionale Software haben.

  • die Notwendigkeit neue Fähigkeiten zu erlernen als Entwicklungsmöglichkeit sehen.

  • die englische Sprache in Wort und Schrift beherrschen.

  • sowohl selbstständig als auch teamorientiert arbeiten können.


Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung inklusive der üblichen Unterlagen und deiner Gehaltsvorstellung unter: j.broenstrup@fm-maschinenbau.de


Solltest du noch Fragen haben, erreichst du uns auch unter 030 30398087 (Jonas Brönstrup).

title: User Experience Developer at New York University (New York, NY)
description: The User Experience (UX) Developer works amongst an internal team of professionals and occasional third-party vendors to engineer and maintain secure and efficient solutions for NYU.edu and NYU's related online ventures. Responsibilities include the development of secure, standards-compliant, cross-browser code, and for fixing and resolving bugs/defects in support of the positive digital representation of central NYU and success of highly visible, enterprise, digital properties.

title: Senior PHP Developer at Holidaypirates Group (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:
Do you spend your time thinking about how to make things you’ve already made, better? 
Do you get excited when you are able to implement something completely new where the only limitation is your imagination? 
When you come across a new piece of technology, do you automatically think of all the amazing new superpowers it will give you and new things that you will be able to do with them? 

Yo-ho-ho! Then you are the pirate we are looking for!


We are a web technology incubator company operating in Berlin with some of Germany’s biggest and fastest growing web and mobile properties. We are currently looking for a PHP developer to join our team to help us improve on some of our existing products and make them more awesome!

title: BI Developer at eVision Industry Software (Den Haag, Netherlands)
description:
As market leaders, we have high expectations of ourselves – quality, reliability, safety of our products – and strive for continuous improvement. We work with the best, to be the best, and the secret of our success is simple: we keep learning and exploring. We’ve set our eyes on the world – we want to offer our safety software globally, to complex businesses in many industries. Care to join us?


As an integral member of our product team, the Business Intelligence (BI) Developer is responsible for the entire development cycle of our mission-critical enterprise BI solution. Working with cross-functional teams, you will take responsibility not only for design and development of the platform but quality assurance and maintenance as well.


Using your skills and experience as a BI Developer, you will then shape the underlying architecture of our data warehouse according to business needs identified and projected by the Product Manager.


We are looking for BI Developers.


Accountabilities:


As a Business Intelligence Developer within eVision, your accountabilities will include (but not be limited to):



  • Participate in design and analysis of our solutions

  • Assist Product Manager with translating business requirements into product specifications

  • Implement and guard technology best practices, guidelines and development processes

  • Work closely with Chief Architect to ensure seamless integration with our core products

  • Streamline Quality Assurance by automating tests

  • Provide support to eVision Professional Services to ensure the availability and performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal stakeholders

  • Provide technical assistance and cross training to other team members and Professional Services teams

title: Go/Ruby Developer for our new Data Pipeline! at Geckoboard (Greater London, UK)
description:
WHO WE ARE


Thousands of businesses use Geckoboard to build TV Dashboards that help drive growth and focus teams, by taking the complexity out of connecting their data and understanding it at a glance. Some of our customers include Airbnb, Slack, Netflix and Skyscanner.


We have a lot of interesting, creative work ahead and are looking for curious problem solvers to reimagine how our customers get their data into Geckoboard. You'll be joining a friendly team with great people in an environment with empowered developers, flexible working conditions, and a focus on skill development. 


LIFE AT GECKOBOARD


We’re constantly striving to ensure that we offer the most encouraging, supportive and efficient environment possible. We want everyone on the team to be empowered to influence our architectural decisions. The whole team is involved in prioritising and evaluating our work and we regularly program in pairs to share knowledge, promote collaboration, and improve our code quality.


We don't just pay lip service to work-life balance, we actively and strongly encourage it. Flexible working hours and the ability to regularly work from home lets you work in a way that fits you and your family. We see our contractual obligation to offer 25 days' paid holiday as a lower bound, rather than a limit.


We actively contribute to personal and professional development and have a minimum budget allowance to be spent on courses, conferences, and books. We also run fortnightly "Innovation Wednesdays", where everyone has complete freedom to work on anything that interests them, from contributing to open source, to learning a new skill, or improving our internal tools and processes.


Here are some examples of our Innovation Wednesday projects:



  • We built and open sourced Prism, a targeted profiling tool for Go

  • We implemented the UDP network protocol in Ruby

  • We wired up our office coffee maker to Slack

  • We built and open sourced Everdeen, a mocking HTTP proxy server in Go

  • We built a Slack bot to help with organising Team Lunch on Friday

title: Backend Developer - C#, Java, Python - Leading e-commerce co. at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
description:
Come work for Agoda

We are a big technology company, but this opportunity is specifically for an important role on a small team. This ambitious team is thinking every day about how to use the latest technology to build new exciting services that will be used by millions of people. We really need someone special to join us and help lead the back end development.

Work will focus on building a service that combines many different 3rd party API integrations.

You must be confident in code quality and execution, working in an agile team.

Industry knowledge and understanding of the e-commerce and B2B SaaS is a plus.

Office location - Bangkok, Thailand.

Technology you should be comfortable with or interested in learning: OpenStack, SQL, Go, Python, RabbitMQ, Redis, C#, REST API's

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Implementation of API endpoints for data manipulation and processes.
  • Build and maintain core application features.
  • Write unit and integration tests.
  • Collaborate in all project planning.
  • Work with both front-end and back-end web developers.
  • Prioritise tasks and coordinate work within the team.
  • Engaging with current team to improve and optimise current code and planning practices.
  • Be prepared to lead strategic technology decisions.
  • Take responsibility for successful delivery of solutions.
  • You will also be bridging the gap between the user experience and the server-side infrastructure, taking an active role on both.


YOU WILL BE A GREAT FIT IF
  • You are passionate about TDD.
  • You care about both user experience and developer experience.
  • You write DRY, readable, and modular code.
  • Are interested in learning new programming languages and tools.


RECOMMENDED SKILLS (NOT 100% REQUIRED):
  • Strong experience building and improving scalable applications.
  • Experience with using ORM and MVC frameworks.
  • Experience with HTTP, WebSocket, and Message Queue protocols.
  • Experience designing and building Restful APIs using Django Rest Framework.
  • Ability to learn and integrate 3rd party API's quickly into existing applications.
  • Ability to work independently and manage projects with many moving parts.
  • Familiarity with session and authentication best practices, access control, and preventing CSRF.
  • Familiarity with how front-end frameworks work such as Angular, Backbone, React JS, etc.
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git, GitHub.
  • Be willing to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from them.


This is a permanent, full time position working on-site in our offices at Central World in downtown Bangkok, Thailand. We are open to candidates from all nationalities and will help with relocation if you are not currently based here.

title: Lead UI Artist (Games) at DIGIT Game Studios (Dublin, Ireland)
description:
Our goals for this role



  • Your goal is to help DIGIT continue the growth of our hit title Kings of the Realm

  • You will bring our title to the next level, helping DIGIT to truly push the boundaries of UI design in the game

  • As Lead UI Artist, you will be hands on, as well as leading a small experienced team of games UI designers.


Here's what you will be doing



  • Provide art direction and own the UI for the game

  • Rapidly deliver intuitive and rewarding user interfaces to millions of players for all new game features

  • Design fully responsive user interfaces, that work seamlessly across multiple mobile devices

  • Concept, create and validate UI designs for the game (from user flows through to release)

  • Assist in rapid iterations and testing ideas (using wireframes and sketches, in-engine mockups etc.)

  • Create clean and easy to implement UI assets, which can seamlessly move straight over to the development team and into games production

  • Own the UI pipeline - create and define style guides and monitor consistency and quality across your team

  • Lead and technically manage a small skilled team of UI designers - review work daily, act as technical mentor and guide, set goals etc.

  • Guide the UI vision and art direction across the team (explorations, colour, composition, iconography etc.)

  • Innovate and try new things - always push the quality bar on every single topic.

title: Site Reliability Engineer Go(lang) at JustWatch GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:
Your responsibilities:

- You will continuously improve developer experience with fast builds, quick (canary) deployments and ChatOps
- You will care about great metrics and sane alerting at a low false-positive rate
- You will make distributed systems reliable, fault tolerant and highly available
- You will build immutable infrastructure based on the 12factor methodology, incorporating cluster, configuration and credentials management

- You will write lots of software too, always striving for the highest level of automatization and sharpening your engineering skills

title: Senior Research Engineer - Algorithms (Scala, Restful API's) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
description:
THE OPPORTUNITY

Zalando Technology is one of the most collaborative places you can imagine. Partnerships happen with all key engineering and product teams, the Zalando Research unit, and with the international tech community outside of Zalando. We are looking for research engineers to work on a broad set of real-world practical problems of massive scale that will have a direct and significant business impact.

As a Research Engineer, you will conduct algorithmic research, plus design and build the optimization engines for all logistics operations for Zalando. Your solutions will save millions of Euros and improve customer experience with faster package deliveries. You will have the freedom to challenge our status-quo and help us define best practices for how we work.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR



  • A degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or other similar quantitative field (PhD, M.Sc.)

  • At least three years of professional / academic programming experience in an object oriented language or Scala

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills and a demonstrated ability to find creative solutions to algorithmic problems

  • Knowledge of graph theory, combinatorics and optimization methods

  • Experience in mathematical or algorithmic research

  • Willingness to work with microservice architecture, distributed systems and RESTful APIs

  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services

  • Effective communication skills and ability to understand business requirements

  • Deep skepticism of, plus the ability to identify and debunk buzzword mumbo jumbo, false assumptions and analysis

  • English language fluency




Additional Preferred Skills



  • Experience with building and / or running large-scale applications

  • Demonstrated expertise and desire to work hands-on in analyzing and modeling large data sets




YOUR ROLE



  • Research, design and implement algorithms to improve our optimization engines

  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability

  • Communicate effectively with our engineering and data science teams and use agile processes

  • Be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment

  • Play a critical role in the team as a creative research engineer working on key results

  • Understand and communicate effectively with internal business customers, partners, and stakeholders

  • Think abstractly and discover correlations between problems, methodologies, and solutions.

  • Implement possible solutions, evaluate outcomes, and update research direction according to business goals and constraints

  • Follow a feature through its entire lifetime from problem formulation to solution delivery




WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties and events.

Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.

Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at data science conferences and Meetups, and encouragement to publish work.

Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.

Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.



Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!

If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Manjuri Sinha.

title: Backend Developer at Dojo Madness GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
description:
Your mission:

title: Devops System Engineer at Optiver (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Excited by the idea of having to manage over 5000 components across more than 20 locations world-wide? Can you make split second decisions that directly influence our P&L and do you keep your cool when everything around you seems to fall apart? Are you the type of engineer who improves their work by automating tasks? Then you will fit right in!

Technology at Optiver
In order to be successful in our trading domain, we constantly need the most advanced technology, trading software and connections to the market. In short, we need the best technologists to develop, optimise and support our systems and tools. With 12 datacenters and thousands of servers we run ten thousands of trading components executing hundred thousands of trades every day. These systems produce a lot of data that needs to be wrangled to turn it into valuable information for different areas of the business.


What you'll do
As a DevOps System Engineer you are the custodian of our production trading environment. You will care for our trading software and systems using your distinct skillset and insights, and adapt the environment as required to achieve our business goals. Activities include setting up, tweaking, optimizing and monitoring the different software and hardware components manually, as well as developing tools to make these activities less labour intensive and more consistent.
You constantly keep an eye on our trading activities, answering questions and troubleshooting issues as they arise. You will be working with highly skilled, smart and engaged colleagues within a team of traders, researchers, software engineers and other system engineers. Together you constantly question the status quo; see whether it makes sense and is the most optimal, and find ways to improve and then make it happen.

Zalando Technology is the base of our e-commerce platform. INTERESTED?

title: Front End Software Engineer at IRESS (Melbourne, Australia)
description:
We're seeking an exceptional Front End Software Engineer to join our growing research and development center in Melbourne.


 IRESS is a principal global supplier of share market and wealth management systems producing innovative, sophisticated solutions. We provide solutions that help with life's big decisions – from getting a mortgage approval, planning for retirement, to trading on the stock exchange – things that make a real difference to people's lives and financial well-being.


Role


Our Melbourne Development center builds complex, high performance, multithreaded trading applications used by leading financial institutions in several countries, handling over 10,000 transactions per second!


As a Front End Software Engineer, you'll join a new team responsible for building one of our newer products – Viewpoint. VewPoint is the future of web-based trading and is one of the largest, Financial Market product initiatives undertaken at IRESS in recent years, currently being used by customers in several countries. The product development process is following user-centric design principles and is heavily involved with the UX team. Tech stack includes Javascript, HTML5, CSS3, Node.JS, Knockout, Typescript, jQuery etc


As a Front End Software Engineer you’ll be part of a relatively new team building prototypes and pushing new features. You’ll have a significant impact in ensuring continuous innovation and development of IRESS Financial Market products throughout the entire development lifecycle from inception to deployment and production support.


As we continue to grow there are opportunities to develop your skills by working on different products, taking on additional responsibilities in projects, mentoring or becoming an expert on IRESS products.


As a Front End Software Engineer, you'll also have the opportunity to join a highly collaborative, AGILE team (we have squads and tribes). We're passionate about improvement as we introduce continuous integration and continuous delivery best practices into our engineering environment.  You'll work alongside talented Engineers who are passionate about keeping up to date with the latest trends and tools while having access to formal training opportunities at IRESS.


This is a great chance for a Front End Software Engineer to solve unique problems at one of Australia's fastest growing and established Fintech's!


We’re open to applicants both locally and overseas and can provide sponsorship for suitable candidates.


About You


Required



  • Experience in a similar role as Software Engineer, Developer, Programmer, Web Developer, Front End Engineer

  • Exceptional front-end development skills using modern HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript

  • Strong web application development skills using JavaScript libraries like Knockout.JS, jQuery, Node.js etc.

  • Good experience across responsive design, performance tuning as well as localization & accessibility


Desired



  • Experience working in complex and innovative R&D environments

  • Experience working in AGILE teams

  • Experience with real-time, multithreaded, time critical applications


Culture and Perks


We recognize and reward hard work and celebrate our successes over a Friday afternoon drink and at various socials throughout the year. We don't sweat the small stuff either, our dress code is as relaxed as we are. As well as local charity events and initiatives, we hold global days and activities to make the most of our global strength and diversity. This includes a yearly global hackathon!


Perks include subsidized healthcare insurance, share scheme, community events, flexible working opportunities and access to various learning and development programs.

title: Graduate Software Engineer at Improbable (London, UK)
description:
_about us


Improbable’s mission is to make new realities possible. These realities will enrich the human experience, underpin superior decisions, be the foundation for new businesses and create insights into how the universe works.


Our first product is SpatialOS; a distributed operating system capable of producing consequential, persistent simulations at unprecedented scale. SpatialOS is being deployed in progressive game studios and the most critical government institutions across the world.


We are a British technology company with an internationally diverse workforce, unified by our desire to achieve extraordinary things. Fulfilling our long-term vision requires solving some of the most interesting and difficult problems on earth; the journey to new realities provides continuous progression and development opportunities for our world class problem solvers.


_mission


At Improbable we are building software to solve completely new and complex problems around distributed systems, AI, physics and containerisation; all at massive scale with extreme performance requirements. We operate in small, agile, autonomous teams each working on key aspects of our offering. Examples of what teams are working on include;

• integrating new workers with our distributed stack -- e.g. physics, navigation, raycasting
• developing new algorithms to distribute and scale our simulations
• developing tooling to understand and reason about large real-time simulations
• researching new applications of our tech and developing proof of concepts
• creation of world-class, robust APIs and SDKs for external customers


// TEAMS


We have a range of opportunities available across our engineering teams, broadly falling into these categories:



  • Building our base real-time distributed simulation platform

  • Applying our real-time distributed simulation platform to gaming

  • Building exciting demo's to showcase the power of SpatialOS

  • Applying our real-time distributed simulation platform to other verticals

title: Senior Software Engineer Backend (m/f) - Java/ Scala at Zalando SE (Dortmund, Germany)
description:
The opportunity



As a Zalando Back-end Software Engineer, you will build, scale and continuously improve the software of one of the world's largest e-commerce platforms. Whether junior- or senior-level, you will use cutting-edge technologies to create high-performance applications that scale. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others' projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand-while receiving meaningful support at every step.

What we are looking for



  • Deep knowledge of Scala or Java

  • Experience with relational (e.g. PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g. Cassandra, Redis) databases

  • Expertise in functional programming

  • Enthusiasm for microservices architectures, distributed systems and RESTful APIs

  • Experience with building and/or running large-scale applications on a PaaS/SaaS cloud, preferably AWS

  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services

  • English language fluency




Your responsibilities



  • Help design and build our distributed microservices landscape and evangelize best practices

  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability

  • Use agile methodologies

  • Think big-picture: Constantly evaluate our work and processes and challenge us




What you can expect from us



  • One-month mentoring program

  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical "People Leads" who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to networking with industry leaders

  • Community: hack weeks, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals




About Zalando



Zalando is Europe's leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast - with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams - and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It's how we grow.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!



If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Rebecca Kurzbuch at rebecca.

title: Cotiviti Labs Senior Scala Developer at Cotiviti (Dunwoody, GA) (allows remote)
description:
PRINCIPLE PURPOSE OF JOB:


Developers with the Cotiviti Labs team are responsible for working with a global team of medical doctors and business experts to create break-through solutions for incredibly difficult problems. In 2015 we found $3.2B in health system inefficiencies. We use a combination of innovative and proven technologies game-changing solutions


We use a combination of innovative and proven technologies game-changing solutions into production as quickly as possible. Our solutions are scalable, elastic, concurrent, parallel, and deliver results to our clients in real-time.  We are a Scala functional programming shop but are willing to use the best technologies to get into production quickly.  Our DevOps team members have created a sophisticated ChatOps infrastructure that supports everything from deployments, to releases, to provisioning new clients. Our continuous integration and build facilities are world class.


The Labs team has a flat organizational structure so people on this team have no direct managers, are responsible for their own work assignments, and will receive and give quarterly 360 reviews from their peers. We have no deadlines, only a requirement to move as fast as humanly possible and make every minute count. To thrive in this environment team member must have a passion for computer science, technology, innovation, and delivery.


We value teamwork above everything. We succeed together as a team and are accountable to each other for that success. Though we are scattered across the world we regularly get together to have fun. If you are looking for such a tribe apply now.


ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:


Primary Responsibilities



  • Work with our team to accelerate our research into production

  • Research open source libraries for code that can accelerate development

  • Constantly work to identify to speed up the development process

  • Identify training or coaching opportunities that can accelerate team members

  • Search for an experiment with new technologies that could accelerate development and deployment

  • Work with a global, multi-cultural team to understand complex business requirements

  • Write code that is beautiful, tested, and commented that you will want to tell your grandchildren about

  • Making practical decisions that will deliver value to customers quickly

  • Review and merge Pull Requests from team members

  • Identify and implement technologies that can improve the quality of our code.

  • Write excellent documentation



  • Actively promotes and participates in brainstorming sessions



  • Establish and maintain the highest level of integrity with your team members


Other Related Responsibilities



  • Contribute to Cotiviti and other open source projects

  • Present at and attend conferences

title: PHP Web Developer  at Hays Specialist Recruitment Ltd (Birmingham, UK)
description:
PHP Web Developer required £39,924 - £42,742 + 32d Hol + 8 bank holidays + Health & Life cover + many other benefits

Birmingham City University (BCU) is a large, diverse and increasingly popular place to study. They are defined by their core values of "Excellence, People focus, Partnership working and Fairness & Integrity".

The 22,500 students are at the heart of everything they do. They are from over 80 countries and can access an enviable range of facilities with even more planned. The Complete University Guide ranked BCU as top 30 UK University for spending on facilities in 2015.

They are in the midst of transformation. BCU is investing £260 million in its estate including a major expansion of the city centre campus at Eastside adjacent to the planned HS2 Curzon Street station. This provides opportunities to make substantial fundamental changes to our learning environment and operations.
An opportunity has arisen for a proven PHP Web Developer to join a busy in house Development team. If successful, you will be joining a multi-disciplined software development team consisting of backend integrators, web developers, web designers, development DBAs and the QA testers.

Essential Skills:

* 3 years backend PHP experience
* 3 years mySQL experience
* Able to configure apache web servers for hosting of web sites, apps, open source CMSs such as Wordpress
* 3 years front end development experience in JavaScript
* 2 years experience of using jQuery
* 3 years design experience in Photoshop or Fireworks
* Use of source control repositories such as GIT, SVN or TFS.
* Experience of Moodle VLE
* Experience of configuring and developing WordPress

Desirable skills:

* Able to create conceptual designs and take through wireframing & mocking to working pages and UAT.
* Any exposure to ASP.NET and C# or VB.NET would be highly advantageous.
* Experience in Agile/Scrum development methodologies.

As this is a friendly and collaborative team with a positive culture you will need to have good interpersonal skills and have a good standard of written and verbal communication.

The role demands someone who is naturally interested and in-touch with the latest web technologies. You will be confident in communicating at all levels and will be passionate about knowledge sharing to enhance the overall quality of the team. Experience in e-learning environments is an advantage but not essential.

This exciting position is paying a good salary and a very attractive benefits package including 32 days Holiday plus 8 bank holidays, Career Average Pension, sickness & absence entitlement, Private Health, On site gym, Life Assurance, Travel card Scheme, Car parking, Cycle to work scheme, car share scheme and catering.

The immediate location for this role will be North Birmingham with later relocation near to the City Centre scheduled for later on in the year. The post holder will be required to travel between Birmingham sites as per operational requirements.

If you are ready for this challenge and have the necessary experience please submit an up to date copy of your CV outlining your relevant skills and experience, together with your notice period/availability or call Daney on 0121 230 1455.

Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk

title: Senior Developer (London, UK) at Gram Games (London, UK)
description:
Come on board and develop mind blowing games for millions of players around the planet. What are you waiting for?


Essentially...


As a developer here, your responsibilities would include, among others, working on our internal development framework, rapidly prototyping new game concepts, and working closely with our design, art, data science, and marketing teams to create the next (or next ten) big mobile hit(s). You’d be expected to be proactive, and to act as a fount of knowledge when it comes to game development. We're looking for candidates who won't balk at a challenge, whether it be wrangling the code of large, third-party codebases, or implementing features that will, when published, affect millions of people around the world. Simply put, we're looking for someone with the passion for both building great games, and shipping great code.


We're looking for someone who...


...has at least 5+ years experience as a game developer


...has previous experience working with mobile games, as well as a proven track-record.


...has previously shipped at least one product.


...has a solid understanding of the Unity 3D game engine.


...can code in C# with the best of them.


...has a solid understanding of game development related design patterns.


...is very comfortable with modern version control systems (git)


...is competent with general game development concepts, including graphics development, game logic, communication with backend services, user interface development, and artificial intelligence.


...has strong communication skills, regardless of the team member’s technical proficiency


...designs, architects, and implements high quality, structured, and robust code.


…can independently create quality solutions to problems.


...can quickly, and efficiently, pick up and start working with pre-existing codebases.


...is proficient at written and spoken English.


It would also be great if you...


...have previous exposure to the Free-to-Play model.


...have a BSc in Game Development/Computer Science/Computer Engineering


...have some knowledge of Python, Objective-C, Swift, and Java.


...are familiar with more complex parts of software development, such as writing unit tests, using continuous integration, and working with backends (parsing json, using Web sockets, encryption, etc.)


...are someone who builds games in their free time, or takes part in recreational game development opportunities such as Game Jams or Hackathons

title: Back end Team Engineer - Data Architecture   at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
description:

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. Being part of Priceline group, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. Although we are in hotel booking business, we see ourselves as an IT company where major focus is on engineering highly scalable, high performance solutions with goal of being the best on the market. In addition of being large company with enough capital to make things happen, we are start-up at heart, with flat hierarchy and ability to move very fast to react on market demands. We are achieving this by being KPI oriented and organized in SCRUM teams for maximum flexibility and efficiency.

We are looking for highly skilled engineers to join our multinational group and help us further push the boundaries of innovation and creativity. Join us and work side by side with amazing people from all over the world and directly impact experience of our customers on global level!

Qualifications:
  • 3+ years of experience in software development
  • experience and high programming skills in at least one of following languages: Scala, Java, Python or C#
  • strong problem solving skills
  • strong background in object oriented programming, understanding data structures and design patterns
  • exposure to big data
  • ability to communicate in English clearly and concisely in both written and verbal form
  • being able to debate and communicate your ideas
  • software engineering enthusiasm is a must!


Highly desirable additional skills:
  • experience in designing highly scalable solutions
  • experience with following technologies: Zookeeper, Cassandra, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, Elasticsearch, Spray or alternatives
  • experience with concurrent processing
  • experience with designing/building/supporting high availability products
  • experience in software continuous integration
  • experience working in cross functional SCRUM team
  • experience in DevOps role


What we offer:
  • live and work on full-time position in Bangkok, Thailand
  • receive competitive salary and benefits
  • work on solving challenging problems on huge scale
  • learn from many experienced professionals currently working with us
  • build products that currently do not exist on the market

title: Development Team Leader at Infomedia Ltd (Alexandra Headland, Australia)
description:
Infomedia are the global  leaders in retail automotive software, providing SaaS solutions from our large suite of products that make our dealership customers more productive and more profitable. Our team get to build and support some of the coolest products on the market, using the latest tech in an environment where ideas are nurtured, curiosity is rewarded and collaboration is key to our success. We are evolving fast and so we are on the lookout for those who thrive in fast paced and ever changing environments where innovation and continual improvement are the norm. You know, the people who are forever curious, asking questions and seeking answers, challenging prevailing perceptions in pursuit of the best outcomes and not the "normal" outcomes. Our team are not at the top of our industry by accident, we are forever challenging each other to be better in a supportive culture conducive with high performance. You will be stretched and you will be pushed but you will experience growth like you've never experienced, within a growing, high tech and energetic organisation where we are all pulling in the one direction and know exactly where our goals are!

And the tangible cool stuff? we do have

  • Onsite Gym
  • Quarterly meetups
  • Games and breakout areas
  • Brand new campus minutes from the Northern Beaches
  • Social events
  • Casual Fridays
  • Regular lunches provided

To name a few…

Who are we looking for?
We are looking for a Development Team Lead that is equal parts people leader and creative code perfectionist to join our team either in Sydney and be a key driver in the evolution of our products. The perfect person for this role isn’t just a developer but is a clean code advocate, a meticulous tech legend and a true moulder of technical minds. Characteristically you will be happy with nothing other than perfection and the pursuit of continual improvement and growth. This person duties will look something like this:

  • Lead a team of software developers to build secure, highly available and highly performant applications
  • Work closely with team members to solve problems, transfer knowledge, and develop their skills
  • Perform code reviews and constantly strive to improve the current architecture
  • Lead daily stand-up meetings, sprint reviews and planning sessions
  • Work with project management to update project plans and assign resources to meet product requirements and manage risks
  • Actively seek to improve our products and processes

What skills and experience do we think will ensure success in this role?

  • Experience leading a high performing software development teams
  • Deep knowledge of Java, MongoDB and AWS
  • Strong experience in front-end development including JavaScript, AngularJS, HTML5 and CSS
  • Equal parts trainer mentor and lead from the front character
  • Excellent knowledge at designing secure, highly available and performant cloud based systems
  • Pragmatic approach to balancing business goals with architectural goals
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

And if you can offer more than this, we ‘re ok with that too.

In this role, you will be a key driver in the growth and exposure of our business, brand and capability on a global scale in conjunction with our Marketing Director and so it will be no small feat – but being as outcome focussed as you will need to be to be successful in this position, you will thrive on this and turn these challenges into your drivers for ongoing growth and continuing success!

Would love to chat with you if you think the above detail suits what you are looking for in a new team and if you possess all of the desired skills and experience mentioned above, drop me your CV and let’s link up.

title: Operations Engineer - AWS (m/f) at Beko Käuferportal GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)

Our team

Operations Engineer - AWS (m/f)

title: Senior Algorithm Developer for Autonomous Driving (m/f) (105395) at BMW Group (München, Deutschland)
description:
IF YOU THINK OUT OF THE BOX, YOU CAN TEACH CARS TO THINK TOO.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE.


To revolutionise the future of mobility, one has to go ahead and set standards today. Intelligent technologies that are increasingly taking over driving tasks and providing greater safety and comfort are already in use in our vehicles. Increasing our lead in autonomous driving will need visionary thinkers and creative developers. Specialists in the fields of machine learning, artificial intelligence, sensor technology and software development will work in expert teams, in centres centers of excellence networked around the world, to redefine the limits of what is possible.


Senior Algorithm Developer for Autonomous Driving (m/f)
Job reference: 105395


We are offering you an interesting position at the BMW Group to work as a Senior Algorithm Developer (m/f) in the field of Autonomous Driving. Your tasks will include the development of algorithms and software solutions for the environmental and driver model. In close cooperation with the specialist departments, you will develop the architecture of highly networked, innovative software. Here, you will be involved in the entire development chain, from requirements analysis, algorithm design, implementation and validation of the software, through to integration of the software on the control devices. In your position, you will write and optimize complex algorithms, such as for the recognition, classification and fusing (high and low level) of objects and open spaces fit for driving and of situation interpretation, and you will provide support in implementing the algorithms into efficient embedded software. Your thrilling range of activities will be rounded off by the testing and validation of the developed algorithms, as well as testing and functionality throughout the overall vehicle.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

title: Python Qt Client Software Engineer at SpiderOak, Inc. (Kansas City, MO) (allows remote)
description:
SpiderOak is looking for an energetic and enthusiastic mid-to-senior level Python / PyQt developer to join the engineering team. SpiderOak ONE is the original and leading Zero Knowledge cloud backup and file sync tool. You will be working with the ONE product team to drive new features and advance the UX of the product. You'll also be working with our business-side product team to turn customer asks and user stories into fully-fledged features within the product. Our goal is not to present just the best UI for privacy-centric products, but the best UI, period. We take the security and privacy of our customer's data very seriously, so some understanding of the seriousness of our goals is important- if you believe mining user data is the key to monetization, or security is a secondary concern, we will not be a good fit.


You'll have a lot of latitude in crafting the right solutions to problems you've been given to solve. We're a global team with an all-remote Engineering workforce, and we make heavy use of our tools to keep flowing and working with each other- using git, videoconferences, issue tracking, wiki, and Semaphor to communicate and understand what each other is up to. We enjoy working with remote team members who are remote because they happen to like where they live, not because they're working remote to avoid human interaction.

title: Junior Front End Engineer at Realogy Services Group LLC (Emeryville, CA)
description:
Requisition 35991

About ZapLabs LLC
ZapLabs (www.zaplabs.com) is the innovation and technology hub for global real estate leader Realogy Holdings Corp. (NYSE: RLGY), and the driving force behind inventive technology for brokers and agents affiliated with Realogys world renowned real estate brands. ZapLabs delivers its highly effective consumer, sales associate and broker solutions in support of Realogys leading franchise brands and is positioned to expand the scope of its technology development efforts to encompass Realogys other business segments, including residential brokerage, relocation and settlement services. ZapLabs is headquartered in Emeryville, California.

Title: Junior, Front-End Engineer

At ZapLabs, youll join a highly efficient development team with experience in all aspects of web application development - including building the most trafficked real estate brokerage website in the country. On top of that, were rapidly expanding our mobile presence, on several platforms, with great success. Thats only half the equation, though, because these powerful consumer applications connect directly to Zap - our industry-leading CRM in the Real Estate sector. All in all, we are a talented development team working on a dynamic array of products.

What you will do:

You will be co-responsible for continuing the development of our web applications managing packages and tasks, automation, testing, and writing modular and reusable components, which seamlessly integrate into our core apps.

What we are looking for:

You are a talented Front-end Engineer with some experience and demonstrated ability to turn mockups into visually stunning, intuitive, and standards-compliant HTML mobile views. You are passionate about taking your skills to the next level and excited about delving deeper into HTML5 and other new web technologies. You have experience, or a whole lot of interest, in mobile web development. You can work independently but thrive in a collaborative, team-oriented environment and have a passion for writing efficient, maintainable, and reusable code. You have an unwavering commitment to quality, intuitive web interface development, have excellent technical abilities, and a high motivation to work / push for bleeding edge technologies keeping in mind that the final product needs to be stable.

Skills you should have:

- Expert level HTML5 and CSS3 skills

- Good knowledge of Javascript

- Knowledge of AngularJS

- Some experience with REST APIs and endpoints

- Some experience with DevTools (multiple browsers and virtual devices)

- Understanding of Grunt, its tasks, and processes

- Knowledge of package handling (Bower and NPM)

- Knowledge of CSS preprocessors (SASS preferred)

- Some understanding of BEM, Atomic CSS, OOCSS, SMACSS or any other CSS methodology

- Some knowledge of object-oriented JavaScript

- Excellent analytical/troubleshooting skills

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Nice to haves:

- Familiarity with Java/JSP

- Working knowledge of Unix, and thorough understanding of OSX, iOS and Android

- Phonegap / Corvoda experience and its frameworks (Ionic, Steroids, etc..) is a must

- Experience developing mobile web apps, knowledge of idiosyncrasies of OS fragmentation and issues, i.e., scrolling, fixed positioning, etc

- Front-end templating and MVC

- A thorough understanding of cross-browser/cross-platform Web Development

Minimum qualifications

- BS degree in Computer Science related technical field or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications

- Development experience in JavaScript, Python.

- Experience with HTML, CSS, and AJAX.

- Web application development experience

- Some experience developing user-facing software.

- Development experience designing object-oriented JavaScript.

- Knowledge of web libraries and frameworks such as ReactJS, Redux AngularJS, Polymer, and Closure.

Realogy Holdings Corp. and its subsidiaries are committed to providing equal employment opportunity (EEO) and will make employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, sexual preference, gender identity or gender expression, veteran status, marital status, disability, or any other characteristic protected under applicable laws and regulations. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected under applicable laws and regulations. Under the Americans with Disabilities Act and other applicable laws Realogy will provide reasonable accommodation to disabled applicants upon request during the application process to ensure equal opportunities to be considered for employment.

To learn more about Realogy and the accomplishments of our brands, log on to www.realogy.com. #LI-LY1

Realogy Holdings Corp. is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to diversity in its hiring and business practices. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

SF:MUSE

ZIP123

title: Software Developer at eVision Industry Software (Den Haag, Netherlands)
description:
Job Summary:


Design and build new features for our health and safety products


Member of a product development team, working in a very agile way


Own parts of the product, participate in creating vision and coordinate product evolution


Focus on code quality and continuously improve with every next release


You work with:


A product development team composed of software developers, QA engineers, UX Designer and a Product Manager


Professional Services associates who deliver projects to our customers


Your very own team lead, that helps you grow and be effective as a professional


Desired Background, Experience and Education:


2+ years of experience in software development


Good knowledge of, and proven experience with: C#, .NET Framework 4.0+, LINQ


Firm grasp of design patterns and of SOLID, and experience using them in a commercial application


Knowledge of Domain Driven Design, CQRS, Event Sourcing desirable


Good experience with code quality – unit testing, TDD, code review, automated testing concepts and defensive coding are essential


Strong knowledge of continuous integration and deployment;


Knowledge of HTTP and .NET HTTP frameworks – ASP.NET MVC


Knowledge of relational and non-relational data stores – MSSQL (preferred), RavenDB (optional)


Able to understand and write multi-threaded code


Good grasp of both technical and functional characteristics of software products, particularly in terms of scalability, performance, usability and quality


Knowledge of concepts of scripting and automation


Experiences with developing for mobile platforms (Android, iOS) is desirable and a plus


Good communication skills in English, both written and verbal


In possession of a valid European work permit.

title: User Interface (UI) Development Manager - Agoda at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
description:
Want to be the figurehead for Front End Design frameworks across Agoda?

Want your creative vision to be realised and enjoyed by millions?

Based in Bangkok, Thailand - full relocation and visa support available.

We take our work and our people seriously at Agoda, and we respect your expertise and professional brilliance!

You'll be responsible for managing the team who build the frameworks and front end dev standards used by all our engineers across the business. You'll be developing the strategic direction and setting the standards of front end development for others to follow, engaging with a highly intelligent bunch to bring your vision to life.

You'll also have good input to the layout of the site and creative elements (which is why we need someone with an eye for design) - the great thing is it's a really shallow hierarchy and relatively new operation (this is a new role) so you can achieve as much as your expertise allows...

Agoda has c2,800 staff and growing rapidly, we're huge in Asia and growing in other markets globally. Plus the lifestyle in Bangkok is an amazing adventure!

We hire engineers from all over the world so you'll be working amongst an international elite. We don't mess about when it comes to becoming a market leader and we rely on your expertise and proven management experience to help take us there. It's very autonomous with lots of ownership, not too rigid in structure so a brilliant environment.

Experience?

All the front end stuff along with frameworks like Bootstrap - you've implemented those in businesses before.

Management management management! You need to have managed at least a small team before for a decent amount of time and evidence of engaging with stakeholders to board level with gravitas to carry yourself.

- Some of:- Bootstrap / html / css / javascript / frontend development / creative direction / interactive / digital design / web design standards / frameworks / Foundation / angular / node.js and many many more

Get your application in now and we'll be in touch, we're game if you are.

With relocation support and visa sponsorship available we've got you covered, leaving you free to look forward to an amazing new experience!

title: Quality Assurance (QA) Manager (Istanbul, Turkey) at Gram Games (Istanbul, Turkey)
description:
You have one mission - no bugs allowed! You are the bug-slayer of this town. Create the ultimate bug-defense system, and maintain a squeaky clean interface. 


Essentially...


As a Quality Assurance Manager here at Gram, you would play a crucial role in product development and design. Your position would combine attention to detail, technical understanding, and communication skills to effectively eliminate bugs and any other quality issues through all stages of development. As the QA manager, it would be up to you to ensure that the highest standards are maintained in the development of new and existing games in the mobile F2P marketplace.


As QA manager, you’d need to know how to develop test plans for both internal and external testing teams, while managing external QA vendors. You would also need to ensure timely and effective reporting of bugs and inconsistencies found throughout the test cycle. As you would be integrated in all aspects and processes of the development process, it is also essential that you have stellar communication and collaboration skills.


We're looking for someone who...


…..is experienced in defining QA scope and creating test plans and guiding/coordinating all teams involved in design, development and support for titles in development or for those in the live environment


…..is experienced in working with developers, designers and external QA vendors to ensure documentation is kept up-to-date and accurate


…..is able to manage and liaise with external QA teams to ensure delivery within deadlines


…..is able to work with developers to determine causes and implement solutions to any identified problems, bugs or errors in QA/Development process


…..is able to ensure that test results are logged accurately within Gram Games’ development management toolset (ie, JIRA, Confluence, etc.)


…..has a solid understanding of various development methodologies and programming tools/languages


…..has extensive experience in gaming, and thus has a passion for maintaining the highest quality gaming experiences


…..has an exceptional eye-for-detail and pattern-recognition skills


…..has superior written and spoken communication skills


…..is largely fluent in English, written and oral


…..has a constructive and collaborative approach to development and testing


It would also be great if you had...


…...3-5 years work experience in mobile app, software development testing


…...a Software Engineering degree or related development experience


…...familiarity with Android, iOS and Windows testing environments, tools, and SDKs

title: New Product Senior Developer at Derivco (La Lucia, South Africa)
description:
This position will challenge your ability to balance efficiency, reliability and rapid prototyping using cutting edge technologies to build production ready solutions. To develop, test and document high quality software to meet requirements, as per Derivco standards. We are looking for an enthusiastic, innovative person who is self-motivated, open to ideas and a team player.

title: Software Engineer  Java Developer at Picnic (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Who are you?


You get excited by solving hard problems. You are not intimidated by grand challenges. You love building ultra-scalable systems. Reaching technical excellence gives you a deep satisfaction. Chasing operational excellence is your second nature. You flourish when your team reaches peak performance.



What are your challenges?

  • Innovate and advance the core planning, shopping, retailing and shipment algorithms

  • Live and breathe innovation, technology, and engineering

title: Big Data Engineer - SUPERCRUNCH by GfK at GfK (Nürnberg, Deutschland)
description:
HERE YOU ARE. Another day in the office. Time to wrap up and hit the traffic home. Remember how excited you were when you got that great job in this brilliant IT team? And now? We guess the job is ok, your colleagues are nice too, and the coffee breaks are timed to perfection. All in all, a comfortable gig. Of course, you're keeping an eye out for other roles. You're still ambitious. Still want to go places and try out new stuff. Looking for a fresh challenge. Something to get your teeth into.


In time for the launch of our new brand SUPERCRUNCH by GfK!


At SUPERCRUNCH by GfK, Data Science driven by next level technology takes center stage. Not just a fuzzy business power talk Management hears and thinks, "Yeah, that sounds great, next topic". Everyone gets it, lives it, and breathes it. It's an agile start up within an established, global organisation – the best from both worlds!


More than 35 experts from 12 nations share the same vision: To develop best-in-class tech and analytics solutions addressing todays biggest marketing challenges. Why just be a number cruncher, if you could be a SUPERCRUNCHER!


With GfK's incredible global data landscape at our disposal, we might have an unfair advantage – not many players can say they collect granular sales data in more than 100 countries, or measure cross-media behavior using state-of-the-art technology for tens of thousands of consumers. Our other major USPs are our team and our values. Close, cross-functional collaboration of Data Scientists, IT Engineers, and Commercial experts is in our DNA. Our radically agile and dynamic startup setup enables everyone to learn at a fast pace, contribute to our solutions and get recognized for the hard work they do.


Our Big Data Engineer is part of the most ambitious, Big Data crunching operations team on the planet and contribute to making SUPERCRUNCH the No. 1 Marketing Analytics player!


SUPERCRUNCH's Technology unit is led by Jörg, Senior Director Technology – passionate IT Manager by day and Superhero IT nerd by night and with Big Data focus dating back to ancient times (2008), who prides himself with the most diverse taste in music and racket based sports and spent most of his career building up and fostering the success of DevOps- and Software Engineering teams. SUPERCRUNCH is led by Norbert, an obsessed number-cruncher himself, whose music taste reflects his personality: from Paolo Conte to Sex Pistols and everything in between!

title: Systems Administrator at Springfield College (Springfield, MA)
description:
Systems Administrator



Springfield College invites applications for a Systems Administrator for the Department of Information and Technology Services. The ideal candidate will be tasked with effective and efficient provisioning, installation, configuration and optimization of network system operations and hardware/software systems maintenance in support of the assets which comprise the college wide-area network. This includes, but is not limited to, systems proactive monitoring, virtual server installation/maintenance in a VM environment, configuration and support of Active Directory, wide-area network routing, wireless network configuration/maintenance, disk storage management, systems integrity verification, disaster preparedness, systems OS maintenance/upgrades, systems performance monitoring/optimization, and research of evolving technology trends to advance network performance and security.



The ideal candidate must hold a four-year degree in a technology related discipline from a recognized accredited organization and must be able to perform physical activities supporting up to 25 pounds. Prior systems administration experience and/or professional network certification is a plus.



Applicants should submit a letter of interest, resume, and three professional references as one document attached and directed to hroffice@springfieldcollege.edu.



Springfield College is committed to enhancing diversity


and equality in education and employment.

PI96996248

title: Teamwork Desk Software Engineer at Teamwork.com (Cork, Ireland)
description:
The Job


Come help us build the best HelpDesk software in the world. The product we built handles millions of support emails a month for thousands of companies. Join a small team of talented developers, doing what we love every day. You will be writing code most of your day :)



What started out initially as a single web app has evolved into an architecture with many small services working with message queues, in-depth metrics, monitoring and logging. We need you to help us build some of the incredible new features we have planned and continue developing this architecture.


Our Tech Stack



  • Go (we love Go)

  • CoffeeScript

  • KnockoutJS

  • RabbitMQ

  • MySQL

  • Redis

  • ElasticSearch

  • AWS EC2, ECS, S3, RDS, CodeDeploy, AutoScale

Meet some of the Team



  • Brandon

Some things published by the Team

We care about all our teams, and they care about when their teammates will be online, what their timezone is and where they will be working from.
