We will also ask you whether or not you are open to considering spending some time in our Irish office, if you would like to work remotely, if you would like to relocate or if you're already here and ready to start work at Teamwork HQ in Cork, Ireland.

title: Senior Software Integration Engineer  - Agoda hiring now! at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
description:
We're looking for smart, passionate and motivated software engineers to join an awesome and growing team of integration engineers! Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world.

Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe. Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

In an increasingly connected world, the capability to connect to of our partners in smart and creative ways can deliver immense value for our business. Our team is working hard with best in class technology to integrate with many new partners in several different ways. Are you the right fit to join us?

Our tech stack includes Scala, AKKA, Cassandra, Kafka, Couchbase, Docker and best in class CI / CD. You may not have worked with all these technologies in the past, but if you are a talented software engineer great attention to detail and a growth mindset, you may be just who we are looking for.

Our team
  • We engineer elegant and robust systems that provide real value to our business
  • We care deeply about both the quality of what we do and the speed at which we do it
  • We value our engineers highly and are invested in their growth
  • We are multi-cultural, multi-talented and team focused


Who we are looking for
  • Strong ability in at least one language (eg Java, Scala, C#, Python etc.)
  • Experience in writing testable code (unit testing, mocking, faking, DI etc.)
  • A passion to work on distributed and scalable systems
  • Great attention to detail
  • Hands on experiences with Agile practices
  • Business-level English (written and spoken)


It would be great if you have experience with integration projects or with the technologies in our tech stack.

We are offering a full time position working in a great office space in central Bangkok. Salary and benefits are very competitive and aligned to your skills and experience.

Relocation and visa sponsorship are available for this role

title: Cultivate your skills on a global team in Tokyo (Software Engineer) at WOVN.io (Tokyo, Japan)
description:
"Welcome the world in one line of code."


This is the tagline for WOVN.io and it defines our thinking. Simple solutions with global ambitions.


Product


WOVN.io is a website localization service (creating Chinese, Spanish, Dutch etc versions of your website). Our goal is to create the simplest and quickest solution for website localization, without compromising on features. Minimalism is of the utmost importance to us. This means providing as simple an experience as possible for our users without sacrificing quality.


Having recently finished our third round of fundraising we are at a unique and exciting point in our company's history. We are approaching a point of explosive user growth which will require creative engineering solutions to sustain and fuel. To prepare for this, we need passionate, skilled engineers who are ready to take the leap with us into the next chapter!


Team


We are a small and nimble team of about 15 people and contrary to traditional Japanese workplaces, we enjoy a relaxed work environment. Developers choose their own hours, and we don't get in the way of anyone doing their best work. Each developer has a visible impact on WOVN.io and we're creating an environment that gives everyone the opportunity to improve their skills and gain valuable experience. While some of us speak Japanese, this is not a requirement. That being said, from working together many of us have seen great improvements in our Japanese -- and English.


About 60% of our company is made up of developers and roughly half  of us are foreigners living in Japan. Diversity is important to us because our target market is not Japan, but the world. This is why we are focusing on developing solutions for global users.


Technology Stack



  • Ruby on Rails

  • MongoDB

  • Redis

  • Vue.js

  • vanilla javascript


Environment



  • Flexible hours and vacation time

  • Your choice of PC, monitor, keyboard and other work essentials

  • Free language lessons (any language) for all employees

title: Full Stack Engineer - Agoda Bangkok at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
description:
Do you consider yourself a hardcore engineer? Are you always the smartest guy on the team? The one who knows what the problem is, what the best solution is, what the most appropriate technology is? Would you like to work in a team of people EXACTLY like you?

We're looking for some extreme programmers to assist us with the core platform of the website. Responsibilities here are really varied: our platform team takes on a lot of different, cool stuff!
  • Containerization technology
  • Migration of .NET apps to .NET core
  • Load testing
  • R&D into JavaScript frameworks and their implementation
  • Refactoring & implementation of new design patterns
  • Data access
  • Software comparison (Should we Aerospike or Cassandra? Spark or Storm?)
  • Machine learning of outlier data to provide predictive models of incidents so we can take preemptive action
  • Automation of managing events


So normally comes the technology bit where we say which tech you must have in order to be applicable.

Just. Be. Smart.

In order to be successful you will be the kind of person that will learn new technology easily. That can understand new paradigms as just part of their day job. We are interested in the super-geeks: those who adapt and apply technology because it's the right choice. We're not looking to build just another application; fun for the first 3 months and that's it: this is a true opportunity to work consistently on an exciting innovative platform. Introducing latest tech, fixing the hardest problems. If you're genuinely looking to make an impact this is here.

Below is a list of tech that people in this team use frequently (this is not a list of requirements, but to give an idea of the diversity in tech talent we have and are looking for):
  • Scala
  • Python
  • node.js
  • Java
  • C#
  • .NET core
  • Open stack
  • Docker swarm
  • JavaScript + test frameworks


In short - this is an exclusive role, open to the smartest people passionate about technology, always aiming to be the best and constantly improving. If you're looking at last year's code and thinking "what was I doing??!" this role may be for you! Come, challenge yourself.

Visa sponsored - we welcome applications from both International and locally based Software Engineers.

title: (Senior) Java Developer at foryouandyourcustomers Düsseldorf GmbH (Essen, Deutschland) (allows remote)
description:

Wir sind ein (noch) kleines Team aus Essen, das für namhafte Kunden mit State-Of-The-Art Technologien spannende Software-Projekte aus dem Bereich E-Commerce umsetzt.

Wenn Du Technologie cool findest und auch weisst, wie man sie einsetzt und Lust hast, Dich mit uns zusammen weiterzuentwickeln, dann freuen wir uns, von Dir zu hören.

title: Senior Software Engineer (DevOps and Automation)  - Agoda at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
description:
Agoda is looking for a unique kind of software engineers to solve Agoda's unique problem. Those that has zero tolerance for inefficiencies in software development. Who can see beyond the norm and assist Agodians in releasing the best software impossibly fast, while impossibly safe.

The team is directly responsible in leading DevOps culture by example and developing workflow automation at Agoda.

Specifically, our work includes a scalable swarm of docker containers. A whole virtualized environment of Asia's leading booking site in a laptop. An obliteration of conventional processes and establishing automated tools and systems. A robust event queue to track movement of features from developer commits to production. A scalable automated delivery system to support a growing websites, growing customers and growing number of engineers.

We are looking for individuals who share our vision and values to bring their best in solving these challenges together

Key Traits
  • Zero tolerance for process inefficiency
  • Always look for opportunities to optimize and automate daily workflow
  • See beyond the current norm of operation, then design and implement solutions in stages
  • Great communication skills in building culture for other engineers to do the same


Requirements
  • Hands-on experience with the whole SDLC: Requirement, Design, Code, Test, Deploy
  • Proficient in any one programming language (e.g. Java, Python, JavaScript/NodeJS)
  • Deep understanding of the computer science and its application
  • Understand VMs, docker containers and their applications
  • Hands on experiences with Agile practices: XP, Scrum, TDD
  • Business-level English (written and spoken)


Bonuses
  • Experienced in supporting Web application deployment at scale
  • CI: Jenkins , Teamcity
  • UI Tests with Selenium
  • Experience with configuration management: Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Powershell
  • Built a monitoring system for DevOps systems


If that's the kind of team you want to join, let's talk!

Our client is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. They do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Please note this role open to local and international applications. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available.

title: Full Stack Software Engineer - DevOps focus - Bangkok at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
description:
A life less ordinary.

We're not just talking about the location; as Asia's fastest growing ecommerce hotel booking platform and the biggest pure Tech company in Thailand, you'll use every last ounce of your Engineering talent at Agoda!

The Job

We're looking for Full Stack Developers with a passion for DevOps, build and deployment. If you're a Developer who likes to manage their own deployments you've come to the right place. We're looking to build our capability in this area and need your help.

In essence you'll be responsible for the complete scope, design, build and testing of products and features for one of Asia's fastest growing e-commerce websites. As a part of the Agoda .net Engineering team, you will be exposed to numerous innovative technologies in the fields of data-processing, big data, efficient data storage structures, recommender systems / machine learning, natural language processing, and many more. Whichever technology we work with, it must operate at the performance needs of a hyper-scale infrastructure operating at thousands of requests per second.

You'll be involved in the technical stuff, coding, hands-on but also working with design patterns, complex solutions design, implementation, devops, deployment, testing and much more. We're highly scalable and performance driven in our approach and our website is a best in class ecommerce solution that is highly user-centric and customer driven.

This exciting opportunity is full-time, permanent based in Bangkok, Thailand!

With relocation support and visa sponsorship available we've got you covered, leaving you free to look forward to an amazing new experience!

About You.

Our team structures are pretty flat so when we say that we're a big company operating as a start-up, we mean it. You'll need bags of initiative, but you'll also have experience of building for scalability, reliability and performance. A full-stack developer knows what's under the bonnet, and you're no different.

You may well have worked on a raft of different projects before but you'll have the same enquiring mind and hunger for knowledge and to make things better for the end user.
  • You have Architect-level expertise in solution design but also love to code!
  • 'Hands-on' DevOps expertise is highly desirable e.g. AWS, Amazon Route 53, Cloud Formation, elastic beanstalk, Azure, terraform, octopus, infrastructure as code or others
  • You're a master in either C# .net , Java or other OOP language
  • You have a deep level of Engineering experience through the stack and have touched on many elements that translate well to full e-commerce software architecture
  • You take full ownership of whatever you're building, and see it through to completion
  • You're confident in your ability
  • And passionate about your work (but not afraid to let others in to help too)
  • Your expertise spans the full SDLC thru' concept, design, build, test (automation if poss) and deployment
  • Your natural Engineering-mindset considers problem, solution and alternative in equal measure
  • The end user is at the heart of what you do, as is the commercial value to Agoda
  • You have a progressive outlook - TDD, BDD, Agile are second nature to you
  • You love working in a Change environment with fewer formal processes
  • Your experience will certainly be strong in backend Engineering primarily, ideally with decent frontend expertise to help things along
  • Able and willing to test your own work and create automated tests along the way


Interested?

Get in touch and apply now!

This exciting opportunity is full-time, permanent based in Bangkok, Thailand!

Visa sponsorship available.

title: Full Stack Senior Software Engineer - .Net / Java - Bangkok at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
description:
Your most exciting challenge yet!



Location: Bangkok, Thailand - permanent role

Visa sponsored

.Net C# / Java

Architect, Technical Lead, Fullstack Web Developer, Senior Engineer.

Whatever you want to call it one thing is for sure, you've got exceptional Engineering pedigree and are looking for an opportunity to shine!

At Agoda we believe in empowering you to perform your best work. Period.

From scoping thru' design, build, testing and deployment, what you build today will be live and used by millions tomorrow. From top to bottom we give you the tools to succeed and autonomy to get the job done. After all, you're an exceptional Engineer passionate about your craft; you don't need babysitting.

But you DO love working as part of a team, and welcome the abundance of collaboration at Agoda. You're not hung up on job titles, no matter who's round the table we've all got an equal voice, and we love working together to solve complex programming problems.

Scalable, distributed architecture is your bread and butter, you love scaling systems that serve millions of customers in diverse markets and working out the best way to scale out the platform whilst focusing on performance, reliability and user experience.

Experience?

Commercial experience of scalable distributed systems, full SDLC incl. unit testing, Java, .Net C# or Scala OOP expert (we work in C# .Net framework), front end skills nice to have, anything like ASP.Net MVC an absolute bonus.

We want passionate people on a mission to self-improve and help their team do likewise - this is beyond compromise... Finally you've played a lead role in projects serving millions of end users and understand what makes users and systems tick.

Our offices in Central World are ultra-modern too - with all that technology to play with and chance to work with the brightest Fullstack Engineers from around the World, this could be your biggest and most exciting challenge yet!

Interested?

This truly is the chance of a lifetime so apply now, we won't leave you hanging.

Thanks for spending some time with us, we can't wait to hear from you.

title: Real-Time Metrics Platform Engineer - Agoda at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
description:
Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia, and as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world.

Why Join Agoda?

Our Bangkok team is looking for top quality passionate engineers to build products across our next gen data platform products.
  • Our systems scale across multiple data centers, totaling a few million writes per second and managing petabytes of data. We deal with problems from real-time data-ingestion, replication, enrichment, storage and analytics. We are not just using Big Data technologies; we are pushing them to the edge.
  • In this competitive world of online travel agencies, finding even the slightest advantage in the data can make or break a company. That is why we put data systems in our top priorities.


Why Agoda Metrics Platform Team?

Our Agoda Data Platform engineers specialize in running high throughput, reliable services: our core infrastructure receives billions of measurements per day and serves several tens of millions of API requests, all with an uptime in excess of 99.9%. You and your teammates will power a system relied on every day by EVERY department within the company providing an extraordinary experience for millions of people across the world.

We deliver consumable information to the business and directly impact efficiency and decision-making across the entire company by making large scale data easy to explore and interpret.

Operating our own systems at hyper growth levels is a rewarding challenge. We are a small passionate group of teams that love working together and we are looking for exceptional additions to our flock. We value maintainability, testing at scale, robustness, quality, simplicity and performance.

Day to Day:
  • You will create new well-designed data processing systems from scratch all the way to deploying software.
  • You will be comfortable navigating the following technology stack: Linux, JVM, Java/Scala, NoSQL (Cassandra), messaging (Kafka), scripting (Bash).
  • You will research new techniques and technologies and hold presentations for teams across organizations.
  • Fix production problems.
  • You will profile for performance, self-recovery and stability.
  • You will collaborate with other teams and departments.
  • Automate systems tasks via code as needed.
  • This role lives at the intersection of engineering, analytics, and growth and enables the company to be data empowered in decision making.
  • The scale at which your systems operate will require not only producing and using highly-performant algorithms and data structures, but also solving complex problems involving distributed cloud based systems.


About You:
  • You have five plus years of industry experience, preferred at a tech company
  • You will have experience with at least one the following languages: Scala, Java, and/or any functional language. We code primarily in Scala, so you'll be excited to either ramp up on that or continue building amazing systems with it.
  • You have expertise developing on the JVM, including asynchronous I/O, concurrency, and have a solid grasp of the Java memory model.
  • Intimately familiar with KV stores and both NoSQL and SQL paradigms.
  • You are an experienced coder, who can stand your ground with experience building systems with purpose that are flexible, well-tested, maintainable and scale.
  • You have a scientific approach formulating hypotheses, running experiments, reaching actionable conclusions.
  • Detail oriented considering every outcome of a particular decision.
  • You are comfortable being on-call and working at odd hours as needed.
  • Excited about sitting between engineering and data science, empowering whole organizations to be data-centric.
  • Well versed in API integration (protocols, formats, standard methodology).
  • You can communicate in technical English with fluidity, both verbal and written please.
  • You probably hold a B.Sc. in Computer Science, Data Analytics, or related field.


If that's the kind of team you want to join, let's talk!

Agoda is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Please note this role open to local and international applications. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available.

title: HDL Developer at CERN  European Organization for Nuclear Research (Geneva, Switzerland) (allows remote)
description:
Functions

As HDL Developer you will:

  • Take responsibility for the design, evolution and support of the HDL code (mostly VHDL) in various key components of the accelerator control system.
  • Identify areas for improvement and propose solutions, including the development of new HDL and auxiliary software components, and the adoption of new technologies.
  • Collaborate with controls and data acquisition teams around CERN and support them, for the integration of standard BE-CO-HT hardware and HDL solutions into complete systems.
  • Take a leading role in all activities related to quality assurance for HDL components in the section, such as tools, design flow, testing, documentation, packaging and distribution.
  • Participate in the operational support of all the deployed solutions in the domain of distributed controls and data acquisition hardware.
  • Document and present your work as appropriate.


Qualification required

Master's degree in the field of electronics, or equivalent.

Experience and competencies

The experience required for this post is:

  • Demonstrated experience in and extensive knowledge of programmable logic design using Hardware Description Languages, VHDL in particular.
  • Demonstrated experience in automated testing and verification of complex HDL components.
  • Experience in design and development of Printed Circuit Boards, including component selection, schematics entry and layout would be an advantage;
  • Experience in radiation-tolerant design of electronics and techniques to measure and increase reliability would be an advantage.


The technical competencies required for this post are:

  • Design of electronics based on field programmable logic-based devices (FPGA): knowledge of the Xilinx design tools would be an advantage.
  • Digital circuit design, modelling and simulation.
  • Programming/software development: experience in software development in C and Python. knowledge of embedded Linux and device driver development would be an advantage.


The language competencies required are:

  • Spoken and written English: ability to understand and speak English in professional contexts.
  • Abilty to draw-up technical specifications and scientific reports and to make oral presentations.
  • The knowledge of the French language or the willingness to acquire this rapidly would be an advantage.


Eligibility conditions

Employing a diverse and international workforce is a CERN core value and central to our success. We welcome applications from all Member States irrespective of gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or personal situation.

This vacancy will be filled as soon as possible, and applications should normally reach us no later than 02.04.2017.

By applying here, you allow CERN to consider your application for any position it considers relevant with respect to your profile. Please ensure you update your profile regularly with any relevant information and that you inform the recruitment service if you wish your file to be removed from the database.

Note on Employment Conditions

We offer a limited-duration contract for a period of 5 years. Limited-duration contracts shall terminate by default on their date of expiry. Subject to certain conditions, holders of limited-duration contracts may apply for an indefinite position.

This position requires:

  • Stand-by duty, when required by the needs of the Organization.
  • Work during nights, Sundays and official holidays, when required by the needs of the Organization.

title: Manager, Java Cloud Services at Gogo Corporate (Chicago, IL)

Gogo's worldwide inflight Wi-Fi services have made internet and video entertainment a regular part of flying. We are a diverse group of technologists, marketers, strategists, and any other function you can think of- all working together in extraordinary harmony. And that's just the beginning.

title: Data Scientist / Security Expert at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
description:
We're Hiring Data Scientist / Security expert!

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen. What's stopping you from getting in touch?

Bangkok: While it's 30°+ outside, our engineers don't sweat, knowing they have the coolest jobs out there. Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe.

We move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We put cutting-edge technology in your hands so you can help us change the way people run their lives. We want you to come here so they can get there - and get your career going places, too.

Maintaining this growth requires an incredible amount of data, a superior IT infrastructure, and world class talent to bring it all together.

This is what we need you to do:
  • Be a world-class hands-on deploy master
  • Be vigilant and keep the bad guys away using state of the art tools
  • Optimizer by trade
  • Ask the right questions (and answer them!)


This is what we need you to be:
  • A coder, a data monger, and a statistics/machine learning expert (at least two years of experience is necessary; 5 years is preferable).
  • Practitioner with a heart of a theoretician. A solid personal ML education plan is a major plus.
  • An academic quantitative degree, preferably a PhD (not a must but a big plus).
  • A good knowledge of what's "Under the hood" of statistical methods.
  • Did we mention coding? (Python, R, Scala, )

We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.

  • You'll be experienced with configuration management systems (e.g. Puppet, Chef, Saltstack, etc) and version control (eg. git, svn)
  • You'll have experience with Linux HA, clustering and load balancing solutions
  • You'll have great multi-tasking skills
  • You'll have proficient English oral and written communication skills


ROLE OPEN TO LOCAL AND INTERNATIONAL CANDIDATES

title: C++ Software Developer at Stevens Capital Management LP (Radnor, PA)
description:
We're seeking highly driven, production-oriented developers who possess strong technical skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced collaborative environment. 


Primary Responsibilities



  • Develop and support multi-threaded applications with a strong emphasis on high performance.

  • Optimize our trading strategy implementation and performance analysis platform using network and systems programming.

  • Create tools to process, store and analyze quote, order and financial data.

  • Work closely with our quantitative research analysts, engineers and other groups to provide software solutions.


Requirements



  • Professional-level C++ programming experience in a Linux environment.

  • A Computer Science or Mathematics degree.

  • Outstanding problem solving skills.

  • Knowledge of shell scripts and other languages including Perl, Bash or CSH is a plus.

  • Experience with relational databases including Sybase, SQL Server and Oracle is a plus.

  • Experience with GUI design is a plus.

title: Growth Engineer at Noom (New York, NY)
description:
Noom Inc., a leader in mobile health coaching, combines the power of technology with the empathy of real human coaches to deliver successful behavior change at scale. Our mobile applications cover chronic/pre-chronic disease (diabetes, hypertension, and obesity to name a few), reaching more than 45 million users worldwide, and transforming millions of lives. The Growth Hacking team is at the forefront of this mission, tackling one of the hardest challenges in healthcare today: getting people to take that initial (and biggest!) step towards living a healthier lifestyle. This is where you come in.


The growth engineer we are seeking will be a marketing and engineering hybrid. You will be working directly with our cofounder to understand how consumers discover and adopt our products, and will be translating ideas and mock-ups into code that works. Your code will directly impact how we increase user conversion every step of the way, moving the needle on acquisition, engagement and retention metrics. You will be working with a highly cross-functional team that covers engineering, content and digital marketing, UX/UI testing, and data analysis, and learn the approaches used by the best tech companies to grow their business by 10x and beyond.


The growth team moves very quickly, and you’ll be exposed to new challenges on a daily basis. This is an ideal role for someone who has either started in marketing and evolved into tech or vice versa, and you will have the opportunity to build your skills in both.
 


What We’re Looking For:



  • A hacker mindset and a passion for working with numbers and data

  • Previous experience in a technical role, whether as an intern or full-time employee

  • Experience with, and interest in, Javascript, Python, SQL, HTML5, CSS

  • Good communicator: comfortable explaining technical problems in-person and in-writing

  • A team player: you enjoy collaboration, and teaching people new concepts

  • Sense of responsibility and ownership over your work

  • Willingness to learn a lot of new technical and growth concepts quickly

title: Quality Assurance Manager - Agoda at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
description:
We're Hiring Quality Assurance Manager!



Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen. We love innovation and putting new technologies to work to extend our lead on the competition. What's stopping you from getting in touch?



Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe. We move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Therefore, business value from your contribution can be seen in real-time basis. Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.



Apply now!



Responsibilities:



The Quality Assurance manager role at Agoda is a key part of the development process. Successful candidates will be responsible for the following tasks:

  • Develop and own QA strategy, track and manage a group of projects simultaneously
  • QA Resource management (Staff and Test environment)
  • Drive Agile and organization best practices
  • Coaching and developing staffs (both soft skill and technical skill)
  • Lead and manage test activities in a dynamic and high velocity development environment to ensure the highest quality of products
  • Lead Automation strategy to ensure high velocity of quality delivery
  • Work with related business departments to ensure business value delivery




Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in IT related fields
  • At least 5 years' experience in Software Quality Assurance
  • At least 3 years' experience in leading, managing and developing team
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision and commit to agreed business goals
  • Familiar with Agile development
  • Familiar with Test Automation development
  • Familiar with non-functional testing such as load , performance and resiliency testing
  • Ability to identify and communicate project risks
  • Understand the culture of fast moving business (WWW business)
  • Good communication, analytical, problem solving and interpersonal skills
  • Good at multi-tasking and working under pressure
  • Be able to work under direct and assertive culture
  • Good command of English (Speaking, Writing and Reading)
  • Role open to both local Thai and International candidates willing to relocate (full relocation and visa sponsorship available).

title: Java Developer at Data Fusion International (Dublin, Ireland)
description:
Data Fusion International (DFI), is an Irish, privately held software development and solutions provider, providing intelligent search and retrieval software solutions targeted at the global Security, Healthcare & Financial Services markets. Our core Infinity solution aligns internal organisation information, with relevant Open Source Intelligence, and other external data, to maximise the availability of decision making information in a coherent, precise and user friendly format.

DFI consists of a small team of key personnel, advisors and contractors. Currently our software development activities are outsourced. DFI are witnessing strong growth potential and demand for our products/services from international markets. Resulting from this encouraging market activity, DFI are seeking to build a small but core in-house team of experienced developers to take ownership and lead the design, development and support of the next generation of our Infinity product evolution.

Availability for international travel lasting typically 3-4 days at a time is required. Notice of such travel is normally one-two months in advance, but on certain occasions, may be at shorter notice. The ideal candidate will be experienced and comfortable working on their own with minimum supervision and/or as part of a small core team, reporting to the Chief Operating Officer.

This position is a ‘hands-on’ role and the majority of a candidate’s time will be spent designing, coding and improving our product offerings.The candidate must be comfortable interacting with current and future clients by email, telephone and face-to-face. On a project by project basis, the candidate may be responsible for managing and overseeing third Party consultants assisting on certain development projects. This position is an exciting opportunity for the right candidate to take ownership of projects and products from inception, through development, deployment and support.

title: Programmer/Analyst II at College of DuPage (Glen Ellyn, IL)
description:
Concepts from all cultures


Expertise in every area


Dedication to each profession


It Takes a Community to SUSTAIN Success.


At College of DuPage, we believe that a community college should offer the advantages of an actual community. Ours is composed of highly diverse students, administrators, and professionals who are dedicated to furthering the future of our neighborhood and our world. We are the second-largest higher education institution in Illinois, dedicated to creating a positive influence on everyone whose life we touch. Our team strives to support and sustain the educational resources we offer with extensive knowledge, impressive service, and unparalleled expertise from individuals representing every culture imaginable.



Become a new member of our inclusive community as a Programmer/Analyst II:


Performs computer programming activities as assigned to fulfill programming requests, resolve problem reports, and respond to help desk calls. Prepares detailed specifications from which programs can be written. Under general direction, designs new systems and resolves complex problems. Applies good technical knowledge to work.




  • Performs programming and analysis activities as assigned to fulfill project requests, resolve problem reports, and respond to help desk calls. This includes investigation, coding, testing, updating documentation, and preparation for implementation.

  • Receives assignments verbally or written. In some cases, the specifications may be brief and they will be required to use their system knowledge and analysis experience to complete the task.

  • Communicates with users and external vendors as needed for project requests and problem reports. Keeps supervisors informed of work progress.

  • Provides high level technical knowledge to resolve application problems in the production environment. Applies technical knowledge to work. Serves as a resource when needed.

  • Prepares detailed specifications from which programs can be written. Assists project leader as directed.

  • As requested, learn and become proficient in new technologies (examples are, but not limited to programming languages, software, applications, etc.).

  • On call 24 hours a day to resolve application problems that affect the production environment.

  • Perform other duties as assigned.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Systems Engineering at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
description:
Job Requisition Number:56484



Bloomberg Electronic Trading is the world's largest and most widely used electronic trading platform. We provide analytics, execution, as well as straight-through processing across a wide range of asset classes including equities, fixed income securities, derivatives, currencies and commodities.

On the System Engineering Team, our mission is to create state of the art frameworks and platforms to serve as foundation of building high speed, stable and scalable electronic trading platforms. One of our current projects is building out a capacity monitoring platform that will greatly improve problem detection and speed resolution of issues impacting our clients. This provides better insight and analytic to our engineers, operations staff and product owners. We are using a diverse set of technologies - both home grown and open source - to collect, analyze, distribute, persist and present vast amount of application and infrastructure metrics data. This provides us a clear picture of what our systems are doing and their health and who needs to be notified when issues arise.

Who are you?



A full stack engineer, comfortable working with both UI and backend across different technologies. You're self-motivated and have the aptitude and desire to learn new things.

You need to have:

  • Proficiency in Object-Oriented programming languages (eg. C++ or Java)
  • 3+ years of experience with building distributed systems
  • A high level of competency with a modern scripting language (eg. Python or Javascript)


We'd love to see:

  • Experience using open source distributed (and related) technologies such as Kafka, Hadoop, HBase, OpenTSDB, Parquet, Postgres, etc.
  • Experience with large-scale data, analytics, data science or machine learning applications


Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

title: Django Engineer (m/w) at RegioHelden GmbH (Stuttgart, Germany)
description:
Heroic deeds


As an engineering hero you will participate in all phases of the software development cycle from product definition and design through implementation, documentation and training.


You will work collaboratively with other engineers and must be open to take on any technical tasks that contribute to the goals of the team and the company.


Heroic tasks & responsibilities



  • Continuously develop our intranet and workflow management system

  • Develop and improve our tools for business process automation and workflow optimization

  • Train employees on internal tools and systems

  • Develop superhero gadgets to supercharge our products

  • Be involved in technical decisions

description:
Requisition 37517

About ZapLabs LLC
ZapLabs (www.zaplabs.com) is the innovation and technology hub for global real estate leader Realogy Holdings Corp. (NYSE: RLGY), and the driving force behind inventive technology for brokers and agents affiliated with Realogys world renowned real estate brands. ZapLabs delivers its highly effective consumer, sales associate and broker solutions in support of Realogys leading franchise brands and is positioned to expand the scope of its technology development efforts to encompass Realogys other business segments, including residential brokerage, relocation and settlement services. ZapLabs is headquartered in Emeryville, California.

Job Title: Java Engineer

At ZapLabs, we work to build and improve a platform that helps real estate professionals work effectively, and helps delight home buyers and sellers with an excellent experience. We do that by combining great technology with great people and were looking for a Java Engineer to join our team.

What were looking for:

Youre a motivated java engineer with some solid experience, and youre ready to take your skills to the next level. You know your way around Java, Spring, Hibernate, and other new back-end technologies, and youve got experience developing micro services solutions. You can work independently without a hitch, but you also thrive in a collaborative, team-oriented environment. Youll bring your passion for writing efficient, maintainable, and reusable code plus your unwavering commitment to quality, efficiently-architected services. And of course, youre eager to learn even more.

What youll do:

At ZapLabs, youll play a key role in delivering quality products that make life easier for our agents, brokers, home buyers, and sellers. Youll turn requirements into clean, scalable, and efficient back-end services. Youll work with ZapLabs java engineering, front-end engineering, product management, and QA teams on a daily basis to design, test, and deliver first-rate, functional software. Youll learn a little something new everyday and thats something you look forward to.

Skills, accomplishments, interests you should have:

  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field
  • 3 or more years of relevant experience
  • Experience working within a software development team
  • Proficiency in developing Spring- and Hibernate-based web applications
  • Hands-on experience in developing micro services solutions
  • Ability to work quickly with an eye towards writing clean, efficient, reusable code
  • Ability to build prototypes for new features that will delight our users and are consistent with business goals
  • Iterate quickly in an agile development process
  • Refactor early and often to continuously improve code quality
  • Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit

Nice to haves:

  • Knowledge of Unix, preferably Linux
  • Extensive LOTR or Star Wars knowledge

title: Maps Search Principal/Architect at Apple Inc. (Cupertino, CA)
description:
Apple Maps powers many applications that are making a huge impact to daily lives of millions of users every single day. You can play a big part in the next revolution in local search in a high-performing and collaborative team with a single mission to surprise and delight users with the worlds best search experience not found anywhere else. You will have plenty of opportunities to create groundbreaking technology for large scale systems, big data, cutting-edge search ranking and relevance, artificial intelligence and more. If you have significant background in machine learning and/or search technology, please consider joining the Maps Search and Machine Learning team at Apple.

Key Qualifications:
We are looking for a principal engineer/architect to join the Maps Search team and provide technical expertise and leadership as we solve the next generation of local search problems. You will be responsible for figuring out architecture and design for core problems in search such as query interpretation, ranking, retrieval and improving a scaleable search platform. You will help mentor a strong team of engineers and scientists. You will work across Maps and the rest of Apple to power user-delighting experiences based on local search services.
Key Qualifications
Expertise and experience in various facets of machine learning and natural language processing, such as classification, feature engineering, information extraction, structured prediction, clustering, semi-supervised learning, topic modeling and ranking
Desire to solve challenging problems at the intersection of user experience and computational algorithms
Experience in search, ads or recommender systems.
Hard working, self-starter with proven ability to manage multiple projects to strict deadlines. Excellent written and oral communication skills and ability to interact with all levels of researchers and engineers

Description:
The goal of the Maps Search team is to take Apples Maps to the next level of intelligence and accuracy using advanced statistical techniques. Engineers and scientists on this team work on a wide spectrum of approaches to improve the search experience on Apple Maps. You would work on core machine learning algorithms and models that help improve search relevance and experience. You would also work on designing and architecting scalable infrastructure that allow the rest of the team of engineers and scientists to develop, test, debug and release algorithms, models and features quickly. We impact many users around the world by developing a phenomenal product with a prime focus on accuracy, understandability and performance of the product.

Education:
BS in Computer Science or related field. MS is a plus.

Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

title: Graphics Programmer at Sucker Punch Productions (Bellevue, WA)
description:
Looking for a Graphics Programmer to join our ranks! Our talented artists generate gigabytes of raw creativity, and you’ll be pivotal in bringing that creativity to life in a spectacular game. The graphics quality is a big focus at Sucker Punch, and the results are easy to see: our games look gorgeous, our lighting accentuates our art, and our colors highlight our mood. Come join us, add your talent to our team, and help us make something great even better.

Sucker Punch fosters a healthy company culture, crucial to creating a productive and collaborative work environment. Here you will participate, interact, voice your ideas, and be a key part of something awesome.


Responsibilities



  • Design and develop new features in our graphics engine, from user input to beautiful pixels.

  • Analyze and enhance existing features, and support the artists and designers using them.

  • Keep up to date with the latest developments and research in graphics programming, and look for opportunities to apply this knowledge on our engine.

title: Software Architect for vehicle-data-based services (m/f) (107513) at BMW Group (München, Deutschland)
description:
THE SOURCE CODE TO THE FUTURE IS DEVELOPED HERE.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR DEVELOPING SOFTWARE.


To revolutionise the future of mobility, one has to go ahead and set standards today. Intelligent technologies that are increasingly taking over driving tasks and providing greater safety and comfort are already in use in our vehicles. Increasing our lead in autonomous driving will need visionary thinkers and creative developers. Specialists in the fields of machine learning, artificial intelligence, sensor technology and software development will work in expert teams, in centres centres of excellence networked around the world, to redefine the limits of what is possible.


Software Architect for vehicle-data-based services (m/w)
Job reference: 107513


We are offering you an interesting position at the BMW Group as a Software Architect (m/w) in the field of vehicle-data-based services. Digitalisation will dominate the future development of new automobiles. The use of vehicle sensor data and swarm intelligence of a networked fleet as well as the high-performance, efficient processing and aggregation of data in back end systems form the basis for new customer functions. In this, a special role is played by geospatial data, as the streets and their environments constitute the space in which vehicles move about. As part of your activities, you will develop and validate the smooth functioning of our vehicles. As a Software Architect, you will work out and assess appropriate functions in a scrum team and contrive technical solutions that are implemented and put into operation in close collaboration with the team. Furthermore, you will develop highly scalable systems that can deal with hundreds of thousands of vehicles. Your interesting range of tasks will be topped off by the coordination with interface partners and ensuring the embedding into existing system architectures and environments.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

title: Data Scientist - Experimentation at eBay (San Jose, CA)
description:
Primary Job Responsibilities: 

Experimentation is a key enabler for innovation at eBay and plays a critical role in improving buyer & seller experience. Our experimentation capabilities are world class and we continue to enhance it to stay ahead of the ecommerce trends. The team is looking for a Data Scientist, Experimentation Science to help improve the sensitivity of the financial metrics used in experimentation program by application of complex statistical techniques such as Modeling/Machine Learning, Bayesian Structural models, Clustering, Regression techniques, Time series etc.





Key Responsibilities:


  • Working towards implementing various cutting-edge statistical tools and techniques in Multichannel Experimentation and their frequent enhancements.

  • Collaborate closely with principal statisticians in the larger team to scale algorithms and launch high-availability experimentation data-science services

  • Lead research on multivariate statistical methods, quasi-experimental research designs (regression adjustment, stratification), longitudinal analysis, random effect models, evaluating applicability of improved experimental design and measurement techniques to help guide product owners with appropriate approach for A/B testing their products.

  • With the aid of modeling techniques and statistical software - analyze, extract key insights from model outputs and interpret statistical results and communicate findings to the stakeholders (product owners). Use machine learning techniques to create scalable solutions for various business problems related to experimentation.

  • New feature / business performance metric development, derived variable creation, using advanced variable transformation techniques also evaluation of their information value.

  • Variance estimation of complex business metrics (ratio-metrics / continuous), handling issues with heavy-tailed distributions and extreme values. Use cutting edge resampling techniques such as – bootstrapping / jack-knife.

  • Using concepts like factor analysis, principal component analysis to identify minimal set (variable reduction) of key features of a model.

  • Applying Bayesian statistics, Adaptive/Sequential learning for experimentation.

  • Detect heterogeneous treatment effects in A/B tests, conceptualize and perform clustering algorithms, regression adjustments, post-stratification etc.

  • Design, development and evaluation of highly innovative models for predictive learning and sensitivity improvement in experimentation & measurements.

  • Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes and data pipelines for large scale data analyses, A/B testing and related model development.


 

Additional Job Description

The role is data-intensive and hence the successful candidates should be extremely comfortable working with large sets of data and deliver business insights from the data using analytical techniques. The successful candidates should also be able to offer a strategic perspective, sound business judgment, and be able to work collaboratively / cross-functionally with multiple teams, located in different geographies. He will possess strong intellectual curiosity, and a passion for achieving practical business impact.

 

Successful candidates should also demonstrate:


  • Ability to take initiatives and drive work

  • Hands-on approach to data analysis, with attention to detail and quality

  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, in dealing with people at all levels of the organization

  • Exceptional business judgment and quantitative analytic capability

  • Experience in distilling and presenting complex quantitative analysis to business users

  • Intellectual curiosity, passion for problem-solving, and comfort with ambiguity

  • High energy and a desire to work in a results-oriented, fast growth environment

  • Ability to thrive in a cross-functional environment while juggling multiple responsibilities

  • A passion for understanding and serving the unique community of eBay

  • Strong academic profile with an emphasis on quantitative coursework




Qualifications/ Skill Set:


  • PhD/MS Degree in Statistics/ Mathematics or a quantitative field (Engineering / Computer Science/ Economics)

  • Knowledge of databases and scripting languages like - SQL/Hive, data processing framework, data mining (structured and unstructured data)

  • Hands on experience with statistical tools like: R, Python

  • Prior experience on Regression techniques/modeling, Optimization techniques, Bayesian statistics, Bias-variance analysis, Sample size estimation, Cluster Analysis etc.

  • An ideal candidate will possess analytical skills in mathematical formulation, modeling algorithm development.

  • 2-5+ years of relevant experience, preferably in business consulting, ecommerce or financial services

  • Experience in web or social analytics is preferred

title: Frontend Web Developer (m/f) at Mimi Hearing Technologies GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:

Mimi Hearing Technologies, founded in 2014 in Berlin, is one of the most promising startups in the mHealth / sound space. We develop tools for people to explore their hearing health and enjoy a unique listening experience - we strive to be the forefront of sound innovation.

Our vision is to set a new standard for the way we listen and become the #1 technology for personalized sound and hearing health.

We are committed to create a culture which nourishes personal growth as the base for company growth. We are a learning organisation which means, we love to work with people who start doing things, fail and learn fast in order to keep moving instead of waiting and drafting the perfect solutions.



As our Frontend Web Developer you will:

Sounds like you?
Please send an email with your CV and motivational letter (both as PDFs) to jobs@mimi.io

title: High Performance Computing Assistant Linux Systems Administrator at University of California, Irvine (Irvine, CA)
description:
As part of the UCI Research Cyber Infrastructure Center within the Office of Information Technology, the incumbent will provide Linux-based system administration support for the HPC 'condo' computing cluster in support of campus Research Cyber Infrastructure (RCI) efforts. Taking assignments from the Lead HPC Architect and other system administrators, the incumbent will provide system administration services such as operating system support, software installation, patching, maintenance, file system support and monitoring, user support, monitoring of user communications, simple hardware support and hardware problem troubleshooting, and inter-cluster networking support. The incumbent also provides monitoring services for computational, storage, and networking sub-systems of the cluster and logistical support of the physical infrastructure of the cluster including interaction with OIT Data Center staff, vendor relations, RMA support, and inventory control.


This position is a junior level system administration role where the incumbent will learn a large set of high performance computing skills while developing their Linux, storage system, system programming, research user support skills, hardware support skills, within an exciting university research environment. The incumbent will work with highly skilled and experienced world-class experts in high performance computing, Peta-byte sized storage systems, and high performance local and wide-area networking systems. A proven ability to learn and an in-depth interest in HPC are the main requirements for the position.


To view the complete job description and apply, please use this link:


High Performance Computing Assistant Linux System Administrator


or visit http://jobs.uci.edu and search for job number 2017-0131


The University of California is one of the largest public university systems in the country, comprising 10 campuses, a combined student body of 238,700 students, 62,400 academics, 135,900 staff members and over 1.6 million living alumni.


We invite you to join our dynamic team of nearly 350 IT service professionals in the University of California, Irvine (UCI) Office of Information Technology (OIT). OIT is the central IT organization that provides the majority of the campus IT services. We take pride in providing robust IT services to the campus community (students, faculty, and staff) that support the educational and research mission of the university. Explore working at OIT here: www.oit.uci.edu/org/jobs/career Some of the many advantages of working in the IT environment at UCI include:



  • Exceptional benefits including health/wellness insurance programs with low associated premium costs

  • A minimum of 3 weeks accrued vacation, 13 paid holidays, and accrued sick days

  • UC Retirement Program, including a traditional pension plan

  • Excellent work/life balance

  • Supportive management and co-workers

  • Opportunities to work with new technology

  • A positive reputation with the people we serve


The University of California, Irvine is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer advancing inclusive excellence. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or other protected categories covered by the UC nondiscrimination policy at http://policy.ucop.edu/doc/4000376.

description:

title: Software Engineer - Portfolio Analytics at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
description:
Job Requisition Number:56373



Portfolio Analytics (PORT) provides critical intraday, historical, and forward-looking risk analytics to our clients so they can make investment decisions. Our highly scalable system processes billions of data points and complex calculations each day. The scale of our product imposes technical challenges around stringent availability, throughput, and responsiveness metrics.

Portfolio Managers use our quantitative computing tools to understand the performance of their historical portfolio, monitor the impact of intraday market movements, and estimate the projected losses under extreme market conditions. Our system is a critical tool for money managers, mutual funds, hedge funds, and pension funds.

To keep pace with the tremendous growth of our product, we're constantly looking for ways to improve using new technologies. Our goal right now is to prepare our system to serve 10x the load it is capable of today. In order to achieve this we are using technologies such as redis, Elasticsearch, Apache Spark, Cassandra, and Hadoop/HBase. If you're interested in high performance distributed systems, a modern software code base and are looking to build new products using latest technology, we want you on our team.

You need to have:

  • 2+ years of experience with object-oriented programming such as C++, C# or Java
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of data structures, object oriented design and systems/applications programming
  • Strong problem solving skills


We'd love to see:

  • Experience with multithreading
  • Familiarity with SQL, Python and JavaScript
  • Experience with high volume, high availability distributed systems
  • Interest in the financial markets


Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

title: Practice Lead - Back-end Engineering at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
description:
Backend Engineering Practice Lead @ Zalando

Zalando Technology introduced a new shared leadership model within its organizational approach "Radical Agility". As a Backend Engineering Practice Lead you will partner with Delivery Leads to coach and empower individuals working in autonomous teams along the path of innovation and delivery of high quality, state of the art software.

Working one on one with backend engineers, you develop relationships built on trust and act as a coach for each of your directs; aligning their individual motivation, growth and goals with those of Zalando Tech. Your mission is to set the bar for engineers at Zalando and work directly with them on their journey to Mastery.

Your Challenges

  • In collaboration with Delivery Leads and Software Architects ensure that Zalando's backend engineering standards and performance expectations are met by your directs.
  • Coach and mentor individuals, to raise the performance bar for backend engineers working in autonomous delivery teams.
  • Inspire and encourage individuals to grow their skills and capabilities through discovering and following their passion and purpose.
  • Act as a key contributor in developing Zalando Tech's overall technical capabilities by aligning individual purpose with company and team purpose
  • Conduct regular performance assessments
  • Develop and evangelize great engineering practices and a strong feedback culture across all of Zalando Tech.
  • Work with recruiting team to attract, onboard, and retain diverse top talent.
  • Cultivate a culture of ownership, autonomy, mastery, innovation, and purpose




Your Profile

  • You hold a degree in Computer Science or have equivalent experience as a software engineer.
  • You have 5-10 years of direct experience and a ton of passion for back-end technologies.
  • You can lead, coach and mentor software engineers, team and collaborate with other leaders.
  • Preferably, you have solid experience from working in an agile development environment.
  • You are passionate about developing and growing people.
  • You communicate with empathy, influence and inspiration.
  • You deal with and resolve conflicts in a graceful manner.


What You Can Expect:



Our recipe for success: think big and act fast. Your work today will affect millions of customers tomorrow. At Zalando, you'll have the chance to help develop the world's best online fashion experience in a rapidly growing, international company!
  • Zalando offers you a fast moving and agile working environment where you will be continuously challenged with new opportunities.
  • A highly motivated international team of colleagues that inspires and supports you.
  • Training and further development opportunities to expand your skills and help you achieve your aspirations.
  • A corporate culture where your skills are assessed by your contributions - our motto: wear sneakers, not ties!
  • Attractive employee discounts for our online shop.


About Us



Thanks to our eCommerce expertise and can-do spirit we've become one of Europe's most favorable online shopping destinations in only a few short years. Today, Zalando operates in 15 countries. The core of our business is to be cutting edge in each and every of our fundamental pillars: fashion, information technology and logistics. Zalando SE, which is based in Berlin, operates the international business and takes care of our business development, comprising of management, marketing, IT and administration.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!



If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Manjuri Sinha.

title: Software Engineer - Trading Systems at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
description:
Job Requisition Number:56372



Trading Systems empowers the biggest players in the financial world to manage their portfolios, execute and settle their trades, and make decisions that move the markets. Trillions of dollars pass through our systems on a daily basis so our applications need to be fast, accurate and scalable. Our integrated platforms interact with a number of agencies and governments around the world, and we use the best technology the industry offers to build them.

We are full stack engineers who specialize in everything from the UX to server-side development and are always looking for new ways to make our products better. As engineers, we live at the intersection of technology and finance, so you'll have the opportunity to learn about the financial markets and suggest new ways we can lead the industry.

As an engineer in Trading Systems, you'll be able to lead projects, partner with the business and meet clients to understand their workflows. We work primarily in C++, but we believe a smart engineer can learn any language with some ramp up time. If you're from a different OO background but you're willing to learn C++, we still want you to apply. We have opportunities in all phases of the SDLC, so if you want to make an immediate impact and work on the financial world's toughest technical challenges, apply today.

You need to have:

  • 2+ years of experience with object-oriented programming such as C++, C# or Java
  • Strong problem solving skills


We'd love to see:

  • Experience with multithreading
  • Familiarity with SQL, Python and JavaScript

title: Cloud Systems Developer m/f - Implementing innovative solutions on AWS and Azure at Cloudreach Ltd (Munich, Germany)
description:
Big dreams often start small. From an idea in a London pub, we have grown into a global cloud enabler which operates across 7 countries and speak 30 languages.

Our mission at Cloudreach is to "enable innovation". We do this by helping enterprise customers adopt and harness the power of cloud computing. We believe that the growth of a great business can only be fuelled by great people, so join us in our partnership with AWS, Microsoft and Salesforce and help us build one of the most disruptive companies in the cloud industry. It's not your average job, because Cloudreach is not your average company.

Overlooking Munich, our office is located on the 8th floor of a modern and light building, a short stroll away from Hirschgarten. How about a view of the Alps from your Cloudy Hub ?

What does the Cloud Enablement team do ?

The Cloud Enablement team is responsible for implementing innovative solutions for major clients who are moving to cloud platforms, built principally within Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure.

How will you spend your days ?



  • Adventures in developing cloud-native distributed systems, container orchestration platforms, microservice and serverless architectures, and immutable infrastructure delivery.

  • Orchestration and automation of build and deployment processes, continuous integration and application configuration management.

  • Using automation and configuration management tooling to ensure compliance and ongoing operation of large estates.

  • Migrations of legacy workloads to transform and shape them into dynamic, resilient and scalable platforms -- helping clients to make the most of the cloud.

  • Working with reputable clients and stakeholders to identify requirements and take these from design through to build and beyond.




What kind of career progression can you expect ?



  • You can grow into a Systems Developer Lead, a Cloud Architect or a Cloud Consultant.

  • There are opportunities for relocation in our other cloudy hubs.




How to stand out ?



  • Passion and enthusiasm for technology and its adoption.

  • A degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a similar STEM subject.

  • Software development experience and/or automation in Python, Ruby, or Go -- but talk to us if you love to hack in any language.

  • Experience with cloud ecosystems, from requirements analysis all the way to operations.

  • You automate everything where sensible. If you had 10 servers, you wouldn't update each one manually, right?

  • Systems administration skills -- you'll probably prefer a command line to a GUI.

  • Fluent in German and very good english level.




What are our cloudy perks?



  • MacBook Pro, big screen monitor, personal Google Apps domain and new smartphone (you will have to choose between Galaxy or iPhone - make the right choice !)

  • Unique 'cloudy' culture: our people are diverse, passionate and easy to work with.

  • Enjoy our uncapped holiday policy and your birthday off.

  • Cloudy University: our continuous learning platform that will provide training and career development opportunities.

  • Meal vouchers and "Cloudy Lunch" where every Friday we take over a local restaurant. Enjoy, it's on us !

  • Discount on private healthcare scheme and gym membership. Stakeholder pension with shared employee and employer contribution.

  • We kick-off every new financial year by getting together in a cool destination in Europe.

title: Robotics Engineer (m/f) (108682) at BMW Group (München, Deutschland)
description:
CREATIVE INTELLIGENCE IS THE KEY TO ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR MACHINE LEARNING.


To revolutionise the future of mobility, one has to go ahead and set standards today. Intelligent technologies that are increasingly taking over driving tasks and providing greater safety and comfort are already in use in our vehicles. Increasing our lead in autonomous driving will need visionary thinkers and creative developers. Specialists in the fields of machine learning, artificial intelligence, sensor technology and software development will work in expert teams, in centres centers of excellence networked around the world, to redefine the limits of what is possible.


Robotics Engineer (m/f)
Job reference: 108682


We are offering an exciting role as a (Senior) Robotics Engineer (m/f) in the field of artificial intelligence for automated vehicles. Based on your sound knowledge in the fields of motion planning, decision-making or autonomous systems, you will work independently to develop new concepts, implement them and evaluate them in simulation tests as well as during testing under real conditions.

Furthermore, your tasks will include the implementation of development tools for the effective simulation and testing of your algorithms. Implementation will largely be in C ++ so that in-depth knowledge of this programming language is required. You will ideally also have development experience using Linux and ROS.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then apply online at http://bmw.jobs/autonomousdriving and join our team. You can find out more about us as an employer, our entry programmes and other job opportunities under www.bmwgroup.com/careers

title: Windows Developer (Senior) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
description:
The opportunity



As a Windows Phone software engineer at Zalando, you will design, build and implement award-winning apps used and enjoyed by millions of people. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we evolve into a "mobile first" company. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others' projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand--while receiving meaningful support at every step.

What we are looking for

  • A degree in Computer Science and/or at least 2 years of programming experience in C# and .Net
  • Demonstrated experience creating WPF, Windows Phone 8, Windows Phone 8.1, Windows Phone 10 or Windows Universal apps
  • Good knowledge of MVVM pattern, XAML, as well as Windows RT platform and Silverlight frameworks
  • At least one live Windows Phone, Universal or Windows RT app on Windows Store
  • Demonstrated experience producing object-oriented, structured, readable and testable code
  • A solid grounding in software design and architecture and RESTful web services
  • Experience using modern version control systems such as git and SVN
  • Experience using build management tools (e.g. Maven) and continuous integration systems (e.g. Jenkins)
  • An attitude of accountability and team spirit-you enjoy reviewing others' code and sharing your knowledge
  • Excellent communication skills--you can spar with engineers, product owners and other stakeholders
  • English language fluency


Your responsibilities

  • Follow agile methodologies to continuously improve our Windows app
  • Help our team to develop amazing user experiences for mobile
  • Identify and share your knowledge of state-of-the-art technologies that will help us innovate faster


What you can expect from us

  • One-month mentoring program
  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical "People Leads" who help you achieve mastery
  • Personal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to industry networking Community: hack weeks, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more
  • Competitive salary
  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount
  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando



Zalando is Europe's leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast - with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams - and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It's how we grow.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!



If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Maria Ulbrich.

title: DevOps Engineer (Junior) at Lenovo (Carmel, IN) (allows remote)
description:
Lenovo is looking for a qualified person to fill a junior DevOps Engineer role.  As a DevOps Engineer, your primary responsibility will be helping architect and implement automated systems for testing and deploying code. You will also be responsible for ensuring that the Lenovo Software AWS infrastructure remains available at all times and scales gracefully as load increases.


Lenovo Software leverages many leading-edge development and DevOps technologies, including AngularJS, Node.js, Firebase, AWS, Travis CI and Docker, among others. We are looking for a unique individual who has a development and operations background.  The individual should have an automation mindset with 2-5 years of development and cloud security experience. 


Responsibilities



  • Maintain and improve continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) processes.

  • Maintain, improve, and document AWS infrastructure.

  • Develop best practices for building, deploying, monitoring, and auto scaling JavaScript applications.

title: Ruby on Rails Developer at LevelUp (Boston, MA)
description:
When they aren’t building our developer sandbox, creating V.2 of LevelUp analytics, working to optimize our payment processing, or designing time-based advertising campaigns for our merchants, our Rails engineers are thinking of innovative and epic ways to make LevelUp even better.


Curious about current projects?


Here are some of the challenges that drive development for the Platform team:


- How can we empower businesses to excite and reward their customers in new ways?


- What interesting things can we do with SKU-level data when a user places an order?


- Why should businesses keep using LevelUp or run more campaigns? How can we help them reach those conclusions more easily?


- Who might want to build on top of our platform and how can we make sure our API supports their needs?


- When will our system reach its breaking point? What must be done now to push back that date?
